This yellow sheet cake with chocolate fudge frosting is the only yellow cake recipe you'll ever need.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "yellow sheet cake, yellow cake with chocolate frosting", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/05/quarter-sheet-yellow-cake-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/05/quarter-sheet-yellow-cake-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/05/quarter-sheet-yellow-cake-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/05/quarter-sheet-yellow-cake.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/yellow-sheet-cake-chocolate-fudge-frosting/", "recipeIngredient": ["2 and 1/4 cups (266g) cake flour\u00a0(spooned &amp; leveled)", "2 and 1/2 teaspoons baking powder", "1/4 teaspoon baking soda", "1/2 teaspoon salt", "1 cup (16 Tbsp; 226g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "1 and 1/2 cups (300g) granulated sugar", "2 large eggs, at room temperature", "2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract", "1/2 cup (120g) sour cream, at room temperature*", "1 cup (240ml) whole milk, at room temperature*", "1 cup (16 Tbsp; 226g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "4 and 1/2 cups (540g) confectioners&#8217; sugar", "3/4 cup (62g) natural unsweetened or dutch-process cocoa powder", "1/2 cup (120ml) whole milk", "1 Tablespoon light corn syrup*", "1 and 1/2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract", "1/8 teaspoon salt", "optional: rainbow sprinkles"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Generously grease and lightly flour a 12&#215;17-inch half sheet pan or a 9&#215;13-inch quarter sheet pan. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/yellow-sheet-cake-chocolate-fudge-frosting/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the cake flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together in a large bowl. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/yellow-sheet-cake-chocolate-fudge-frosting/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter and sugar together on high speed for 3 full minutes. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a silicone spatula as needed. Turn the mixer down to medium-high speed and beat in the eggs and vanilla extract until combined. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl as needed. Beat in the sour cream.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/yellow-sheet-cake-chocolate-fudge-frosting/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add 1/2 of the cake flour mixture/dry ingredients and 1/2 of the milk and beat on low speed until combined. Add the remaining dry ingredients and milk and beat on low speed until combined. Do not overmix this batter. The batter will be smooth, velvety, and slightly thick. You may need to whisk it all by hand to make sure there are no lumps at the bottom of the bowl.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/yellow-sheet-cake-chocolate-fudge-frosting/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Spread the cake batter into the prepared pan. Smooth it out into a thin, even layer. For a 12&#215;17-inch sheet cake, bake for 20-22 minutes or until the top is lightly browned and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. For a 9&#215;13-inch sheet cake, bake for 36-40 minutes or until the top is lightly browned and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. With either size, make sure you rotate the cake pan once or twice during bake time.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/yellow-sheet-cake-chocolate-fudge-frosting/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove from the oven and allow the cake to cool in the pan placed on a wire rack. Using a fine mesh strainer, sift the confectioners&#8217; sugar and cocoa together. Add the sugar/cocoa mixture to the butter, then beat on low speed for 20 seconds. Stop the mixer, then add the milk, corn syrup, vanilla, and salt. Beat on medium-high speed for 2 minutes. Allow to cool.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/very-vanilla-cupcakes/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To make the frosting, beat softened butter on medium speed with an electric or stand mixer. Beat for about 3 minutes until smooth and creamy. Add confectioners&#8217;\u00a0sugar, cream, vanilla extract, and vanilla bean seeds with the mixer running. Increase to high speed and beat for 3 minutes. Add more powdered sugar if frosting is too thin or more cream if mixture is too thick. Add salt if frosting is too sweet (1/4 teaspoon). Frost cooled cupcakes (I used Wilton 1M piping tip). Then, dip in egg and let any excess drip off. Then generously roll in the coconut mixture, shaking off any excess. Pour into a 9-inch springform pan or 10-inch springform pan and pack in very tightly. The tighter it&#8217;s packed, the less likely it will fall apart when cutting the cheesecake. I recommend using the bottom of a measuring cup to pack it into the bottom and up the sides. You can watch me do this in the video above. Freeze for 10\u201320 minutes as you prepare the filling.", "name": "Make the crust", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/no-bake-cheesecake/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a hand mixer or a stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment, whip the cold heavy cream into stiff peaks on medium-high speed, about 4\u20135 minutes. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a silicone spatula as needed. Add the confectioners&#8217; sugar, sour cream, lemon juice, and vanilla extract. Beat for 2\u20133 minutes on medium-high speed until smooth and combined. Make sure there are no large lumps of cream cheese. If there are lumps, keep beating until smooth.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/no-bake-cheesecake/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using your mixer on low speed or a silicone spatula, fold the whipped cream into the cheesecake filling until combined. This takes several turns of your silicone spatula. Combine slowly as you don&#8217;t want to deflate all the air in the whipped cream.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/no-bake-cheesecake/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove crust from the freezer and spread filling into crust. Make pie dough the night before because it needs to chill in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours before rolling out (step 3).", "name": "Pie crust", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/brown-sugar-sweet-potato-pie/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "\u00a0Place sweet potatoes in a large saucepan. Cover them with water, then bring to a boil on the stovetop. Boil for 45-50 minutes, or until super soft. During this time, begin step 3.", "name": "As the pie dough chills, start the sweet potatoes", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/brown-sugar-sweet-potato-pie/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "On a floured work surface, roll out one of the discs of chilled dough (use the 2nd pie crust for another recipe or freeze). Turn the dough about a quarter turn after every few rolls until you have a circle 12 inches in diameter. Carefully place the dough into a 9-inch pie dish. Tuck it in with your fingers, making sure it is completely smooth. To make a lovely thick edge, I do not trim excess dough around the edges. Instead, fold the excess dough back over the edge and use your hands to mold the edge into a nice thick rim around the pie. Crimp or flute the pie crust edges. Brush edges with egg wash. Chill the dough in the refrigerator or freezer for at least 15 minutes as you work on the filling\u2014this helps prevent the crust from shrinking.", "name": "Roll out the chilled pie dough", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/brown-sugar-sweet-potato-pie/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C).", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/brown-sugar-sweet-potato-pie/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Drain the boiling water and run the potatoes under very cold water. The skin should peel off easily at this point. Cool for a few minutes until easy to handle. Slice the potatoes into a couple large chunks, then place into a mixing bowl.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/brown-sugar-sweet-potato-pie/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle or whisk attachment (or you can use a blender for this), beat/blend the potatoes on medium-high speed until smooth. Add the remaining filling ingredients (down to and including the salt) and beat/blend on high speed until smooth and combined. Spread filling into prepared pie crust.", "name": "For the filling", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/brown-sugar-sweet-potato-pie/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for 55-60 minutes or until the center of the pie is only slightly jiggly. A toothpick inserted into the center of the pie should come out *mostly* clean. During bake time, if you find the edges of the pie crust are browning too quickly, apply a\u00a0pie crust shield or a ring of aluminum foil to protect it. Remove finished pie from the oven. Place on a wire rack to cool completely or for at least 2 hours. The pie filling will sink and set as it cools. Decorate with whipped cream or pie crust acorns (see note).", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/brown-sugar-sweet-potato-pie/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover leftovers tightly and store in the refrigerator for up to 5 days.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/brown-sugar-sweet-potato-pie/#instruction-step-8"}], "prepTime": "PT3H30M", "cookTime": "PT1H", "totalTime": "PT7H", "recipeYield": ["9", "one 9-inch pie"], "recipeCategory": "Pie", "cookingMethod": "Baking", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "39", "ratingValue": "4.9"}, "video": {"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "VideoObject", "name": "Brown Sugar Sweet Potato Pie | Sally's Baking Addiction", "description": "This homemade sweet potato pie is sweetened solely with dark brown sugar and flavored with warm fall spices, so you already know it\u2019s good! Both toppings are completely optional if you prefer plain cranberry orange muffins. Try them with homemade cinnamon butter!", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "cranberry orange muffins", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/cranberry-and-orange-muffins-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/cranberry-and-orange-muffins-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/cranberry-and-orange-muffins-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/cranberry-and-orange-muffins.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cranberry-orange-muffins/", "recipeIngredient": ["1/3 cup (67g) packed light or dark brown sugar", "1 Tablespoon (15g) granulated sugar", "1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon", "1/4 cup (4 Tbsp; 56g) unsalted butter, melted", "2/3 cup (83g) all-purpose flour (spooned &amp; leveled)", "1 and 3/4 cups (219g) all-purpose flour (spooned &amp; leveled)", "1 teaspoon baking soda", "1 teaspoon baking powder", "1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon", "1/2 teaspoon salt", "1/2 cup (8 Tbsp; 113g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "1/2 cup (100g) granulated sugar", "1/4 cup (50g) packed light or dark brown sugar", "1 Tablespoon orange zest (from about 2 oranges)", "2 large eggs, at room temperature", "1/2 cup (120g) plain yogurt or sour cream, at room temperature*", "2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract", "2 Tablespoons (30ml) fresh orange juice", "2 Tablespoons (30ml) milk (any kind), at room temperature", "1 and 1/2 cups (185g) fresh or frozen cranberries\u00a0(do not thaw)", "optional: coarse sparkling sugar, for sprinkling on top (if not using crumb topping)", "1 cup (120g) confectioners&#8217; sugar", "2 Tablespoons (30ml) fresh orange juice"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 425\u00b0F (218\u00b0C). Spray a 12-count muffin pan with nonstick spray or line with cupcake liners. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cranberry-orange-muffins/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Mix the brown sugar, granulated sugar, cinnamon, and melted butter together in a small bowl until combined. Add the flour and use a fork to gently mix until crumbs form. Don&#8217;t over-mix into a paste. Just mix until it is crumbly. Place in the refrigerator while you make the muffin batter. Cold crumbs hold shape better when baking.", "name": "Make the crumb topping", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cranberry-orange-muffins/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the flour, baking soda, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt together in a medium bowl. Set aside.", "name": "Make the muffins:\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cranberry-orange-muffins/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar together on high speed until smooth and creamy, about 3 minutes. Scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed. (Here\u2019s a helpful tutorial if you need guidance on\u00a0how to cream butter and sugar.) Add the orange zest and beat on medium speed for 1 minute. Add the eggs, yogurt/sour cream, and vanilla, and beat for 1 minute, then turn up to high speed until the mixture is combined and mostly creamy. (It&#8217;s ok if it appears somewhat curdled.) Scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cranberry-orange-muffins/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "With the mixer on low speed, add the dry ingredients, orange juice, and milk, and beat until no flour pockets remain. Gently fold in the cranberries. Avoid over-mixing. Batter is thick.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cranberry-orange-muffins/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Spoon the batter into prepared muffin cups, filling them all the way to the top. Spoon crumb topping on each, gently pressing it down so it sticks. If not using crumb topping, sprinkle muffins evenly with coarse sugar.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cranberry-orange-muffins/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for 5 minutes at 425\u00b0F; then, without opening the oven, reduce the oven temperature to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Bake for an additional 16\u201319 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. The total time these muffins take in the oven is about 21\u201324 minutes. (Usually closer to 21 minutes if you&#8217;re skipping the crumb topping.)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cranberry-orange-muffins/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Allow the muffins to cool for 5 minutes in the muffin pan, then transfer to a wire rack to continue cooling. Pour in the water and olive oil and stir with a wooden spoon or silicone spatula until the dough comes together in a clump.\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/homemade-artisan-crackers/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured work surface. Return the dough to the bowl and cover the bowl with plastic wrap. Keep one half of the dough covered while you work with the other half.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/homemade-artisan-crackers/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "On a lightly floured work surface with a lightly floured rolling pin, roll one half of the dough out into a rectangle. Roll the dough very thin\u2014about 1/16th of an inch (1.5mm). If the dough keeps shrinking back as you try to roll it out, lightly cover it and let it rest for 5 minutes, then try again. (Don&#8217;t worry if it shrinks, that&#8217;s completely normal and expected.)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/homemade-artisan-crackers/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a ruler and a pizza cutter, cut the dough into small rectangles about 3 x 1.5 inches in size. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/iced-oatmeal-cookies/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl using a hand mixer or a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter, brown sugar, and granulated sugar together on medium-high speed until creamed, about 2 minutes.\u00a0Add the eggs, molasses, and vanilla extract and beat on high speed until combined, about 1 minute.\u00a0Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl and beat again as needed to combine.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/iced-oatmeal-cookies/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and mix on low until combined. Make pie dough the night before because it needs to chill in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours before using. (See note.)", "name": "Pie crust", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/mini-fruit-galettes/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Line two large baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone baking mats. Make sure you have enough room in your refrigerator for these baking sheets because the shaped galettes must chill in step 7.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/mini-fruit-galettes/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Gently stir the berries, cornstarch, sugar, and lemon juice/vanilla together in a medium bowl until combined. Place in the refrigerator, covered or uncovered, until step 5.", "name": "Prep the filling", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/mini-fruit-galettes/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Working with 1 chilled pie dough at a time, place the dough onto a floured work surface. Roll into a large 12-inch circle. Use your warm hands to mold any cracking edges back together as you see me doing in the video tutorial below. From the circle, cut rounds using a 5.5 or 6 inch cookie cutter. I simply use the rim of a bowl that&#8217;s about that size. Or you can use a ruler and cut circles with a sharp knife. You\u2019ll have to re-roll the dough scraps a few times. Work quickly because the dough becomes much more delicate the longer it\u2019s at room temperature. You\u2019ll get about 5 rounds per pie crust. Repeat with 2nd chilled pie dough for a total of about 10.", "name": "Shape the crusts", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/mini-fruit-galettes/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Arrange dough rounds on prepared baking sheets. Remove filling from the refrigerator and spoon about 1/4 cup into the center of each dough round, leaving any excess juice behind in the bowl. Gently and tightly fold the edges over the filling leaving the very center exposed, as you see in the photos and video tutorial. Make sure the mini galettes are tight and compact so they don&#8217;t unfold themselves or lose shape while baking.", "name": "Fill galettes", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/mini-fruit-galettes/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Brush the edges of the pie dough with milk, which helps guarantee the dough will brown. The pie holds together nicely and the homemade pie crust is phenomenal.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "strawberry rhubarb pie", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/05/strawberry-rhubarb-pie-1-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/05/strawberry-rhubarb-pie-1-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/05/strawberry-rhubarb-pie-1-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/05/strawberry-rhubarb-pie-1.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/strawberry-rhubarb-pie/", "recipeIngredient": ["homemade pie crust\u00a0(my\u00a0recipe makes 2 crusts; 1 for bottom 1 for top)", "3 cups (about 300g) sliced rhubarb\u00a0(1/2 inch pieces)", "2\u00a0and 1/2 cups (about\u00a0380g)\u00a0chopped strawberries", "1/3 cup (67g) packed light brown sugar", "1/3 cup (67g) granulated sugar", "1/4 cup (32g) cornstarch", "1/4 teaspoon salt", "1 Tablespoon (15ml) orange juice", "1/2 teaspoon pure vanilla extract", "2 Tablespoons (28g) unsalted butter, cut into small pieces", "1 large egg, lightly beaten with 1\u00a0Tablespoon (15ml) milk", "optional:\u00a0coarse sugar for garnish"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Prepare my pie crust recipe through step 5.", "name": "The crust", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/strawberry-rhubarb-pie/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "\u00a0Stir\u00a0the rhubarb, strawberries, brown sugar, granulated sugar,\u00a0cornstarch, salt,\u00a0orange\u00a0juice, and vanilla extract together in a large bowl.\u00a0Set filling aside as the oven preheats.", "name": "Make the filling", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/strawberry-rhubarb-pie/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to\u00a0400\u00b0F (204\u00b0C).", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/strawberry-rhubarb-pie/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "On a floured work surface, roll out one of the discs of chilled dough (keep the other one in the refrigerator). Turn the dough about a quarter turn after every few rolls until you have a circle 12 inches in diameter. Carefully place the dough into a 9-inch pie dish. Tuck it in with your fingers, making sure it is smooth. Spoon the filling into the crust, leaving all of the excess liquid in the bowl (you don&#8217;t want that in the filling\u2014discard it). Dot the pieces of butter on top of the filling.", "name": "Roll out the chilled pie dough", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/strawberry-rhubarb-pie/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove the other disc of chilled pie dough from the refrigerator. Roll the dough into a circle that is 12 inches diameter. Using a pastry wheel, sharp knife, or pizza cutter, cut strips 1/2- to 1-inch wide. Carefully thread the strips over and under one another, pulling back strips as necessary to weave. Press the edges of the strips into the bottom pie crust edges to seal. Use a small knife to trim off excess dough. Crimp the pie crust edges with a fork, if desired. (Alternatively, you can simply cover the filling with the 12-inch pie dough circle. Cut slits in the top to form steam vents. Trim and crimp the edges. Or a crumble or streusel topping would be great.)", "name": "Arrange\u00a0the lattice", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/strawberry-rhubarb-pie/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Lightly brush the top of the pie crust with the egg/milk mixture. Keeping the pie in the oven, turn the temperature down to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C) and bake for an additional 30-35 minutes. After the first 20 minutes of bake time, I place a pie crust shield on top of the pie to prevent the edges from browning too quickly. The pie is done when the filling&#8217;s juices are bubbling all around the edges.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/strawberry-rhubarb-pie/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Allow the pie to cool for 3\u00a0full hours at room temperature before serving. Set aside.", "name": "Make the cake", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-gingerbread-bundt-cake-with-cream-cheese-frosting/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Sift together flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, salt, ground ginger, cinnamon, cloves, and nutmeg into a medium bowl. Gently fold the flour mixture into the molasses mixture until just combined. There will be lumps remaining. Pour batter into prepared pan and bake for about 30 minutes until cake is pulling away from the sides and a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean. Set aside.", "name": "Make\u00a0the cake", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blackberry-peach-skillet-cornmeal-cake/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter and brown sugar together on high speed until smooth and creamy, about 2 minutes. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a silicone spatula as needed. Add the eggs and vanilla, then beat on medium-high speed until combined. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl as needed. With the mixer on low speed, add the dry ingredients until just incorporated. With the mixer still running on low, slowly pour in the buttermilk until combined. Do not overmix. You may need to whisk it all by hand to make sure there are no lumps at the bottom of the bowl. Finally, fold in the fruit. The batter will be slightly thick. Spread into prepared skillet. Sprinkle with coarse sugar, if desired (and an extra blackberry or two!).", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blackberry-peach-skillet-cornmeal-cake/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake the cake for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. (Light colored helps you determine when the butter begins browning.) Melt the butter over medium heat, stirring occasionally. Once melted, the butter will begin to foam. Keep stirring occasionally. After 5-6 minutes, the butter will begin browning\u2014you&#8217;ll notice lightly browned specks begin to form at the bottom of the pan and it will have a nutty aroma. You can see a visual in my How to Brown Butter post. Once browned, remove from heat immediately\u00a0and cool for 5 minutes. The butter will eventually solidify, so don&#8217;t let it sit too long. After 5 minutes, whisk in the rest of the icing ingredients until smooth. Add more confectioners&#8217; sugar for a thicker texture, if desired. Likewise, add more milk to thin out if needed.", "name": "Make the icing:\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blackberry-peach-skillet-cornmeal-cake/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Drizzle over cornmeal cake. Also wanting a very thick cookie I also added 2 tsp of cornstarch. When I formed the dough according to the directions I popped my cookie sheet in the freezer as I had to go out for over an hour. When I came home, I pre-heated my oven and my cookies baked beautifully, came out nice and thick. Everyone loved them. Next time I will have to do a double batch. I like really thick cookies."}], "datePublished": "2012-07-03", "@id": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/thick-oatmeal-raisinet-cookies/#recipe", "isPartOf": {"@id": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/thick-oatmeal-raisinet-cookies/#article"}, "mainEntityOfPage": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/thick-oatmeal-raisinet-cookies/"}]}, {"@context": "https://slickstream.com", "@graph": [{"@type": "Plugin", "version": "3.0.1"}, {"@type": "Site", "name": "Sally&#039;s Baking", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com", "description": "Trusted Recipes from a Self-Taught Baker", "atomUrl": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/feed/atom/", "rtl": false}, {"@type": "WebPage", "@id": 5929, "isFront": false, "isHome": false, "isCategory": false, "isTag": false, "isSingular": true, "date": "2012-07-03T04:58:52-04:00", "modified": "2022-03-03T18:27:32-05:00", "title": "Thick Oatmeal Raisinet Cookies", "pageType": "post", "postType": "post", "featured_image": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/07/Oatmeal-Raisinet-Cookies-121.jpg", "author": "Sally McKenney", "categories": [{"@id": 7, "parent": 710, "slug": "cookies", "name": "Cookies", "parents": [{"@type": "CategoryParent", "@id": 710, "slug": "desserts", "name": "Desserts"}]}, {"@id": 710, "parent": 0, "slug": "desserts", "name": "Desserts", "parents": []}, {"@id": 748, "parent": 7, "slug": "drop-cookies", "name": "Drop Cookies", "parents": [{"@type": "CategoryParent", "@id": 7, "slug": "cookies", "name": "Cookies"}, {"@type": "CategoryParent", "@id": 710, "slug": "desserts", "name": "Desserts"}]}, {"@id": 851, "parent": 720, "slug": "nut-free", "name": "Nut Free", "parents": [{"@type": "CategoryParent", "@id": 720, "slug": "special-diet", "name": "Special Diet"}]}], "tags": ["all-purpose flour", "brown sugar", "butter", "cinnamon", "eggs", "granulated sugar", "oats", "Raisinets", "vanilla extract"]}]}]

You can simply leave them out, with no other changes to the recipe. Or you can replace with 1 thinly sliced bell pepper. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone baking mat. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/creamy-green-bean-casserole-from-scratch/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "(While the onions bake, you can blanch the green beans\u2014step 4.) Thinly slice the onion, and separate the slices. Pour flour in one small bowl, panko + salt + pepper into a medium bowl, and whisk the egg and milk together in another small bowl. To bread the onion slices, you&#8217;ll want to use one hand for dry and one hand for wet. It helps things move a little quicker and easier. First, dip a few slices into the flour. Then into the egg mixture. And finally, give them a nice dunk into the panko and coat them well. Place onto baking sheet. Repeat with the rest of the onions. Bake onions until golden brown, about 20 minutes. Flip them twice during this time. Set them aside.", "name": "For the onions", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/creamy-green-bean-casserole-from-scratch/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Reduce oven temperature to 400\u00b0F (204\u00b0C).", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/creamy-green-bean-casserole-from-scratch/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Blanch the green beans: Bring a gallon of water and 1 Tablespoon of salt to a boil in a large saucepan. Add the green beans and boil for 5 minutes. Fill a large bowl with ice water and set near the sink. Drain the beans and immediately transfer them into the bowl of ice water to stop the cooking process. Drain again, and set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/creamy-green-bean-casserole-from-scratch/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Over medium-high heat, melt the butter in a large 10- to 12-inch ovenproof skillet. Add the mushrooms, 1 teaspoon salt, and the pepper. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the mushrooms begin to release some moisture\u2014about 5 minutes. Add the garlic, stir, and cook for another 2 minutes. Sprinkle the flour on top and stir until combined. The flour will soak up all the moisture. Add the chicken broth and simmer for 3 minutes. Reduce the heat to medium-low and add the half-and-half. Stirring occasionally, cook until the mixture is thick\u2014about 10 minutes or maybe more if you prefer a thicker sauce.", "name": "For the casserole", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/creamy-green-bean-casserole-from-scratch/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove from heat and add about a quarter of the onions, and all of the green beans. Brown butter is the secret to their unbeatable flavor.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "brown butter toffee chocolate chip cookies", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/03/brown-butter-toffee-chocolate-chip-cookies-2-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/03/brown-butter-toffee-chocolate-chip-cookies-2-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/03/brown-butter-toffee-chocolate-chip-cookies-2-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/03/brown-butter-toffee-chocolate-chip-cookies-2.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/brown-butter-toffee-chocolate-chip-cookies/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 cup (16 Tbsp; 226g) unsalted butter", "1 cup (200g) packed light or dark brown sugar", "1/2 cup (100g) granulated sugar", "2 large eggs, at room temperature", "2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract", "2\u00a0and 1/2 cups (313g)\u00a0all-purpose flour\u00a0(spooned &amp; leveled)", "1 teaspoon baking soda", "1/2 teaspoon salt", "1 and 1/4 cups (225g) semi-sweet chocolate chips", "1 cup (150g) Heath Bar Bits O&#8217; Brickle English Toffee (see Note)", "optional: coarse sea salt"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Set out a medium heat-proof bowl because you\u2019ll need it at the end of this step. Slice the butter into Tablespoon-size pieces and place in a light-colored skillet or large pot. Light colored helps you determine when the butter begins browning. (See note if using a dark skillet or pot.) Melt the butter over medium heat and stir or whisk constantly. Once melted, the butter will begin to foam. Keep stirring/whisking. After 5-7 minutes, the butter will begin browning and you\u2019ll notice lightly browned specks begin to form at the bottom of the pan. It will have a nutty aroma. Once browned, remove from heat immediately and pour into the bowl, including any solids that have formed on the bottom of the pan. (You want those solids for flavor.) Cool brown butter for 5 minutes. Don&#8217;t cool longer than that because the butter will begin to thicken and, as a result, the cookie dough will be difficult to mix and its texture will be too crumbly.", "name": "Brown the butter", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/brown-butter-toffee-chocolate-chip-cookies/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the brown sugar and granulated sugar into the brown butter and then whisk in the eggs and vanilla extract. Set aside. In a large bowl, whisk the flour, baking soda, and salt together. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients, add the chocolate chips and toffee, then stir together with a large spoon or silicone spatula. The dough will seem too dry at first, but keeping stirring until it comes together. Dough will be greasy, thick, and a bit crumbly.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/brown-butter-toffee-chocolate-chip-cookies/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Scoop dough into balls, about 1 and 1/2 Tablespoons of dough each, and place on a large plate or baking sheet. I like to roll each cookie dough ball between my hands to smooth them out since they can be a little crumbly. Cover and chill the cookie dough balls in the refrigerator for 2 hours and up to 3 days before baking. (You can also freeze the dough balls, see Freezing Instructions below.)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/brown-butter-toffee-chocolate-chip-cookies/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Towards the end of chill time, preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Line large baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone baking mats. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/brown-butter-toffee-chocolate-chip-cookies/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Arrange cookie dough balls 3 inches apart on prepared baking sheets. If desired, lightly sprinkle coarse sea salt on top of each. Press the salt down into the cookie dough balls if it&#8217;s not sticking.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/brown-butter-toffee-chocolate-chip-cookies/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for 12-13 minutes or until the edges are lightly browned. Remove from the oven and allow cookies to cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely. While the cookies are still warm, I like to press a few more chocolate chips or toffee pieces into the tops\u2014this is only for looks! Cookies are extra soft out of the oven, but become chewier as they cool.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/brown-butter-toffee-chocolate-chip-cookies/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cookies stay fresh covered at room temperature for up to 5 days or in the refrigerator for 1 week.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/brown-butter-toffee-chocolate-chip-cookies/#instruction-step-8"}], "prepTime": "PT2H30M", "cookTime": "PT12M", "totalTime": "PT3H", "recipeYield": ["32", "32-36 cookies"], "recipeCategory": "Cookies", "cookingMethod": "Baking", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "61", "ratingValue": "4.6"}, "video": {"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "VideoObject", "name": "Brown Butter Toffee Chocolate Chip Cookies | Sally's Baking Recipes", "description": "These sweet and salty brown butter toffee chocolate chip cookies are soft and chewy in the centers with deliciously crisp edges.\n\nGet the full recipe: https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/brown-butter-toffee-chocolate-chip-cookies/\n\n\u2022 Ask your recipe question or leave a review over on the recipe page.\n\n#baking #recipes #brownbuttertoffeechocolatechipcookies\n\n\u2022 More of Sally's baking recipes: https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/", "duration": "PT1M", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/2xVOvrLod74?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2xVOvrLod74", "thumbnailUrl": ["https://i.ytimg.com/vi/2xVOvrLod74/hqdefault.jpg"], "uploadDate": "2022-06-09T18:33:30+00:00"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Dottie"}, "datePublished": "2025-10-21", "reviewBody": "These are so tasty and I love the texture!  They are bit chewy but also soft in the middle.  I overbaked my first batch a bit but even a bit crispy they are really good!!  They don't taste too different from regular chocolate chip cookies but they are a bit more caramelly and the texture is different enough to make it worth browning the butter.  I think these might be yummy with some white chocolate chips with the toffee or maybe some pretzel pieces! I will make these again for sure! \r\nI used my stand mixer so my dough really blended together and wasn't crumbly at all. I put the rolled dough in the fridge overnight and they didn't spread at all."}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Laura Brisson"}, "datePublished": "2025-11-16", "reviewBody": "I don't love baking, but I've made these a few times now because not only are they so easy, but they're also freaking delicious!! Everyone who tries a slice is instantly hooked.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "banoffee pie", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/10/whipped-cream-banoffee-pie-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/10/whipped-cream-banoffee-pie-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/10/whipped-cream-banoffee-pie-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/10/whipped-cream-banoffee-pie.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/banoffee-pie/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 and 1/2 cups (180g) graham cracker crumbs (about 12 full sheet graham crackers)", "1/4 cup (50g) granulated sugar", "6 Tablespoons (85g) unsalted butter, melted", "1 and 1/4 cups dulce de leche**", "2 large\u00a0bananas, sliced", "2 cups (480ml) cold\u00a0heavy cream\u00a0or\u00a0heavy whipping cream", "1/4 cup\u00a0confectioners&#8217; sugar\u00a0or\u00a0granulated sugar*", "1 teaspoon\u00a0pure vanilla extract", "optional toppings: chocolate shavings, chopped nuts, or toffee bits for garnish"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C).", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/banoffee-pie/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "If you\u2019re starting out with full graham crackers, use a\u00a0food processor or blender to grind them into fine crumbs. Stir the graham cracker crumbs and granulated sugar together in a medium bowl, and then stir in the melted butter. The mixture will be thick, coarse, and sandy. Try to smash/break up any large chunks. Pour the mixture into an ungreased 9-inch pie dish. With medium pressure using your hand, pat the crumbs down into the bottom and up the sides to make a compact crust. Do not pack down with heavy force because that makes the crust too hard. Simply pat down until the mixture is no longer crumby/crumbly. Tips: You can use a small flat-bottomed measuring cup to help press down the bottom crust and smooth out the surface, but do not pack down too hard. And run a spoon around the bottom &#8220;corner&#8221; where the edge and bottom meet to help make a rounded crust\u2060\u2014this helps prevent the crust from falling apart. For more shaping technique tips, see the graham cracker crust recipe page.", "name": "Make the crust", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/banoffee-pie/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake the crust for 15 minutes. Cool for 15 minutes.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/banoffee-pie/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a hand mixer or a stand mixer fitted with a whisk\u00a0attachment, whip the heavy cream, sugar, and vanilla extract on medium-high speed until medium peaks form, about 3-4 minutes. Medium peaks are between soft/loose peaks and stiff peaks and are the perfect consistency for topping and piping on desserts.", "name": "For the whipped cream:\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/banoffee-pie/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Spread dulce de leche on top of the crust. Garnish with toppings before serving, if desired.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/banoffee-pie/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover and store leftover pie in the refrigerator for up to 5 days.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/banoffee-pie/#instruction-step-7"}], "prepTime": "PT20M", "cookTime": "PT15M", "totalTime": "PT3H35M", "recipeYield": ["8", "8-10 servings"], "recipeCategory": "Pie", "cookingMethod": "Baking", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "37", "ratingValue": "4.8"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "4"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Laura"}, "datePublished": "2025-07-06", "reviewBody": "The pie was delicious. I added some salted cashews to the bottom layer. It was a little too sweet for my liking. I think next time I would put less of the condensed milk on the bottom-- just enough to create a layer. It also got a bit wet as the bananas released juice. Next time I would make sure to let the condensed milk cool even further, put the condensed milk layer into the crust and put it in the fridge before adding the bananas. I would also whip the cream to be closer to stiff peaks as it seemed to lose fluffiness after several hours."}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Shana B"}, "datePublished": "2025-10-25", "reviewBody": "I first heard of this recipe on the Great British Baking Show and I knew I had to make it. Thank you for sharing this incredibly easy and delicious recipe! Absolutely a hit and will be making again!"}], "datePublished": "2018-10-29", "@id": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/banoffee-pie/#recipe", "isPartOf": {"@id": The homemade dough comes together using a \"rough puff\" method where you carefully work butter into your dry ingredients and then fold and flatten the dough many times to create countless flaky layers. Make sure you start with very cold butter. This recipe is also in my cookbook, Sally's Baking 101.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "rough puff pastry", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/homemade-buttery-puff-pastry-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/homemade-buttery-puff-pastry-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/homemade-buttery-puff-pastry-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/homemade-buttery-puff-pastry.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/rough-puff-pastry/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 and 1/3 cups (167g) all-purpose flour\u00a0(spooned &amp; leveled), plus more as needed", "1 teaspoon granulated sugar", "1/2 teaspoon salt", "3/4 cup (12 Tbsp; 170g) unsalted butter, very cold and cubed", "6\u20138 Tablespoons (90\u2013120g/ml) ice-cold water"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl, whisk the flour, sugar, and salt together. Place the cold and cubed butter on top. Gently toss the flour and butter together with your hands, and then briefly rub the butter into the flour to begin combining them, as you can see in the video tutorial. You do not want to break down the butter too much in this step. I do not recommend a food processor, pastry cutter, or mixer for this step because it will break down the butter too much.", "name": "Make the dough", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/rough-puff-pastry/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "At this point, the butter is still in large cubes/chunks. Begin adding the ice-cold water, 1 Tablespoon (15g/ml) at a time, using your hands to toss the mixture together after each addition. (I usually start with 2 Tablespoons of water before I begin tossing together.) You can use a spatula or spoon for tossing, but I really do recommend your hands so you get a good feel of the dough. As the dough begins to hydrate after about 4 Tablespoons of water, you can start lightly squeezing or clumping the dough together with your hands to help bring it together. Mixture will still be very shaggy, as you can see in the video and photos. If your dough feels sticky and wet before adding 6 Tablespoons of water, mix in 1 Tablespoon of flour (your butter was likely too warm\u2014you can continue with the recipe, but the dough may not be as flaky).", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/rough-puff-pastry/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour the shaggy clump of dough out onto a lightly floured work surface. There should still be large chunks of butter at this point. With lightly floured hands, begin patting the dough down until it&#8217;s 3/4\u20131 inch thick, about a 5&#215;8-inch rectangle. Fold the dough into thirds as if you were folding a business letter. Use your hands to gently flatten and smooth out any cracks in your dough. Wrap it tightly in plastic wrap or parchment paper, or place into an airtight container.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/rough-puff-pastry/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Refrigerate the dough for at least 2 hours and up to 24 hours.", "name": "1st refrigeration", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/rough-puff-pastry/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Take the dough out of the refrigerator to begin the \u201crolling and folding\u201d process. If the dough chilled for longer than about 3 hours, it&#8217;s likely very stiff, so let it rest for about 5 minutes before you begin rolling. Lightly flour a work surface. The dough gets sticky, so make sure you have more flour nearby as you roll and fold. Using lightly floured hands, gently flatten the dough into a small square. Using a rolling pin, roll the dough into a rectangle that&#8217;s 1/2 inch thick, about 6&#215;12 inches. The exact dimensions are not important, but the thickness is. As you roll, it&#8217;s best to flip the dough over once or twice to make sure it&#8217;s not sticking to your work surface. Lightly flour your work surface as needed. Fold the rectangle into thirds as if it were a business letter. (See photos and video tutorial.) Turn it 90 degrees and roll it out into a 1/2-inch-thick rectangle again. Fold into thirds again. Turn it 90 degrees. You\u2019ll repeat rolling and folding 4 more times for a total of 6 times.", "name": "Roll &amp; Fold", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/rough-puff-pastry/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Wrap the dough tightly and refrigerate for at least 15 minutes and up to 24 hours before using in your recipe. You can also freeze the dough at this point. See Notes.", "name": "2nd Refrigeration", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/rough-puff-pastry/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Use wherever you would use frozen store-bought puff pastry. To bake plain, roll pastry dough into a 10&#215;16-inch rectangle and place on a lined baking sheet. Brush all over with egg wash (1 large egg whisked with 1 Tbsp milk), and bake at 400\u00b0F (204\u00b0C) until golden brown and puffy, about 25\u201328 minutes.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/rough-puff-pastry/#instruction-step-7"}], "prepTime": "PT3H", "cookTime": "", "totalTime": "PT3H", "recipeYield": ["1", "about 1 lb. Set aside.", "name": "Make the muffins", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cranberry-cardamom-spice-muffins/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large\u00a0bowl using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter on high speed until smooth and creamy, about 1 minute. Add the granulated sugar and beat on high until creamed, about 2 full minutes. Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl as needed. Add the eggs, sour cream, and vanilla extract. Beat on medium speed for 1 minute, then turn up to high speed until the mixture is combined and creamy.\u00a0Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl as needed.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cranberry-cardamom-spice-muffins/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients and beat on low speed until just about combined. Bake the muffins for 5 minutes at 425\u00b0F (218\u00b0C) then, keeping the muffins in the oven, reduce the oven temperature to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Bake for an additional 15-18 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. The total time these muffins take in the oven is about 22-23 minutes, give or take. Allow the muffins to cool for 5 minutes in the muffin pan, then transfer to a wire rack and drizzle with icing.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cranberry-cardamom-spice-muffins/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "\u00a0Whisk the confectioners&#8217; sugar and orange\u00a0juice together. Line large baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone baking mats. Carefully remove the top dough piece from the refrigerator. Repeat with 2nd piece of dough. I used red and blue M&amp;Ms, Almond Joy round candies, almonds, sprinkles, and crumbled Heath bars. They went super fast, and they were fun to make! When I melted all the caramel, the liquid wasn't deep enough to fully \"dunk\" the pretzels, so I poured the melted caramel into a glass measuring cup, and used a spatula to help swirl the caramel onto the pretzels. It seemed to work pretty well; do you have any other tips for getting the caramel all around half the pretzel? It was kind of gooey and when it cooled too much, I just popped it in the microwave to warm it up a bit so it was easier to work with. Such a fun recipe, and it's easy to adapt for each holiday! (Here\u2019s a helpful tutorial if you need guidance on\u00a0how to cream butter and sugar.) Add the egg, vanilla, and molasses and beat on high speed until combined, about 1 minute. Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl and beat again as needed to combine.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/homemade-little-debbie-oatmeal-creme-pies/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a medium bowl, whisk\u00a0the flour, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, cloves, and oats.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/homemade-little-debbie-oatmeal-creme-pies/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "With the mixer running on low speed, slowly add the dry ingredients to wet ingredients. The dough will be quite thick and very sticky, and you may have to mix it all by hand after a few seconds in the mixer.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/homemade-little-debbie-oatmeal-creme-pies/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Scoop the dough, about 2 heaping Tablespoons of dough per cookie (if using a scale, make them 45g each), and arrange 3 inches apart on the baking sheets (about 6 cookies per baking sheet). Taste and add a pinch or two of salt, if needed. (Without doing so, the cookies may not spread.)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/pumpkin-chocolate-chip-cookies/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for 11-12 minutes or until the edges appear set. This recipe is also in my cookbook, Sally's Baking 101.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "cupcakes, vanilla cupcakes", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/homemade-vanilla-cupcakes-with-vanilla-buttercream-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/homemade-vanilla-cupcakes-with-vanilla-buttercream-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/homemade-vanilla-cupcakes-with-vanilla-buttercream-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/homemade-vanilla-cupcakes-with-vanilla-buttercream.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/simply-perfect-vanilla-cupcakes/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 and 3/4 cups (207g) cake flour\u00a0(spooned &amp; leveled)", "3/4 teaspoon baking powder", "1/4 teaspoon baking soda", "1/4 teaspoon salt", "1/2 cup (8 Tbsp; 113g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "1 cup (200g) granulated sugar", "3 large egg whites, at room temperature", "1/2 cup (120g) full-fat sour cream at room temperature", "2\u00a0teaspoons pure vanilla extract", "seeds scraped from 1/2 of a vanilla bean (optional)", "1/2 cup (120g/ml) whole milk at room temperature", "vanilla buttercream", "sprinkles, for garnish (optional)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Line a 12-cup muffin pan with cupcake liners. Line a second pan with 2 liners\u2014this recipe makes about 14 cupcakes. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/simply-perfect-vanilla-cupcakes/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a medium bowl, whisk the cake flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/simply-perfect-vanilla-cupcakes/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter and sugar on high speed until light and creamy, about 3 minutes. Scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed. Add the egg whites, vanilla extract, and vanilla bean seeds (if using) and beat on high speed until smooth and well combined, about 2 minutes. Add the sour cream and beat on medium-high speed until combined, about 1 minute. With the mixer running on low speed, add the dry ingredients, and then slowly pour in the milk and beat just until combined. Do not over-mix. You may need to whisk it by hand a few times to make sure there are no lumps at the bottom of the bowl. The batter will be slightly thick. Pour/spoon the batter into the liners\u2014fill only 2/3 full to avoid spilling over the sides.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/simply-perfect-vanilla-cupcakes/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for 19\u201322 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Heat the cream in a small saucepan over medium heat until it begins to gently simmer.\u00a0(Do not let it come to a rapid boil\u2014that\u2019s too hot!) Pour over chocolate, then let it sit for 2\u20133 minutes to gently soften the chocolate.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-ganache/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "With a metal spoon or small silicone spatula, very slowly stir until completely combined and chocolate has melted. The finer you chopped the chocolate, the quicker it will melt with the cream. If it&#8217;s not melting, do not microwave it. See Troubleshooting Chocolate Ganache in blog post above.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-ganache/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Ganache can be ready to use as a drizzle or you can let it sit at room temperature to cool and thicken. It will fully cool within 2 hours. Refrigerating speeds this up, but the ganache will not cool evenly. Stir it a few times as it sets in the refrigerator so it remains even and smooth.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-ganache/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once completely cool and thick, the ganache can be piped with a piping tip or scooped with a spoon. You can also beat the cooled thickened ganache with a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment until light in color and texture, about 4 minutes on medium-high speed.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-ganache/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover tightly and store ganache in the refrigerator for up to 5 days. Once ganache cools completely, you can cover it tightly and freeze it for up to 3 months. Thaw in the refrigerator. To rewarm or thin out again, stir constantly over low heat on the stove in either (1) a double boiler or (2) in a heat-proof bowl placed over a pot of simmering water. These soft-baked snickerdoodle cookies only require about 30 minutes start to finish! No dough chilling required.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "snickerdoodles", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/05/snickerdoodles-recipe-5-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/05/snickerdoodles-recipe-5-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/05/snickerdoodles-recipe-5-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/05/snickerdoodles-recipe-5.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/soft-thick-snickerdoodles-in-20-minutes/", "recipeIngredient": ["3 cups (375g) all-purpose flour (spooned &amp; leveled)", "2 teaspoons cream of tartar*", "1 teaspoon baking soda", "1 and 1/2 teaspoons ground cinnamon", "1/2 teaspoon salt", "1 cup (16 Tbsp; 226g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "1 and 1/3 cup (267g) granulated sugar", "1 large egg + 1 large egg yolk, at room temperature", "2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract", "1/3 cup (70g) granulated sugar", "1 teaspoon ground\u00a0cinnamon"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 375\u00b0F (190\u00b0C). Line two large cookie sheets with parchment paper or silicone baking mats (always recommended for cookies). Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/soft-thick-snickerdoodles-in-20-minutes/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Combine the granulated sugar and cinnamon together in a small bowl.", "name": "Make the topping", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/soft-thick-snickerdoodles-in-20-minutes/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the flour, cream of tartar, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt together in a medium bowl.", "name": "Make the cookies:\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/soft-thick-snickerdoodles-in-20-minutes/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl using a hand mixer or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter and granulated sugar together on high speed until smooth and creamy, about 2 minutes. Add the egg, egg yolk, and vanilla extract. Beat on medium-high speed until combined. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a rubber spatula as needed. With the mixer running on low speed, slowly add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients in 3 different parts. The dough will be thick.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/soft-thick-snickerdoodles-in-20-minutes/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Roll cookie dough into balls, about 1.5 Tablespoons (35g) of cookie dough each. I recommend this cookie scoop.\u00a0Roll the dough balls in cinnamon-sugar topping. Sprinkle extra cinnamon-sugar on top if desired.\u00a0Arrange 3 inches apart on the baking sheets.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/soft-thick-snickerdoodles-in-20-minutes/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake cookies for 10 minutes. The cookies will be very puffy and soft. When they are still very warm, lightly press down on them with the back of a spoon or fork to help flatten them out. Line an 8-inch or 9-inch square baking pan with parchment paper or aluminum foil, leaving an overhang on the sides to lift the finished brownies out.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/ultimate-fudge-brownies-with-peanut-butter-chips-2/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Melt the butter, granulated sugar, cocoa powder, and salt in a large bowl in the microwave. Melt in 30 second increments and stir after each time until the butter is completely melted. The mixture will look gritty. Set aside for a few minutes as you get the other ingredients ready. You don\u2019t want the mixture to be piping hot.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/ultimate-fudge-brownies-with-peanut-butter-chips-2/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Stir in the vanilla extract. Add the eggs one at a time, stirring after each addition. The batter will be thick and look shiny. Add the flour, beating with a whisk until fully combined. Try not to overmix the batter at this point. Gently fold in the peanut butter chips, leaving a few to sprinkle on top. Pour into prepared baking pan and sprinkle with remaining peanut butter chips.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/ultimate-fudge-brownies-with-peanut-butter-chips-2/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for 25 minutes and check the brownies for doneness. Set aside.\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/peach-streusel-muffins/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Mix the brown sugar, granulated sugar, cinnamon, and melted butter together in a small bowl until combined. Add the flour and use a fork to gently mix until crumbs form. Don&#8217;t over-mix into a paste. Just mix until it is crumbly. Set aside.", "name": "Make the crumb topping", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/peach-streusel-muffins/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the flour, baking soda, baking powder, cinnamon, allspice, and salt together in a medium bowl. Set aside.", "name": "Make the muffins:\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/peach-streusel-muffins/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter and both sugars together on high speed until smooth and creamy, about 3 minutes. Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl as needed. (Here\u2019s a helpful tutorial if you need guidance on\u00a0how to cream butter and sugar.) Add the eggs, yogurt or sour cream, and vanilla extract. Beat on medium speed for 1 minute, then turn up to high speed until the mixture is combined and mostly creamy. (It&#8217;s ok if it appears somewhat curdled.) Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl as needed. With the mixer running on low speed, add the dry ingredients and milk into the wet ingredients and beat until no flour pockets remain. Fold in the chopped peaches.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/peach-streusel-muffins/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Spoon the batter evenly into each cup or liner, filling each all the way to the top. Spoon crumb topping on each, gently pressing it down so it sticks.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/peach-streusel-muffins/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for 5 minutes at 425\u00b0F; then, without opening the oven, reduce the oven temperature to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Bake for an additional 16\u201319 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. The total time these muffins take in the oven is about 21\u201324 minutes. Allow the muffins to cool for 5 minutes in the muffin pan, then transfer to a wire rack to continue cooling. When warm, the muffins are quite fragile because of the wet peaches. Garnish with sprinkles for an extra special treat!", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "smith island cake", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/07/smith-island-cake-5-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/07/smith-island-cake-5-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/07/smith-island-cake-5-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/07/smith-island-cake-5.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/smith-island-cake/", "recipeIngredient": ["6 Tablespoons (85g) unsalted butter, cut into 6 pieces", "one 4 ounce bar (113g) bittersweet chocolate, coarsely chopped*", "1 and 2/3 cups (335g) granulated sugar", "1 cup (240ml) heavy cream", "2 teaspoons corn syrup (optional, for shine)", "1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract", "pinch salt", "3 and 3/4 cups (443g) sifted all-purpose flour* (spooned &amp; leveled)", "1 teaspoon baking powder", "3/4 teaspoon baking soda", "1 teaspoon salt", "1 and 1/2 cups (340g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "2 cups (400g) granulated sugar", "5 large eggs, at room temperature", "2 and 1/2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract", "1 and 3/4 cups (420ml) buttermilk, at room temperature*", "optional: rainbow sprinkles for garnish"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "The icing needs to completely cool and thicken, so prepare it first. Combine the butter, chocolate, granulated sugar, heavy cream, and corn syrup together in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Stir constantly until butter has melted. Once melted, stir occasionally as the sugar dissolves and the mixture comes to a boil. Allow to boil for 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in the vanilla extract. Taste (it&#8217;s warm, so be careful!) Add a sprinkle of salt, if desired. I always add a pinch. Leave uncovered and set aside to thicken and cool for at least 1-2 hours or until it has a spreadable consistency. This is enough time to bake and cool the cake layers. See make ahead tip if you want to prepare ahead of time. Yields about 2 and 1/4 cups icing.", "name": "Make the icing first", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/smith-island-cake/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Grease three 9-inch cake pans, line with parchment paper rounds, then grease the parchment paper. Parchment paper helps the cakes seamlessly release from the pans; they may crack and crumble otherwise. (If it&#8217;s helpful, see this parchment paper rounds for cakes video &amp; post. You can also reuse the parchment for each of the 9 cakes or cut 9 individual circles.)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/smith-island-cake/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together in a large bowl. Set aside. Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle or whisk attachment, beat the butter and sugar together on high speed until smooth and creamy, about 3 minutes. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a rubber spatula as needed. On medium-high speed, add 1 egg at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat in the vanilla extract. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a rubber spatula as needed. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a rubber spatula as needed.", "name": "Make the cake", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/smith-island-cake/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "With the mixer on low speed, add the dry ingredients in three additions alternating with the buttermilk, beginning and ending with the dry ingredients, and mixing each addition just until incorporated. Do not overmix this batter. The batter will be smooth, velvety, and slightly thick.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/smith-island-cake/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "(There are 8 cups of batter total, so each of the 9 cakes will have slightly less than 1 cup of batter. Leave unused batter loosely covered at room temperature as cakes bake.) Pour slightly less than 1 cup of batter into prepared cake pans. Bake for 12 minutes or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean. The cakes are VERY thin, so they shouldn&#8217;t take much longer than that. Allow to cool for a couple minutes, then carefully invert the cake onto the counter. Peel off the parchment to reuse (or use a new parchment round). Grease the warm cake pans, line with parchment, and grease the parchment. Repeat with slightly less than 1 cup of batter per cake pan. Repeat baking, cooling, and releasing the cakes from the warm pans.\u00a0Grease the warm cake pans, line with parchment, and grease the parchment. Repeat one final time. Allow all 9 layers to cool completely, about 45 minutes.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/smith-island-cake/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Carefully place one layer on a serving platter, cake turntable, or cake stand. Spoon and spread 1/4 cup of icing on top, then repeat with the rest of the cake layers and icing. Some icing will spill over the sides and that&#8217;s ok! Makes a beautiful cake! Decorate the top with sprinkles, if desired.", "name": "Assemble cake:\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/smith-island-cake/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Set cake aside for at least 30 minutes before slicing and serving. Spray a 9-inch springform pan with nonstick cooking spray.\u00a0Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/pumpkin-cake-cheesecake/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the cream cheese and granulated sugar together on medium speed in a large bowl until smooth and creamy, about 2 minutes. Add the sour cream, vanilla extract, and flour and beat until combined. On low speed, add the eggs one at a time, beating after each addition until just blended. Do not over-mix the filling after you have added the eggs. Set aside.", "name": "Make the cheesecake first:\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/pumpkin-cake-cheesecake/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a medium bowl, whisk the oil, brown sugar, eggs, vanilla extract, and blotted-dry pumpkin (see notes) together until combined. Avoid over-mixing the pumpkin cake batter.", "name": "Make the pumpkin cake", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/pumpkin-cake-cheesecake/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Spread 1 and 1/2 cups of the pumpkin cake batter into the bottom of prepared pan. On top of the pumpkin batter, begin dropping large spoonfuls of both the cheesecake batter and pumpkin batter, alternating one after the other. It doesn&#8217;t have to be neat or perfect. Do not swirl with a knife. See photo above of what my cake looked like before going into the oven.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/pumpkin-cake-cheesecake/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "\u00a0If needed for extra visuals, see my\u00a0How to Make a Cheesecake Water Bath; the visual guide will assist you in this step. Boil a pot of water. You need 1 inch of water in your roasting pan for the water bath, so make sure you boil enough. I use an entire kettle of hot water. As the water is heating up, wrap the aluminum foil around the springform pan. Place the pan inside of a large roasting pan. Carefully pour the hot water inside of the pan and place in the oven.\u00a0(Or you can place the roasting pan in the oven first, then pour the hot water in. Whichever is easier for you.)", "name": "Prepare the simple water bath (see note)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/pumpkin-cake-cheesecake/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for 65-75 minutes or until the center is almost set.* If you find the edges are browning, loosely place aluminum foil on top of the cake as it bakes. Once done, turn the oven off and open the door slightly. Let the cheesecake sit in the oven in the water bath for 1 hour. Remove from the oven, peel the aluminum foil off the bottom, wipe pan dry with a towel, then place in the refrigerator to chill for at least 6 hours or overnight (preferred).", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/pumpkin-cake-cheesecake/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "After chilling, run a knife around the edge of the cake to loosen it from the rim. Beat on low speed for 30 seconds, then turn up to high speed and beat until smooth and creamy. Beat in 1-2 Tablespoons of milk, depending how thick or thin you want the frosting. If you're cooking on an <a href=\"https://amzn.to/40Pp0xF\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener nofollow sponsored\">electric griddle</a>, you can simply set it to heat to that temperature. If you're cooking in a <a href=\"https://amzn.to/40UFepl\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener nofollow sponsored\">griddle pan</a> or large skillet on the stove, allow the pan to preheat for several minutes over <strong>medium heat</strong>. Don't be tempted to crank the heat up to high; that will lead to unevenly cooked, burnt pancakes.", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}, {"@type": "Question", "@id": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/buttermilk-pancakes-recipe/#faq-question-1740158677672", "position": 2, "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/buttermilk-pancakes-recipe/#faq-question-1740158677672", "name": "Can I Test the Pan to See if It's Ready for the Batter?", "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "To test if the pan is ready, flick a few drops of water from your fingers onto the pan. If they sizzle in place and disappear, it's not quite hot enough yet. If they \"dance\" around on the surface before sizzling out, your pan is good to go!", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}, {"@type": "Question", "@id": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/buttermilk-pancakes-recipe/#faq-question-1740159083986", "position": 3, "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/buttermilk-pancakes-recipe/#faq-question-1740159083986", "name": "Can I Add Extras to This Batter?", "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "While these pancakes are flavorful on their own, feel free to fold your favorite add-ins\u2014 such as chocolate chips, berries, or chopped nuts\u2014into the batter before cooking. Sprinkles are a fun addition for a birthday breakfast!", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}, {"@type": "Question", "@id": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/buttermilk-pancakes-recipe/#faq-question-1740158687836", "position": 4, "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/buttermilk-pancakes-recipe/#faq-question-1740158687836", "name": "When Do I Flip Pancakes?", "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "Many pancake recipes instruct you to flip when you see bubbles forming on the surface, but you're actually looking for holes. Your pancakes are ready to flip when the bubbles are <em>popping</em>, forming little holes in the surface. Cook until the edges look set and you notice holes in the pancake's surface around the border, about 2 minutes. Flip, then cook for another minute.", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}, {"@context": "https://schema.org/", "@type": "Recipe", "name": "Buttermilk Pancakes", "description": "Fluffy and thick with just the right amount of sweetness, these buttermilk pancakes are the ideal base for your favorite pancake toppings like maple syrup, whipped cream, strawberry sauce topping or blueberry sauce topping, lemon curd, fresh berries, etc.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "buttermilk pancakes", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/03/pancakes-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/03/pancakes-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/03/pancakes-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/03/pancakes.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/buttermilk-pancakes-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["6 Tablespoons (85g) unsalted butter, melted and slightly cooled (plus more butter for greasing)", "2 and 1/4 cups (281g) all-purpose flour (spooned &amp; leveled)", "1/3 cup (67g) granulated sugar", "1 and 1/4 teaspoon baking powder", "1/2 teaspoon baking soda", "1/4 teaspoon salt", "2 large eggs", "2 cups (480ml) buttermilk", "1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Melt the 6 Tablespoons (85g) of butter first. Microwave or stovetop\u2014either is fine. Set aside to slightly cool until step 3. You don&#8217;t want it piping hot.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/buttermilk-pancakes-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl, preferably with a pour spout, whisk the flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together until combined. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/buttermilk-pancakes-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In another large bowl, whisk the eggs, buttermilk, and vanilla extract together until combined. Whisk in the melted butter. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and gently whisk to combine. Make sure there are no patches of dry flour at the bottom of the bowl. The batter is thick and a few lumps are fine.
