The brown butter adds deep flavor, the marshmallows partially melt into caramelized pockets, and the rice cereal brings that light, crisp-crackle texture. For best results, freeze the dough balls before baking so the marshmallows stay intact and the cookies don\u2019t overspread.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally McKenney", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "marshmallow crispy cookies", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/12/brown-butter-marshmallow-crispy-cookies-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/12/brown-butter-marshmallow-crispy-cookies-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/12/brown-butter-marshmallow-crispy-cookies-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/12/brown-butter-marshmallow-crispy-cookies.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/marshmallow-crispy-cookies/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 cup (16 Tbsp; 226g) unsalted butter, cut into 16 pieces", "2 and 1/4 cups (281g) all-purpose flour\u00a0(spooned &amp; leveled)", "2 teaspoons cornstarch", "1 teaspoon baking soda", "1/2 teaspoon salt", "2 cups (52g) crispy rice cereal", "1 cup (60g) mini marshmallows", "3/4 cup (150g) packed light or dark brown sugar", "1/2 cup (100g) granulated sugar", "1 large egg, at room temperature", "1 large egg yolk, at room temperature", "2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract", "optional: flaky sea salt, for topping"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the sliced butter in a light-colored skillet or saucepan over medium heat. (Light-colored helps you determine when the butter begins browning.) Stir or whisk the butter constantly as it melts. Once melted, the butter will begin to foam. Keep stirring. After 5\u20138 minutes, the butter will begin browning\u2014you&#8217;ll notice lightly browned specks begin to form at the bottom of the pan and it will have a nutty aroma. As soon as the butter has browned, immediately remove from heat and pour it into a medium heat-safe bowl. Scrape up the browned solids at the bottom of the skillet and add them as well. Set aside to slightly cool. After browning, you should have around 185-190g butter.", "name": "Brown the butter", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/marshmallow-crispy-cookies/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, cornstarch, baking soda, and salt. Fold in the rice cereal and mini marshmallows.", "name": "Make the cookies", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/marshmallow-crispy-cookies/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the brown butter, brown sugar, granulated sugar, egg, egg yolk, and vanilla together until combined. Pour into the flour mixture and stir with a silicone spatula until fully incorporated. The dough will be greasy and a bit crumbly; that\u2019s ok.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/marshmallow-crispy-cookies/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Scoop the dough, about 2 Tablespoons (40g) per cookie, and use your hands to form it into a ball. Squeeze firmly to help it hold its shape. Place the dough balls on a parchment-lined baking sheet and freeze, uncovered, for 1 hour. If freezing for longer (up to 1 day), transfer the firm dough balls to an airtight container or zip-top bag.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/marshmallow-crispy-cookies/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Line large baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone baking mats.\u00a0Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/marshmallow-crispy-cookies/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Arrange the frozen dough balls 3 inches apart on the prepared baking sheets. Bake for 14-15 minutes, or until the cookies are lightly browned on top, the edges look crisp, and the centers still look soft. (If the cookies haven\u2019t begun to spread by the 10-minute mark, remove the baking sheet from the oven, give it a few firm taps on the counter, then return it to the oven.) Some edges may over-spread if a marshmallow is on the outside. This is normal and expected.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/marshmallow-crispy-cookies/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Sprinkle sea salt, if using, on top of the warm cookies right after you remove them from the oven. Let the cookies cool on the baking sheet for 10 minutes before transferring to a cooling rack to cool completely.\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/marshmallow-crispy-cookies/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover cooled cookies tightly and store at room temperature for up to 1 week.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/marshmallow-crispy-cookies/#instruction-step-8"}], "prepTime": "PT1H30M", "cookTime": "PT15M", "totalTime": "PT1H45M", "recipeYield": ["20", "20-22 cookies"], "recipeCategory": "Cookies", "cookingMethod": "Baking", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "31", "ratingValue": "4.7"}, "video": {"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "VideoObject", "name": "Brown Butter Marshmallow Crispy Cookies", "description": "Chewy, gooey, crispy-edged brown butter marshmallow crispy cookies taste like a brown-butter-infused rice krispie treat in cookie form.", "contentUrl": "https://content.jwplatform.com/videos/b4R94K18.mp4", "thumbnailUrl": ["https://content.jwplatform.com/thumbs/b4R94K18-720.jpg"], "uploadDate": "2025-12-04T17:16:27+00:00"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Kelly"}, "datePublished": "2025-12-07", "reviewBody": "Perfect. I tapped at ten minutes, and then flattened them a bit afterwards with a spoon, while they cooled on the pan. Make em and you won\u2019t regret it."}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sara M"}, "datePublished": "2025-12-13", "reviewBody": "These were awesome! Top with fresh raspberry icing and sprinkles!", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "pound cake", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/mini-vanilla-pound-cakes-with-sprinkles-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/mini-vanilla-pound-cakes-with-sprinkles-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/mini-vanilla-pound-cakes-with-sprinkles-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/mini-vanilla-pound-cakes-with-sprinkles.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/mini-vanilla-pound-cakes/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 and 3/4 cups (219g) all-purpose flour\u00a0(spooned &amp; leveled)", "1/2 teaspoon baking powder", "1/2 teaspoon salt", "1 cup (16 Tbsp; 226g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "1 cup (200g) granulated sugar", "4 large eggs, at room temperature", "1/2 cup (120g) full-fat sour cream, at room temperature", "1 and 1/2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract", "seeds scraped from 1/2 of a vanilla bean", "1/2 teaspoon almond extract (optional but recommended!)", "1/2 cup (85g) fresh raspberries", "2 teaspoons\u00a0granulated sugar", "1 and 1/2 cups (180g) confectioners&#8217; sugar", "1 Tablespoon (15ml) heavy cream or milk"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C) and generously grease a mini Bundt cake pan (or another pan, see note).", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/mini-vanilla-pound-cakes/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "\u00a0Whisk the flour, baking powder, and salt together in a large bowl. Set aside.", "name": "Make the mini cakes", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/mini-vanilla-pound-cakes/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "With a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle or whisk attachment, beat the butter and sugar together on high speed until creamy, about 2 minutes. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl as needed. With the mixer running on low speed, add the eggs one at a time, then add the sour cream, vanilla extract, vanilla bean, and almond extract (if using). Beat on medium-high speed until combined. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl as needed. With the mixer running on low speed, slowly add the dry ingredients. Beat everything just until incorporated. Do not over-mix. Batter will be very creamy and thick with lots of vanilla bean specks.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/mini-vanilla-pound-cakes/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Spoon batter into pan, filling each Bundt cake cavity 2/3 full. If you need to make a 2nd batch, loosely cover the leftover batter and keep at room temperature until your pan is ready again.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/mini-vanilla-pound-cakes/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for 20-25 minutes or until the cakes are lightly golden and spring back when lightly poked with your finger. Remove from the oven and allow to cool inside the pan for 5 minutes. Carefully invert the pan on the counter or wire rack. Give the pan a little shake so the cakes release. Allow Bundt cakes to cool completely on a wire rack before icing and serving.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/mini-vanilla-pound-cakes/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Toss the raspberries and granulated sugar together. Vigorously stir to break up the raspberries. Allow to sit for 5 minutes as the raspberries let out their juices. (You can also use a small food processor for this step.) Strain the raspberries through a fine mesh sieve over a medium bowl. Use a spoon to press them through, extracting all the juices and removing the seeds. You&#8217;ll have about 3 Tablespoons of juice. Whisk in the confectioners&#8217; sugar and heavy cream. Add a little more confectioners&#8217; sugar to thicken or more cream to thin, if desired. Drizzle over cooled pound cakes.", "name": "Make the icing", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/mini-vanilla-pound-cakes/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover and store leftover iced cakes at room temperature for 1-2 days or in the refrigerator for up to 5 days.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/mini-vanilla-pound-cakes/#instruction-step-7"}], "prepTime": "PT20M", "cookTime": "PT25M", "totalTime": "PT2H", "recipeYield": ["8", "8-9 mini cakes"], "recipeCategory": "Cake", "cookingMethod": "Baking", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "14", "ratingValue": "4.9"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Nawal Al-Sulaiti"}, "datePublished": "2025-05-31", "reviewBody": "I love it! Spread into prepared baking pan. My batter for homemade brownies is very thick, so do your best to spread it to the edges. Doesn&#8217;t have to be perfectly neat. Press 24 Oreos down into the top of the brownie batter; you want 6 rows of 4 Oreos.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cookies-cream-brownies/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for 32 minutes, then test the brownies with a toothpick. Insert it into the center of the pan. If it comes out with wet batter, the brownies are not done. If there are only a few moist crumbs, the brownies are done. Keep checking every 2 minutes until you have moist crumbs. My homemade brownies with Oreos on top take about 35 minutes.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cookies-cream-brownies/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove from the oven and place on a wire rack to cool completely in the pan. Once cool,\u00a0lift the parchment paper out of the pan using the overhang on the sides. Do not cut into squares yet. (TIP: It&#8217;s helpful to place the whole slab of brownies (parchment paper still underneath) on a baking sheet because you will need to chill the layers. The baking sheet makes transporting to the refrigerator easier!)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cookies-cream-brownies/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "With a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter on medium speed until creamy, about 2 minutes. Add confectioners&#8217; sugar, milk, and vanilla extract. Beat on low speed for 30 seconds, then increase to high speed and beat for 2 full minutes. With a spoon or rubber spatula, fold in the chopped Oreos. Taste. Add a pinch of salt if frosting is too sweet. I like adding 1/8 teaspoon salt. Spread buttercream on top of cooled brownies. These frosted chai spice snickerdoodles are a chai tea latte in cookie form!", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "chai spice sugar cookies, chai spice snickerdoodles", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/10/Sallys-Baking-Addiction-Chai-Spice-Cookies-3-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/10/Sallys-Baking-Addiction-Chai-Spice-Cookies-3-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/10/Sallys-Baking-Addiction-Chai-Spice-Cookies-3-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/10/Sallys-Baking-Addiction-Chai-Spice-Cookies-3.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/frosted-chai-spice-snickerdoodles/", "recipeIngredient": ["2 and 3/4 cups (344g) all-purpose flour (spooned &amp; leveled)", "2 teaspoons cream of tartar", "1 teaspoon baking soda", "1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon", "1/2 teaspoon salt", "1 cup (16 Tbsp; 226g) unsalted butter, melted", "1 cup (200g) granulated sugar", "1/3 cup (70g) packed light brown sugar", "1 large egg, at room temperature", "2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract", "1/2 cup (100g) granulated sugar", "1 and 1/2 teaspoons ground cinnamon", "1 teaspoon ground ginger", "1 teaspoon ground cardamom", "1/2 teaspoon ground allspice", "1/2 cup (8 Tbsp; 113g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "2 cups (240g) confectioners&#8217; sugar", "1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract", "3 Tablespoons (45ml) heavy cream or milk", "seeds scraped from 1/2 of a split vanilla bean", "1/8 teaspoon salt"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "When you take the butter out of the refrigerator to make the cookie dough, take out 1/2 cup more (1 stick) and allow to soften as you make the cookies. This softened butter is for the frosting.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/frosted-chai-spice-snickerdoodles/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Toss the flour, cream of tartar, baking soda, cinnamon and salt together in a large bowl. Set aside.", "name": "For the cookies:\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/frosted-chai-spice-snickerdoodles/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a medium bowl, whisk the melted butter, granulated sugar and brown sugar together until smooth. You must use a whisk in order to prevent the butter from separating from the sugars. Whisk in the egg, then the vanilla until combined. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix together with a large spoon or silicone spatula. The dough will be very thick and heavy, yet slightly crumbly. Cover the dough tightly with plastic wrap and chill for at least 45 minutes and up to 2 days. (If chilling for longer than a few hours, be sure to let the cookie dough sit at room temperature for 20-30 minutes because it will be quite hard.)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/frosted-chai-spice-snickerdoodles/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). I like to use this medium cookie scoop. The cookies will look very puffy, soft, and under baked. That&#8217;s ok.\u00a0Remove from the oven and allow to cool on the cookie sheet for at least 10 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.", "name": "For the rolling", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/frosted-chai-spice-snickerdoodles/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "(frosting is optional): With a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter on medium speed until creamy\u2014about 2 minutes. Add confectioners&#8217; sugar, vanilla extract, cream, and vanilla bean seeds with the mixer running on low. Increase to high speed and beat for 3 full minutes. Add 1 Tablespoon more cream if frosting is too thick. Taste and add 1/8 teaspoon salt if frosting is too sweet. Line an 8-inch square baking pan or 9-inch square baking pan with parchment paper with enough overhang on the sides to easily remove the bars from the pan. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/vanilla-almond-snack-bars/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a rubber spatula or wooden spoon, mix the honey, vanilla, almond meal, salt, and\u00a0almond butter together until combined. Fold in the almonds, chopped dates, and sunflower seeds until combined.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/vanilla-almond-snack-bars/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Transfer mixture to prepared baking pan and press very firmly into an even layer. You really want it packed in tight\u2014as tight as possible. Bake for 20 minutes. Remove from the oven and allow to cool completely in the pan set on a wire rack for 1 hour, then transfer to the refrigerator to chill for 1 more hour. This helps firm up the bars which makes them stay compact. Remove bars from the pan using the overhang on the sides and cut into bars. Individually wrap each bar in plastic wrap or parchment. Store at room temperature for 1 week or in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks. I find they get a little sticky at room temperature over a few days, so I prefer the refrigerator.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/vanilla-almond-snack-bars/#instruction-step-3"}], "prepTime": "PT10M", "cookTime": "PT20M", "totalTime": "PT2H30M", "recipeYield": ["12", "12 bars"], "recipeCategory": "Snacks", "cookingMethod": "Baking", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "5", "ratingValue": "5"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "SA"}, "datePublished": "2021-03-03", "reviewBody": "Hi everyone. I've been quadrupling / x8ing this recipe and making it about once a month for a little over a year now, so I thought I should leave a comment to let everyone know how great it is. I had never made granola bars before this recipe, and after making these, I never went looking for another variation. They are a staple in my diet and cooking schedule.\r\n\r\nFor my *quadrupled* version, I replace the dates and sunflower seeds with:\r\n- 1 cup dried cranberries (this would be 1/4 cup for original recipe)\r\n- 1 cup chocolate chips (this would be 1/4 cup for original recipe)\r\n\r\nSome tips:\r\n- For making these in bulk: Buy the giant bag of almonds and giant bottle of honey at Costco. These bars are basically pure almond, which are expensive unless you can get the bulk discount.\r\n- They freeze well; I regularly store a half-batch in the freezer for about a month at a time.\r\n- Chop the almonds to relatively fine pieces in your food processor or blender if you want your final bars to really stick together (trade-off: the finer the pieces, the more difficult to cut at the end). \r\n- Leave the almonds in bigger pieces if you want to make it easier to stir the final batch, which is the most labor-intensive component of this recipe (trade-off: the bars may not stick together as well).\r\n- As already mentioned, they get sticky if left at room temperature. Wrap them individually in parchment paper and put them in a large storage bag in the fridge for best results."}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sarah"}, "datePublished": "2022-08-09", "reviewBody": "This recipe is awesome! I've been making a batch (with honey) pretty much every week for the past 6 months. They seem to hold together a little better with raw honey compared to regular honey. I've also tried lots of substitutions of different fruits and nuts, and as long as the weights are about the same as the recipe calls for, they all consistently turn out perfect."}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Kelly S"}, "datePublished": "2023-08-17", "reviewBody": "Its # 7 in the notes! Replace sunflower seeds with 3/4 cup (60g) unsweetened shredded coconut, and add 1 Tablespoon chia seeds. Everything else remains the same."}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Kelly S"}, "datePublished": "2023-08-17", "reviewBody": "I made the cashew coconut variation....so good!! These cookies are irresistible!\u00a0", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "peanut butter rolo cookies", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/08/Rolo-Stuffed-Peanut-Butter-Cookies-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/08/Rolo-Stuffed-Peanut-Butter-Cookies-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/08/Rolo-Stuffed-Peanut-Butter-Cookies.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/take-2-rolo-stuffed-peanut-butter-cookies/", "recipeIngredient": ["1/2 cup (8 Tbsp; 113g) salted butter, softened to room temperature*", "1/2 cup packed light or dark brown sugar", "1/4 cup granulated sugar", "1 large egg", "3/4 cup creamy peanut butter", "1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract", "1/2 teaspoon baking soda", "1 and 1/4 cups all-purpose flour (spooned &amp; leveled)", "24 Rolos"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl using a handheld mixer or stand alone mixer, cream the butter and sugars together. Stir in the peanut butter, egg, and vanilla (in that order). Slowly mix in the baking soda and flour. Do not overmix. Cover and chill the cookie dough in the refrigerator for at least 1-2 hours and up to 3 days.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/take-2-rolo-stuffed-peanut-butter-cookies/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C) and line a baking sheet with a silicone baking mat or parchment paper. Take a 1.5 Tablespoon scoop of the chilled dough and split in half. Stick a Rolo on the bottom half, kind of like a &#8220;cradle&#8221; as shown above. Top the Rolo with the other half of the scooped dough and seal down the sides so that the Rolo is securely stuffed inside. Repeat with the rest of the dough and all 24 Rolos. Bake for 12-13 minutes. Allow to cool completely on a wire rack. Line the bottom and sides of a 9-inch square or 11&#215;7-inch baking pan with parchment paper, leaving an overhang on the sides to easily lift the cooled brownies out of the pan. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/raspberry-cheesecake-brownies/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Slice the butter into Tablespoon-size pieces and melt in the microwave in a large heatproof bowl or in a small saucepan on the stove. (Transfer melted butter to a large bowl if using the stove.) Whisk the oil and granulated sugar into the melted butter. Let it sit for 3\u20135 minutes to slightly cool. Whisk in the eggs and vanilla extract until combined. Add the cocoa powder, flour, and salt and whisk until combined. Batter will be thick. Fold in the chocolate chips. Spread almost all of the brownie batter into prepared pan, reserving about 1/2 cup for top.", "name": "Make the brownie batter", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/raspberry-cheesecake-brownies/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a handheld mixer or\u00a0stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the cream cheese and granulated sugar together on medium-high speed in a large bowl until the mixture is smooth and creamy, about 2 minutes. Beat in the flour, egg yolk, and raspberry preserves. If you&#8217;d like a pinker cheesecake layer, beat in 1 or 2 drops of pink or red food coloring.", "name": "Make the cheesecake batter:\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/raspberry-cheesecake-brownies/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Drop spoonfuls of the cream cheese batter on top of the prepared brownie batter. I recommend tenting the brownies with aluminum foil after about 25 minutes to protect the top from over-browning. Remove from the oven and place the pan on a wire cooling rack. I found that with the 13x9 pan, the baking time was closer to 40 min; I set my timer originally for 30 and tented with foil around the 20 min mark, and I had little-to-no browning on top and they were baked right through after I gave them a little extra time. It\u2019s inexpensive, comes pre-seasoned, works on all types of cooktops, heats evenly, and is made to last a lifetime. (Not sponsored, just a true pan fan!)<br/><br/>This 10.25-inch-diameter, 2-inch-deep size is what I use for\u00a0<a href=\"https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/skillet-pot-pie/\">skillet turkey pot pie</a>,\u00a0<a href=\"https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/frittata-recipe/\">frittata</a>,\u00a0<a href=\"https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/honey-skillet-cornbread/\">honey skillet cornbread</a>,\u00a0<a href=\"https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/skillet-bruschetta-chicken-dinner/\">bruschetta chicken</a>,\u00a0<a href=\"https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blackberry-peach-skillet-cornmeal-cake/\">cornmeal cake</a>,\u00a0<a href=\"https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/flaky-buttermilk-biscuits/\">biscuits</a>, my <a href=\"https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/dutch-baby-pancake-recipe/\">Dutch baby pancake recipe</a>, <a href=\"https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/asiago-bread/\">asiago-crusted skillet bread</a>, and more. Talk about a useful pan to have in the kitchen! ", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}, {"@type": "Question", "@id": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/sea-salt-herb-skillet-rolls/#faq-question-1684766567852", "position": 3, "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/sea-salt-herb-skillet-rolls/#faq-question-1684766567852", "name": "Can I Use Fresh Herbs &amp; Garlic?", "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "Absolutely. I usually use garlic powder, dried rosemary, dried parsley, and dried basil because I have each on hand regularly. However, you can substitute with fresh minced garlic and fresh herbs instead. See recipe details below.", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}, {"@context": "https://schema.org/", "@type": "Recipe", "name": "Sea Salt &amp; Herb Skillet Rolls", "description": "Sea salt &amp; herb skillet rolls are the fluffiest, softest, most flavorful homemade rolls to have with dinner tonight!", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "skillet rolls, sea salt herb rolls", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/sea-salt-herb-rolls-baked-in-skillet-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/sea-salt-herb-rolls-baked-in-skillet-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/sea-salt-herb-rolls-baked-in-skillet-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/sea-salt-herb-rolls-baked-in-skillet.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/sea-salt-herb-skillet-rolls/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 cup (240ml) whole milk, warmed to about 110\u00b0F (43\u00b0C)", "2 and 1/4 teaspoons active dry yeast (1 standard packet)*", "2 Tablespoons granulated sugar, divided", "1 large egg, at room temperature", "1/4 cup (4 Tablespoons; 56g) unsalted butter, melted + slightly cooled and divided", "1 teaspoon salt", "2 teaspoons\u00a0each: dried rosemary, dried basil, &amp; dried parsley*", "1 teaspoon garlic powder (or 2 teaspoons minced garlic)", "3 cups (390g) bread\u00a0flour\u00a0(spooned &amp; leveled), plus more for work surface", "flaky sea salt or coarse sea salt, for topping"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the warm milk, yeast, and 1 Tablespoon sugar together in the bowl of your stand mixer. Cover and allow to sit for 5 minutes. *If you do not own a stand mixer, you can do this in a large mixing bowl and in the next step, mix the dough together with a large wooden spoon/silicone spatula. It will take a bit of arm muscle. A hand mixer works, but the sticky dough repeatedly gets stuck in the beaters. Mixing by hand with a wooden spoon or silicone spatula is a better choice.*", "name": "Prepare the dough", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/sea-salt-herb-skillet-rolls/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the remaining sugar, egg, 2 Tablespoons butter, salt, rosemary, basil, parsley, garlic powder, and 1 cup flour. With a dough hook or paddle attachment, mix/beat on low speed for 30 seconds, scrape down the sides of the bowl with a silicone spatula, then add the remaining flour. Beat on medium speed until the dough comes together and pulls away from the sides of the bowl, about 2 minutes. If the dough seems too wet to a point where kneading (next step) would be impossible, beat in more flour 1 Tablespoon at a time until you have a workable dough. Dough should be soft and a little sticky, but still manageable to knead with lightly floured hands.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/sea-salt-herb-skillet-rolls/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Keep the dough in the mixer and beat for an additional 5 full minutes, or knead by hand on a lightly floured surface for 5 full minutes. (If you\u2019re new to bread-baking, my How to Knead Dough video tutorial can help here.) If the dough becomes too sticky during the kneading process, sprinkle 1 teaspoon of flour at a time on the dough or on the work surface/in the bowl to make a soft, slightly tacky dough. Do not add more flour than you need because you do not want a dry dough. After kneading, the dough should still feel a little soft. Poke it with your finger\u2014if it slowly bounces back, your dough is ready to rise. You can also do a \u201cwindowpane test\u201d to see if your dough has been kneaded long enough: tear off a small (roughly golfball-size) piece of dough and gently stretch it out until it\u2019s thin enough for light to pass through it. Hold it up to a window or light. Does light pass through the stretched dough without the dough tearing first? If so, your dough has been kneaded long enough and is ready to rise. If not, keep kneading until it passes the windowpane test.", "name": "Knead the dough", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/sea-salt-herb-skillet-rolls/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Lightly grease a large bowl with oil or nonstick spray. Place the dough in the bowl, turning it to coat all sides in the oil. Cover the bowl with aluminum foil, plastic wrap, or a clean kitchen towel. Allow the dough to rise in a relatively warm environment for 1-2 hours or until double in size. (I always let it rise on the counter. Takes about 2 hours. For a tiny reduction in rise time, see my answer to Where Should Dough Rise? in my Baking with Yeast Guide.)", "name": "1st Rise", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/sea-salt-herb-skillet-rolls/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Grease a 10-12 inch oven-safe skillet or 9&#215;13-inch baking pan. If using cast iron skillet and it&#8217;s already seasoned, no need to grease it. You can also bake the rolls on a lined baking sheet.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/sea-salt-herb-skillet-rolls/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "When the dough is ready, punch it down to release the air. Divide the dough into 12 equal pieces. (Just eyeball it\u2014doesn\u2019t need to be perfect!) Shape each piece into a smooth ball. Arrange in prepared skillet/baking pan or a couple inches apart on a lined baking sheet.", "name": "Shape the rolls", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/sea-salt-herb-skillet-rolls/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover shaped rolls with aluminum foil, plastic wrap, or a clean kitchen towel. Allow to rise until puffy, about 45-60 minutes.", "name": "2nd Rise:\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/sea-salt-herb-skillet-rolls/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Adjust oven rack to a lower position and preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). (It&#8217;s best to bake the rolls towards the bottom of the oven so the tops don&#8217;t burn.)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/sea-salt-herb-skillet-rolls/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for 23-27 minutes or until golden brown on top, rotating the pan halfway through. If you notice the tops browning too quickly, loosely tent the pan with aluminum foil. Remove from the oven, brush warm rolls with remaining melted butter and sprinkle tops with sea salt. The recipe yields enough pizza dough for two 12-inch pizzas and you can freeze half of the dough for later. Close to 2 pounds of dough total. This recipe is also in my New York Times best-selling cookbook, Sally's Baking 101.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "pizza, pizza dough, pizza crust", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/01/pizza-dough-on-floured-counter-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/01/pizza-dough-on-floured-counter-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/01/pizza-dough-on-floured-counter-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/01/pizza-dough-on-floured-counter.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/homemade-pizza-crust-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 and 1/3 cups (320ml) warm water (about 110\u00b0F/43\u00b0C)", "1 Tablespoon (13g) granulated sugar", "2 and 1/4 teaspoons (7g) Platinum Yeast from Red Star instant yeast (1 standard packet)*", "3 and 1/2 to 4 cups (438\u2013500g) unbleached all-purpose flour (spooned &amp; leveled), plus more as needed", "2 Tablespoons (30ml) extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for greasing\u00a0", "1 teaspoon salt", "sprinkle of cornmeal, for dusting the pan", "extra-virgin olive oil, for brushing", "2 garlic cloves, minced (optional)", "1 cup (250g) store-bought pizza sauce", "4 cups (1lb/454g) shredded mozzarella cheese"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the warm water, granulated sugar, and yeast together in the bowl of your stand mixer fitted with a dough hook or paddle attachment. Cover and allow to rest for 5 minutes. *If you don\u2019t have a stand mixer, simply use a large mixing bowl and mix the dough with a wooden spoon or silicone spatula in the next step.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/homemade-pizza-crust-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the flour, olive oil, and salt. Beat on medium speed for 2 minutes, until the dough pulls away from the sides of the bowl.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/homemade-pizza-crust-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Keep the dough in the mixer and beat for an additional 5 full minutes, or knead by hand on a lightly floured surface for 5 full minutes. (If you\u2019re new to bread-baking, my How to Knead Dough video tutorial can help here.) If the dough becomes too sticky during the kneading process, sprinkle 1 teaspoon of flour at a time on the dough or on the work surface/in the bowl to make a soft, slightly tacky dough. Do not add more flour than you need because you do not want a dry dough. After kneading, the dough should still feel a little soft. Poke it with your finger\u2014if it slowly bounces back, your dough is ready to rise. You can also do a \u201cwindowpane test\u201d to see if your dough has been kneaded long enough: tear off a small (roughly golfball-size) piece of dough and gently stretch it out until it\u2019s thin enough for light to pass through it. Hold it up to a window or light. Does light pass through the stretched dough without the dough tearing first? If so, your dough has been kneaded long enough and is ready to rise. If not, keep kneading until it passes the windowpane test.", "name": "Knead the dough:\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/homemade-pizza-crust-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToSection", "name": "Rise", "itemListElement": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Lightly grease a large bowl with oil or nonstick spray\u2014just use the same bowl you used for the dough. Place the dough in the bowl, turning it to coat all sides in the oil. Cover the bowl with aluminum foil, plastic wrap, or a clean kitchen towel. Allow the dough to rise at room temperature for 60\u201390 minutes or until double in size. (Tip: For the warm environment on a particularly cold day, heat your oven to 150\u00b0F (66\u00b0C). Turn the oven off, place the dough inside, and keep the door slightly ajar. This will be a warm environment for your dough to rise. After about 30 minutes, close the oven door to trap the air inside with the rising dough. When it&#8217;s doubled in size, remove from the oven.)", "name": "Rise", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/homemade-pizza-crust-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 475\u00b0F (246\u00b0C). Allow it to heat for at least 15\u201320 minutes as you shape the pizza. (If using a pizza stone, place it in the oven to preheat as well.) Lightly grease baking sheet or pizza pan with nonstick spray or olive oil. Sprinkle lightly with cornmeal, which gives the crust extra crunch and flavor.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/homemade-pizza-crust-recipe/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "When the dough is ready, punch it down to release any air bubbles. Divide the dough in half. (If not making 2 pizzas, freeze half of the dough for another time. See freezing instructions below.) On a lightly floured work surface using lightly floured hands or rolling pin, gently flatten the dough into a disc. Place on prepared pan and, using lightly floured hands, stretch and flatten the disc into a 12-inch circle, about 1/2-inch thick. If the dough keeps shrinking back as you try to stretch it, stop what you&#8217;re doing, cover it lightly for 5\u201310 minutes, then try again. Once shaped into a 12-inch circle, lift the edge of the dough up to create a lip around the edges. I simply pinch the edges up to create the rim. If using a pizza stone, place the dough directly on baker&#8217;s peels dusted with cornmeal.", "name": "Shape the dough", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/homemade-pizza-crust-recipe/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover dough lightly with plastic wrap or a clean kitchen towel and allow to rest for a few minutes as you prepare your pizza toppings. I suggest pepperoni &amp; green peppers or jalape\u00f1o slices, Hawaiian pizza,\u00a0pesto pizza, spinach artichoke white pizza, or\u00a0homemade BBQ chicken pizza.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/homemade-pizza-crust-recipe/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using your fingers, press dents into the surface of the dough to prevent bubbling. Lightly brush olive oil over the top of the crust. Sprinkle with minced garlic (if using), then spread on 1/2 cup (125g) pizza sauce, and top with 2 cups (227g) shredded mozzarella cheese. leveled)", "1/4 cup (4 Tablespoons; 56g) unsalted butter, cut into 4 pieces", "1 and 1/2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract", "1 and 1/2 cups (188g) all-purpose flour\u00a0(spooned &amp; leveled)", "1 and 1/2 teaspoons baking powder", "3/4 teaspoon salt", "3/4 cup (180ml) whole milk", "6 Tablespoons (85g) unsalted butter", "1 and 1/2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract", "3 large eggs, at room temperature", "1 and 1/2 cups (300g) granulated sugar", "1/2 cup (120ml) heavy cream", "2 Tablespoons light corn syrup", "4 ounces (113g) bittersweet chocolate, finely chopped"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Read the recipe and watch the helpful video above before beginning as there are many little steps that are time sensitive or require cooling.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/boston-cream-pie/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Heat half-and-half in a medium saucepan over medium heat until simmering. Meanwhile, whisk egg yolks, granulated sugar, and salt together in a bowl until smooth. Add flour and whisk until combined. Mixture will be thick. Whisk about 1/2 cup half-and-half into yolk mixture to temper, then slowly whisk tempered yolk mixture into half-and-half in the saucepan. Reduce heat to medium-low and continue to cook, whisking constantly, for 5 minutes as the mixture thickens. (America&#8217;s Test Kitchen instructs for 7-8 minutes, but mine began thickening quickly.)", "name": "Make the pastry cream", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/boston-cream-pie/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Increase heat to medium and cook, whisking vigorously, until bubbles burst on the surface, about 1 minute. Remove from heat and whisk in the butter and vanilla extract until combined. Pastry cream will be thick. Strain through a fine-mesh strainer set over a bowl. Press plastic wrap directly on surface of pastry cream and refrigerate until set, at least 2 hours and up to 24 hours.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/boston-cream-pie/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 325\u00b0F (163\u00b0C). Grease two round 9-inch cake pans, line with parchment paper rounds, then grease the parchment paper. Parchment paper helps the cakes seamlessly release from the pans. (If it&#8217;s helpful, see this parchment paper rounds for cakes video &amp; post.)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/boston-cream-pie/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk flour, baking powder, and salt together in a small bowl. In the microwave or on the stove, heat milk and butter together until butter has melted. Stir in the vanilla extract. Cover loosely to keep warm.\u00a0In a large bowl using a hand mixer or a stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment, whip the eggs and granulated sugar together on high speed until light and creamy, about 4 minutes. Add hot milk mixture and whisk by hand until combined, then whisk in the dry ingredients. Batter will bubbly on top and somewhat thick, similar to pancake batter.", "name": "Make the cake", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/boston-cream-pie/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Divide batter evenly between 2 pans. As the cakes cool, check the pastry cream in the refrigerator. If it&#8217;s too thick, it won&#8217;t easily spread and could tear the cake. I remove pastry cream from the refrigerator about 20 minutes before assembling the cake.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/boston-cream-pie/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "\u00a0 Once cakes are cool, run a thin knife around the edges to release them from the pans. Place bottom cake layer on your cake stand or serving plate. Spread pastry cream evenly on top. Place second cake layer on top and gently press down to adhere to the pastry cream. Refrigerate cake while preparing the chocolate glaze.", "name": "Assemble the cake", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/boston-cream-pie/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Heat heavy cream and corn syrup in a small saucepan over medium heat until just simmering. As it heats up, place chocolate in a heat-proof glass bowl with a pouring spout (I use this 2-cup liquid measuring cup). Once simmering, remove cream from heat and pour over chocolate. Let sit, covered, for 5 minutes. Gently whisk until smooth.", "name": "Make the glaze", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/boston-cream-pie/#instruction-step-9"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour glaze into the center of cake. Spread glaze to the edges of cake allowing it to gently drip down the sides. Refrigerate cake, uncovered, for at least 2 hours (and up to 24 hours) before slicing and serving. If chilling for longer than 2 hours, allow cake to come to room temperature before slicing and serving.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/boston-cream-pie/#instruction-step-10"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover leftover cake\u00a0tightly and store in the refrigerator for 5 days.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/boston-cream-pie/#instruction-step-11"}], "prepTime": "PT4H", "cookTime": "PT30M", "totalTime": "PT6H", "recipeYield": ["10", "serves 10-12"], "recipeCategory": "Cake", "cookingMethod": "Baking", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "80", "ratingValue": "4.6"}, "video": {"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "VideoObject", "name": "Boston Cream Pie | Sally's Baking Addiction", "description": "Completely from-scratch with homemade pastry cream, buttery sponge cake, and shiny chocolate glaze, this classic Boston cream pie recipe is supremely decadent and satisfying.\n\nGet the full recipe: https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/boston-cream-pie/\n\n\u2022 Ask your recipe question or leave a review over on the recipe page.\n\n#baking #recipes #pie\n\n\u2022 More of our favorite recipes: https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/", "duration": "PT3M", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/8KZv6UMzA04?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8KZv6UMzA04", "thumbnailUrl": ["https://i.ytimg.com/vi/8KZv6UMzA04/hqdefault.jpg"], "uploadDate": "2020-04-28T21:00:02+00:00"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Kate"}, "datePublished": "2025-06-10", "reviewBody": "I agree!!"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Kate"}, "datePublished": "2025-06-10", "reviewBody": "It was the most amazing cake I have ever eaten. Line a 12-cup muffin pan with cupcake liners. This recipe yields about 14 to 16 cupcakes, so line a second muffin pan with a few more liners or bake in batches.", "name": "Make the cupcakes", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/classic-chocolate-cupcakes-with-vanilla-frosting/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, baking powder, and salt together in a medium bowl. Set aside. In a large bowl,\u00a0preferably with a pour spout, whisk the oil, sugar, egg, vanilla, and buttermilk\u00a0together until combined. Pour the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients, add the hot coffee/water, and whisk until the batter is completely combined. Batter is thin.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/classic-chocolate-cupcakes-with-vanilla-frosting/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour the batter into the liners, filling only 2/3 full to avoid spilling over the sides. Cupcakes must be completely cooled before decorating.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/classic-chocolate-cupcakes-with-vanilla-frosting/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "With a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter on medium speed until creamy, about 2 minutes. Add the confectioners&#8217; sugar, heavy cream/milk, and vanilla extract. Beat on low speed for 30 seconds, then increase to medium-high speed and beat for 2 full minutes. Taste. Add a pinch of salt if frosting is too sweet. I always add 1/8 teaspoon. Add up to 1/2 cup more confectioners&#8217; sugar if frosting is too thin, or more cream/milk\u2014a Tablespoon at a time\u2014if frosting is too thick.", "name": "Make the frosting", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/classic-chocolate-cupcakes-with-vanilla-frosting/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Frost cooled cupcakes and top with sprinkles, if desired. This time allows\u00a0the strawberries to release their delicious juices.", "name": "Start with the strawberries", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/easy-homemade-strawberry-shortcake/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 400\u00b0F (204\u00b0C). Mix the flour, granulated sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together in a large bowl or in a large food processor. Whisk or pulse until combined. Add the cubed butter and cut into the dry ingredients with a pastry cutter or by pulsing several times in the processor. Pulse until coarse crumbs form. If you used a food processor, pour the mixture into a large bowl.", "name": "Make the biscuits", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/easy-homemade-strawberry-shortcake/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour buttermilk on top. Fold everything together with a large spoon or silicone spatula until it begins to come together. Do not overwork the dough. The dough will be shaggy and crumbly with some wet spots. Pour the dough and any dough crumbles onto a floured work surface and gently bring together with generously floured hands. Have extra flour nearby and use it often to flour your hands and work surface in this step. Using floured hands or a floured rolling pin, flatten into a 3/4 inch thick rectangle as best you can. Fold one side into the center, then the other side. Turn the dough horizontally. Gently flatten into a 3/4 inch thick rectangle again. Repeat the folding again. Turn the dough horizontally one more time. Gently flatten into a 3/4 inch thick rectangle. Repeat the folding one last time. Flatten into the final 3/4 inch thick rectangle.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/easy-homemade-strawberry-shortcake/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cut into 2.75 or 3-inch circles with a biscuit cutter. If using chicken breasts, pound down and cut into strips. If using boneless, skinless chicken tenders (chicken tenders are the lean strips of meat found attached to the underside of chicken breasts\u2014they can also be purchased separately), cut in half lengthwise. Add the chicken strips to the bowl and stir to coat. Cover tightly and marinate in the refrigerator\u00a0for 30 minutes and up to 4-6 hours. The longer, the more flavorful your chicken.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/baked-honey-bbq-chicken-fingers/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 400\u00b0F (204\u00b0C). Beat\u00a0eggs in another shallow dish. Pour Panko breadcrumbs into a third shallow dish. Coat each chicken strip in flour, shaking off any excess. Then, dip in egg and let any excess drip off. Then generously roll in the breadcrumbs, shaking off any excess. Add more Panko to the dish if you are running low. Place the chicken strips on the prepared baking sheet. Spray each with nonstick spray to &#8220;seal&#8221; the breading, which will prevent the breading from staying raw and allows it to bake onto the chicken fingers.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/baked-honey-bbq-chicken-fingers/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for 10 minutes. Turn each piece over and continue baking until the outside is crisp and the centers are cooked through, about 10 minutes more. Baking times may vary, just make sure yours are cooked through. A true anytime treat!", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "dark chocolate raspberry banana bread", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/raspberry-dark-chocolate-banana-bread-4-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/raspberry-dark-chocolate-banana-bread-4-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/raspberry-dark-chocolate-banana-bread-4-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/raspberry-dark-chocolate-banana-bread-4.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/dark-chocolate-chip-raspberry-banana-bread/", "recipeIngredient": ["2 cups (250g) all-purpose flour (spooned &amp; leveled)", "1 teaspoon baking soda", "1/4 teaspoon salt", "1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon", "1/2 cup (8 Tbsp; 113g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "3/4 cup (150g) granulated sugar", "2 large eggs, at room temperature", "1/3 cup (80g) plain Greek yogurt or sour cream*", "2 cups (460g) mashed bananas (about 4 large ripe bananas)", "1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract", "3/4 cup (135g) dark chocolate chips (or semi-sweet)", "1 cup (150g) halved raspberries, tossed in 1 Tablespoon (8g) all-purpose flour to prevent sinking*"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Adjust the oven rack to the lower-third position and preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Lowering the oven rack prevents the top of your bread from browning too much, too soon. Grease a metal 9&#215;5-inch loaf pan with nonstick spray. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/dark-chocolate-chip-raspberry-banana-bread/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the flour, baking soda, salt, and cinnamon together in a medium bowl. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/dark-chocolate-chip-raspberry-banana-bread/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle or whisk attachment, beat the butter and sugar together on high speed until smooth and creamy, about 2 minutes. With the mixer running on medium speed, add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Then beat in the yogurt, mashed bananas, and vanilla extract until combined.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/dark-chocolate-chip-raspberry-banana-bread/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "With the mixer running on low speed, slowly beat the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients until no flour pockets remain. Do not over-mix. Fold in the chocolate chips and floured raspberries.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/dark-chocolate-chip-raspberry-banana-bread/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour and spread the batter into the prepared baking pan. Bake for 60\u201375 minutes, making sure to loosely cover the bread with aluminum foil halfway through to prevent the top from getting too brown. The bread is done when a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean with only a few small moist crumbs. This may be after 70 minutes depending on your oven, so begin checking every 5 minutes around the 60-minute mark.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/dark-chocolate-chip-raspberry-banana-bread/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove banana bread from the oven and allow the bread to cool in the pan set on a wire rack for 1 hour. My parents said it wasn't cooked in the middle. I made it again last night and ended up baking it 30 minutes longer than the recipe calls for to get a toothpick to come out clean. I'm not sure why it took so long to bake, but it was baked through. The texture and density were on point, but for my personal taste I felt like the banana got masked by the chocolate and raspberry combo. It was nice to change things up, but in the future I'll probably stick to more traditional banana bread."}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "3"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Monica P"}, "datePublished": "2025-01-26", "reviewBody": "This was very easy to make. I appreciated the suggestions about using frozen bananas, as I completely forgot to purchase new ones. However the flavor combination was not really for me. I think that's more of a personal taste thing and not a problem with the recipe. Sally\u2019s work has been featured on TODAY, Good Morning America, Taste of Home, People, and more.", "sameAs": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"]}, {"@context": "https://schema.org/", "@type": "Recipe", "name": "Homemade English Muffins", "description": "These honey wheat English muffins are completely homemade from a simple no-knead 8 ingredient dough. Though the dough rises and is ready in about 2 hours, I strongly recommend refrigerating it for at least 6 hours so your English muffins have better flavor. For best success, review recipe notes, video tutorial, and step-by-step photos (below) before starting.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "honey wheat English muffins", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/12/homemade-honey-wheat-english-muffins-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/12/homemade-honey-wheat-english-muffins-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/12/homemade-honey-wheat-english-muffins-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/12/homemade-honey-wheat-english-muffins.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/honey-wheat-english-muffins/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 and 1/4 cups (300ml) milk, warmed to about 100\u00b0F (38\u00b0C)*", "2 teaspoons (6g)\u00a0instant\u00a0or\u00a0active dry yeast*", "3 Tablespoons (64g)\u00a0honey*", "2 Tablespoons (28g) unsalted butter, melted &amp; slightly cooled", "1 large egg, at room temperature", "1 and 1/2 teaspoons salt", "1 cup (130g) whole wheat flour\u00a0(spooned &amp; leveled)*", "2 cups + 3 Tablespoons (280g) bread flour or all-purpose flour (spooned &amp; leveled)*", "cornmeal or semolina flour for handling dough (at least 1/2 cup (60g))"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large un-greased mixing bowl, whisk the warm milk, yeast, and honey together in the bowl of your stand mixer fitted with a dough hook attachment. Cover and allow mixture to sit for about 5 minutes or until foamy on top. *If you do not own a mixer, you can do this in a large mixing bowl and in the next step, mix the dough together with a large wooden spoon/silicone spatula. A hand mixer works, but the sticky dough repeatedly gets stuck in the beaters. Mixing by hand with a wooden spoon or rubber spatula is a better choice.*", "name": "Prepare the dough", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/honey-wheat-english-muffins/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the butter, egg, salt, whole wheat flour, and 1 cup (about 130g) of the bread flour. Whisk to combine. Add 1 more cup (130g) bread flour and beat on low speed for 2 minutes. Dough will be extremely sticky and like a loose batter. Add remaining flour, scrape down the sides of the bowl with a silicone spatula, and then beat on low speed for 1 minute to combine. Scrape down the sides of the bowl again and then fold the dough together a few times with your silicone spatula. Do not be tempted to add more flour. It&#8217;s supposed to be very sticky.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/honey-wheat-english-muffins/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover the dough tightly with plastic wrap or aluminum foil and set on the counter at room temperature. Allow to rise until double in size, about 2 hours. The dough will be sticking to the sides of the bowl and have a lot of air bubbles. You can continue with step 4 immediately, but for absolute best flavor and texture, I strongly recommend letting this risen dough rest in the refrigerator for at least 6 hours and up to 24 hours. Place covered dough in the refrigerator for 6-24 hours. The dough will very slightly puff up during this time, but may begin to deflate after 24 hours.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/honey-wheat-english-muffins/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Line two large baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone baking mats. One is for the shaped uncooked muffins and the 2nd is for baking the muffins.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/honey-wheat-english-muffins/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove cold dough from the refrigerator\u2014no need to bring it to room temperature. Sprinkle a little cornmeal/semolina on the surface of the dough and all over your hands. Have more nearby and use whenever things begin getting super sticky. Grab a small handful of dough, about 1/3 cup of dough or 2.5-3 ounces if you have a kitchen scale, and gently form into a 1-inch thick disc that&#8217;s about 3.5 inches in diameter\u2014doesn&#8217;t need to be perfect\u2014and place onto lined baking sheet. You&#8217;re basically shaping them as you&#8217;d shape hamburger patties. Repeat with remaining dough for a total of about 12. Sprinkle the tops of the shaped discs lightly with more cornmeal and cover to rest for 20 minutes. (Do not extend this time or the muffins will puff too much.)", "name": "Shape the muffins", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/honey-wheat-english-muffins/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Meanwhile, as the shaped muffins rest, get your stove ready. Heat a griddle to medium heat or about 325\u00b0F (163\u00b0C) or use a large skillet or cast iron skillet over medium-low heat. If your griddle/skillet/cast iron is nonstick or seasoned, there&#8217;s no need to grease it. If not nonstick, grease with a little butter. Once greased pan/griddle is heated, sprinkle lightly with cornmeal/semolina flour and begin to cook the muffins in the next step.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/honey-wheat-english-muffins/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a flat spatula, carefully transfer however many muffins can fit on your pan/griddle with at least 2 inches between each because muffins will puff up as they cook. Gently flatten them around the edges with the back of your spatula, being careful to not flatten too hard which would deflate them. Cook for 7-8 minutes and then flip over, gently flatten again, and cook for another 7-8 minutes. (No need to grease or sprinkle more cornmeal/semolina when flipping.) This cook time is a general guideline because griddles/stoves/pans can heat differently and/or unevenly. You want to cook until golden brown on each side and edges seem set. If muffins seem to be over-browning quickly, slightly turn down the stove&#8217;s heat. And, as the muffins cook, you can start preheating the oven (next step). Transfer cooked muffins to the unused prepared baking sheet.", "name": "Read this entire step before starting to cook the muffins", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/honey-wheat-english-muffins/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C).", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/honey-wheat-english-muffins/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for 8-11 minutes or until an instant read thermometer reads the center as 200\u00b0F (93\u00b0C). If you don&#8217;t have an instant read thermometer, cut a muffin open after 8 minutes and if it&#8217;s still extra doughy in the center, return to the oven until baked through. I usually bake them for at least 10 minutes.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/honey-wheat-english-muffins/#instruction-step-9"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove from the oven and cool for 10 minutes on the baking sheet before slicing and handling. To preserve the craggy texture, slice the honey wheat English muffins in half using a serrated knife. Or you can slice around the edges with a regular sharp knife and then pry the two halves apart with a fork. Toast halves in the toaster if desired (taste best that way!) and serve warm with desired toppings such as butter, honey butter, jam, apple butter, or other topping of choice. Muffins can also be used for breakfast sandwiches or eggs Benedict.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/honey-wheat-english-muffins/#instruction-step-10"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Store leftovers covered at room temperature for up to 2 days and then transfer to the refrigerator for up to 3 days. After that, it&#8217;s best to freeze them. Freezing instructions in notes.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/honey-wheat-english-muffins/#instruction-step-11"}], "prepTime": "PT8H45M", "cookTime": "PT25M", "totalTime": "PT9H10M", "recipeYield": ["12", "12 muffins"], "recipeCategory": "Breakfast", "cookingMethod": "Baking", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "319", "ratingValue": "4.8"}, "video": {"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "VideoObject", "name": "Honey Wheat English Muffins | Sally's Baking Addiction", "description": "This video shows how to make honey wheat English muffins using a simple 8 ingredient no-knead dough. Some homemade English muffin recipes call for a round biscuit/cookie cutter, but you don't need it for these-- your hands sprinkled with cornmeal or semolina flour are your best tool.\n\nGet the full recipe: \n\n\u2022 Ask your recipe question or leave a review over on the recipe page.\n\n#baking #recipes #\n\n\u2022 More of our favorite recipes: https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/", "duration": "PT4M", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/5r7DEleU3rI?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5r7DEleU3rI", "thumbnailUrl": ["https://i.ytimg.com/vi/5r7DEleU3rI/hqdefault.jpg"], "uploadDate": "2021-12-31T20:17:21+00:00"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Lynn"}, "datePublished": "2025-01-26", "reviewBody": "Try this! So glad I found your site!!! I'd love more videos on the things you make!!"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "2"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Jill"}, "datePublished": "2025-07-20", "reviewBody": "I gave this recipe a two star because I found key points missing. This is a very big surprise because most of Sally's recipes are perfect. I made this recipe a second time. Here are the modifications. After mixing the dough, I place the dough in another bowl to rise, but a greased the bowl first. This helps the dough not stick to the bowl. I mean the whole point of an English muffin is the nooks and crannies. I also did not use wheat flour or bread flour. Both of those are too dense. I want to nooks and crannies. You have to put cornmeal on your silicone mat heavily where you're going to place the dough to rise. If you don't do this, it just sticks even to the silicone mat. Getting my hands sticky so that the cornmeal really stuck to my hands before transferring them to the frying pan was best. Otherwise they just stuck to my hand and it was terrible. I found frying them at a lower temperature on medium. Low was better otherwise they burned but did not get the rise. I also covered them on the frying pan until they rose and then moved the lid halfway for about a minute before taking the whole lid off. And yes, I found using A tiny bit of butter in the bottom of the pan, even with a nonstick pan helped. The first time I did it they started to burn with the Pan being so high before they even had risen. And now I have nooks and crannies. \r\nAll this being said, as a modification for this particular recipe. Every other recipe I have tried has been spot on. And her croissant recipe is absolutely the best"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "4"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Shelley"}, "datePublished": "2025-12-14", "reviewBody": "I followed your directions exactly and it seems my muffins are quite dense. Using a pastry cutter or 2 forks, cut in the butter until the mixture resembles coarse pea-sized crumbs. Add the water and stir until the flour is moistened. Add 1\u20132 more Tablespoons of water if the dough seems dry. Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured work surface and, using your hands, work the dough into a ball. Flatten it into a thick disc. Wrap the dough disc in plastic wrap or parchment paper and refrigerate it for at least 1 hour, and up to 3 days.", "name": "Make the crust", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/salted-caramel-apple-galette/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Mix the apples, brown sugar, flour, lemon juice, cinnamon, and nutmeg together in a large bowl. Cover tightly and let sit until the dough is ready. I usually cover it and keep it in the refrigerator during this time.", "name": "As the dough chills, prepare the filling:\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/salted-caramel-apple-galette/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone baking mat. Clear some shelf space in your refrigerator because the shaped galette must chill in step 6. (See recipe Note below.)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/salted-caramel-apple-galette/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "On a lightly floured surface, roll the dough into a 12-inch circle\u2014it doesn&#8217;t have to be perfect. Transfer dough to the prepared baking sheet. (You can also roll the dough out right on the parchment paper or silicone baking mat that you are using to line the baking pan. If doing so, lightly flour the parchment paper or baking mat.)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/salted-caramel-apple-galette/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Arrange the apples (and any juices from the bottom of the bowl) into the center of the dough, leaving a 2\u20133-inch border all around them. You can simply spoon the filling on, or arrange the apple slices in a more deliberate design, such as concentric circles. Gently fold the edges of the dough over the filling, overlapping the dough as necessary. Press gently to seal the edges. Brush the crust edges generously with egg wash and sprinkle the crust with coarse sugar, if desired. If desired, drizzle 3 Tablespoons of salted caramel over the filling (not the crust).", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/salted-caramel-apple-galette/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Refrigerate the shaped galette for at least 15\u201320 minutes as the oven preheats (next step), and up to 8 hours. If refrigerating for longer than 1\u20132 hours, cover it lightly. The galette will lose its shape if it&#8217;s not cold when it hits the oven.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/salted-caramel-apple-galette/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 400\u00b0F (204\u00b0C).", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/salted-caramel-apple-galette/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake until the filling is bubbly and the crust is golden brown, about 35\u201336 minutes. The bake time will be slightly shorter, until the fish is completely cooked through.", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}, {"@type": "Question", "@id": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/easy-healthy-dinner-baked-pineapple-teriyaki-chicken/#faq-question-1741167901968", "position": 3, "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/easy-healthy-dinner-baked-pineapple-teriyaki-chicken/#faq-question-1741167901968", "name": "Do I bake this covered or uncovered?", "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "I recommend baking this teriyaki chicken uncovered.", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}, {"@context": "https://schema.org/", "@type": "Recipe", "name": "Baked Pineapple Teriyaki Chicken", "description": "Ready in under an hour, baked pineapple teriyaki chicken is a quick dinner recipe for busy nights. The thick and delicious homemade teriyaki sauce adds tons of fresh, bold flavor\u2014and you control the ingredients, sodium, and spice. Serve with rice or quinoa and vegetables for a wholesome meal.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "pineapple teriyaki chicken, baked teriyaki chicken", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/08/pineapple-chicken-teriyaki-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/08/pineapple-chicken-teriyaki-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/08/pineapple-chicken-teriyaki-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/08/pineapple-chicken-teriyaki.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/easy-healthy-dinner-baked-pineapple-teriyaki-chicken/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 Tablespoon cornstarch", "1 Tablespoon room-temperature water", "1/4 cup (50g) light or dark brown\u00a0sugar", "2\u00a0Tablespoons (43g) honey", "1/2 cup (120ml) soy sauce", "1/4 cup (60ml) apple cider vinegar", "1 garlic clove, minced", "2 Tablespoons minced fresh ginger (or 1/2 teaspoon ground ginger)", "1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper", "4\u00a0skinless boneless chicken breasts (about 2 lbs. total)", "1 cup (175\u2013190g) fresh or canned pineapple chunks*", "optional: chopped scallion/green onion and sesame seeds, for garnish"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Use a fork to whisk the cornstarch and water together in a small bowl. It will be a thick, milky liquid. Combine the cornstarch mixture, brown sugar, honey, soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, ginger, and pepper in a small saucepan over low heat. Whisking occasionally, bring to a boil. Once boiling, stop whisking and allow to boil for 2 minutes, or until the sauce coats the back of a spoon and is the consistency of maple syrup. Turn off the heat and set aside for at least 10 minutes, allowing it to cool and thicken.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/easy-healthy-dinner-baked-pineapple-teriyaki-chicken/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Meanwhile, preheat oven to 400\u00b0F (204\u00b0C). Lightly grease a 2\u20133-quart baking dish, such as a 10-inch baking pan, 11&#215;7-inch baking pan, shallow 9&#215;13-inch pan, or 10-inch cast iron skillet. In the photos, I used this exact pan. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/easy-healthy-dinner-baked-pineapple-teriyaki-chicken/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pat the chicken dry with paper towels. Arrange in the prepared pan. Add the pineapples on top and all around the chicken. Pour sauce on top, then turn the chicken over to make sure every inch is coated in the sauce.
