Beautiful on holiday trays and even better on day 2, this make-ahead recipe includes detailed rolling, cutting, and freezing instructions.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "linzer cookies", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/12/linzer-cookies-1-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/12/linzer-cookies-1-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/12/linzer-cookies-1-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/12/linzer-cookies-1.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/linzer-cookies/", "recipeIngredient": ["2/3 cup (65g) almonds or pistachios*", "1/3 cup (67g) packed light or dark brown sugar", "2 and 1/2 cups (313g) all-purpose flour\u00a0(spooned &amp; leveled), plus more for rolling out", "1/2 teaspoon baking powder", "1 teaspoon ground cinnamon", "1/2 teaspoon salt", "1 cup (16 Tbsp; 226g) unsalted\u00a0butter, softened to room temperature", "1/3 cup (67g) granulated sugar", "1 large egg, at room temperature", "1 and 1/2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract", "1/2 cup (about 150g)\u00a0jam or preserves, such as raspberry or apricot", "2 Tablespoons confectioners\u2019\u00a0sugar, for dusting"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the nuts and brown sugar in a food processor. Pulse into a very fine crumb. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/linzer-cookies/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/linzer-cookies/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter and granulated sugar together on medium-high speed until completely smooth and creamy, about 3 minutes. (Here\u2019s a helpful tutorial if you need guidance on\u00a0how to cream butter and sugar.) Add the egg and vanilla extract, and beat on high speed until combined, about 1 minute. Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl and beat again as needed to combine.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/linzer-cookies/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the flour mixture and the ground nut mixture to the wet ingredients and mix on low speed until combined. It will be crumbly at first, but will come together after a couple minutes of mixing.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/linzer-cookies/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Divide the dough into 2 equal portions, gently flatten into discs, and wrap each in plastic wrap. Chill the discs in the refrigerator for at least 3 hours and up to 4 days.\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/linzer-cookies/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F (180\u00b0C). Line large baking sheets with\u00a0parchment paper\u00a0or\u00a0silicone baking mats. Set aside. If the dough chilled for longer than 3 hours, allow to sit at room temperature for at least 20 minutes before rolling because the dough will be quite hard.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/linzer-cookies/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Generously flour a work surface, as well as your hands and rolling pin. The dough may become sticky as you work, so have extra flour nearby to use as needed. Alternatively, the dough may crack when rolling out. If that happens, wait a few minutes for it to soften up, then try again. The more you work with it, the softer and more manageable it will become. Roll out the first disc of dough to 1/4-inch thickness. Using a 2-inch round or fluted cookie cutter, cut the dough into circles. Re-roll the dough scraps and continue cutting until all is used. Repeat with the second disc of dough. You should have about 64 circles.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/linzer-cookies/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a 1-inch round or fluted cookie cutter, cut a hole into the center of 32 of the circles. Let\u2019s call these 32 cookies the \u201cdonut cookies\u201d because of that center hole.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/linzer-cookies/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Arrange the whole circles and the donut cookies 2 inches apart and on separate baking sheets (because the donut cookies take 1 less minute to bake).", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/linzer-cookies/#instruction-step-9"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake the whole circles for about 11 minutes, or until lightly browned around the edges, and bake the donut cookies for about 10 minutes. Rotate the baking sheets halfway through the bake time. Allow cookies to cool on the baking sheets for 5 minutes. Using a sieve or sifter, dust the \u201cdonut cookies\u201d with confectioners\u2019 sugar, then transfer all of the cookies to a cooling rack to cool completely before assembling.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/linzer-cookies/#instruction-step-10"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Spread 1/2 teaspoon of jam on the bottom of each whole cookie. Carefully top each with a donut cookie and press down gently to create a cookie sandwich.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/linzer-cookies/#instruction-step-11"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Store tightly covered at room temperature for up to 3 days or in the refrigerator for up to 1 week.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/linzer-cookies/#instruction-step-12"}], "prepTime": "PT1H", "cookTime": "PT10M", "totalTime": "PT4H15M", "recipeYield": ["32", "32 sandwiches"], "recipeCategory": "Cookies", "cookingMethod": "Baking", "recipeCuisine": "Austrian", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "16", "ratingValue": "4.9"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Catherine S"}, "datePublished": "2023-03-05", "reviewBody": "Delicious! You should have about 2 cups (packed) crumbs, or 250g. Combine the Oreo crumbs and melted butter together in a medium bowl. Press tightly into the bottom and up the sides of prepared pan. Wrap aluminum foil on the bottom and tightly around the outside walls of the springform pan. This helps prevent leakage.", "name": "Make the crust", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/peanut-butter-butterfinger-cheesecake/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake crust for 10 minutes. Allow to slightly cool as you prepare the filling. Leave oven on.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/peanut-butter-butterfinger-cheesecake/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the cream cheese and granulated sugar together on medium speed in a large bowl\u2014about 3 full minutes until the mixture is smooth and creamy. Add the sour cream, peanut butter, and vanilla, beat until combined. On low speed, add the eggs one at a time, beating after each addition until just blended. Do not overmix the filling after you have added the eggs. Using a rubber spatula or large wooden spoon, fold in 3/4 of your chopped Butterfingers. The rest will be for decorating the top of the finished cheesecake.", "name": "Make the filling:\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/peanut-butter-butterfinger-cheesecake/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "\u00a0If needed for extra visuals, see my\u00a0How to Make a Cheesecake Water Bath; the visual guide will assist you in this step. Boil a pot of water. You need 1 inch of water in your roasting pan for the water bath, so make sure you boil enough. I use an entire kettle of hot water. As the water is heating up, wrap the aluminum foil around the springform pan. Place the pan inside of a large roasting pan. Pour the cheesecake batter on top of the crust. Use a rubber spatula or spoon to smooth it into an even layer. Carefully pour the hot water inside of the pan and place in the oven.\u00a0(Or you can place the roasting pan in the oven first, then pour the hot water in. Whichever is easier for you.)", "name": "Prepare the simple water bath (see note)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/peanut-butter-butterfinger-cheesecake/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for 50-60 minutes or until the center is almost set.* Turn the oven off and open the door slightly. Let the cheesecake sit in the oven for 1 hour. Remove from the oven and allow to cool completely at room temperature. Add confectioners&#8217; sugar, cream, vanilla extract, and salt. Beat on low speed for 30 seconds and then switch to high speed and beat for 2 minutes. Add more confectioners&#8217; sugar if frosting seems too thin; more cream if frosting is too thick; or an extra pinch of salt if frosting is too sweet.", "name": "Make the frosting:\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/funfetti-layer-cake/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "First, using a large serrated knife, slice a thin layer off the tops of the cakes to create a flat surface. Discard (or crumble over ice cream!). Place one cake layer on your cake stand, cake turntable, or serving plate. Using a flat icing spatula or small offset spatula, evenly cover the top with about 1 cup (about 250g) of frosting. Repeat with second cake layer, 1 more cup of frosting, and then the top cake layer. Spread a thin layer of frosting on the top and around the sides as a crumb coat. Run a bench scraper around the cake to smooth out crumb coat. Chill uncovered in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes and up to 3 hours to set the crumb coat.", "name": "Assemble cake + apply crumb coat", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/funfetti-layer-cake/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Spread the remaining frosting all over the top and sides. For best success, read the recipe and recipe notes before beginning.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "pineapple upside down cake, cake", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/03/pineapple-upside-down-cake-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/03/pineapple-upside-down-cake-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/03/pineapple-upside-down-cake-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/03/pineapple-upside-down-cake.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/pineapple-upside-cake/", "recipeIngredient": ["1/4 cup (4 Tbsp; 56g) unsalted butter, melted", "1/2 cup (100g) packed light or dark brown sugar", "8-10 pineapple slices (see note)*", "15\u201320\u00a0maraschino cherries (see note)*", "1 and 1/2 cups (177g) cake flour (spooned &amp; leveled)", "1 teaspoon baking powder", "1/4 teaspoon baking soda", "1/2 teaspoon salt", "6 Tablespoons (85g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "3/4 cup (150g) granulated sugar", "2 large egg whites, at room temperature", "1/3 cup\u00a0(80g)\u00a0sour cream, at room temperature", "1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract", "1/4 cup (60ml) pineapple juice, at room temperature (use leftover from can)", "2 Tablespoons (30ml) milk, at room temperature"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C).", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/pineapple-upside-cake/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour 1/4 cup melted butter into an ungreased 9&#215;2 inch pie dish or round cake pan. (Make sure the pan is 2 inches deep. I recommend this pie dish, which is 1.8 inches deep but I never have an overflow issue.) Sprinkle brown sugar evenly over butter. Blot any excess liquid off the fruit with a clean towel or paper towel. (The wetter the fruit, the more likely the cake could overflow or the topping could seep over the sides when inverted.) Arrange about 6-7 blotted pineapple slices and all the cherries on top of the brown sugar. I like to halve 3 pineapple rings and arrange them around the sides of the pan, too. See my photo and video above for a visual of the arranged topping. Place pan in the refrigerator for a few minutes as you prepare the cake batter. This helps solidify or &#8220;set&#8221; the topping&#8217;s arrangement.", "name": "Prepare topping first:\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/pineapple-upside-cake/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the cake flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together. Set aside.", "name": "Make the cake batter:\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/pineapple-upside-cake/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle or whisk attachment, beat the butter on high speed until smooth and creamy, about 1 minute. Add the sugar and beat on high speed until creamed together, about 1 minute. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a rubber spatula as needed. On high speed, beat in the egg whites until combined, then beat in the sour cream and vanilla extract. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl as needed. Pour the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients. Turn the mixer onto low speed and as the mixer runs, slowly pour in the pineapple juice and milk. Beat on low speed just until all of the ingredients are combined. Do not over-mix. You may need to whisk it all by hand to make sure there are no lumps at the bottom of the bowl. The batter will be slightly thick.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/pineapple-upside-cake/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove topping from the refrigerator. Pour and spread cake batter evenly over topping.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/pineapple-upside-cake/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for 43-48 minutes, tenting foil on top of the cake halfway through bake time to prevent the top from over-browning before the center has a chance to fully cook. The cake is done when a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out mostly clean\u2014a couple moist crumbs are OK. Don&#8217;t be alarmed if your cake takes longer or if the cake rises up and sticks to the foil. (We serve the cake upside down anyway!)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/pineapple-upside-cake/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove cake from the oven and cool on a wire rack for just 20 minutes. Invert the slightly cooled cake onto a cake stand or serving plate. Some of the juices from the topping will seep over the sides\u2014that&#8217;s ok. You can slice and serve the cake warm, but the slices will be messy. I find it&#8217;s best to cool the cake completely at room temperature before slicing and serving. Do not refrigerate the cake to speed up the cooling process because it could end up tasting overly dense.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/pineapple-upside-cake/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover leftover slices and store for up to 3 days in the refrigerator or 3 months in the freezer. Thaw at room temperature. I don&#8217;t recommend freezing the cake as a whole because the topping arrangement doesn&#8217;t thaw very nicely. See make ahead instructions below.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/pineapple-upside-cake/#instruction-step-8"}], "prepTime": "PT25M", "cookTime": "PT45M", "totalTime": "PT1H30M", "recipeYield": ["8", "serves 8-10"], "recipeCategory": "Dessert", "cookingMethod": "Baking", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "280", "ratingValue": "4.8"}, "video": {"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "VideoObject", "name": "Pineapple Upside Down Cake | Sally's Baking Recipes", "description": "This pineapple upside down cake is soft and buttery with a caramelized brown sugar pineapple & cherry topping. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a silicone spatula. On medium speed, beat in the vanilla extract. On low speed, beat the eggs in 1 at a time allowing each to fully mix in before adding the next. After the 3rd egg is added, be careful not to over-mix. Stop the mixer once all eggs are incorporated.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/lemon-berry-yogurt-cake/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour the dry ingredients into the butter/eggs. Bake for 55-70 minutes. Loosely tent the baking cake with aluminum foil halfway through bake time to ensure the surface does not over-brown. Use a toothpick to test for doneness and begin checking at 55 minutes. Once the toothpick comes out completely clean, the cake is done. This is a large cake so don\u2019t be alarmed if it takes longer in your oven.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/lemon-berry-yogurt-cake/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove cake from the oven and allow to cool for 1 hour inside the pan. Lightly flavored with fresh lemon and bursting with sweet mixed berries. \n\nGet the full recipe: https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/lemon-berry-yogurt-cake/\n\n\u2022 Ask your recipe question or leave a review over on the recipe page.\n\n#baking #recipes #lemonberryyogurtcake\n\n\u2022 More of our favorite recipes: https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/", "duration": "PT1M", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/sRFpSUQs_i4?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sRFpSUQs_i4", "thumbnailUrl": ["https://i.ytimg.com/vi/sRFpSUQs_i4/hqdefault.jpg"], "uploadDate": "2021-05-19T13:48:08+00:00"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Violet"}, "datePublished": "2025-10-15", "reviewBody": "Well, Sally, this recipe is a masterpiece!  I baked it on Sunday.  It baked perfectly, turned out of the pan no problem, and looked beautiful.  As soon as it was cool and iced, I tasted it.  Well, meh.   The icing was very lemony, but the cake was not.  I am very generous with lemon zest, always adding more than recipe calls for, and even grating extra and putting it in the oven for a few minutes to dry, and then sprinkling it on top of the cake.  I was so disappointed that I didn't even keep the recipe.  But the next day . . . \r\n\r\nI left it on the counter on a rack overnight and covered just the top and sides with clear wrap.  The next day, Monday, I could taste the lemon in the cake a little bit more.  Then I wrapped it properly and put it into the fridge.  Long story short, by Tuesday, the lemon had permeated that cake and it was delicious.  On Tuesday, it was over the top with delicious lemonness, and I was scrambling for the recipe to print up and file with my 5-star, preferred recipes.  Today, Wednesday, it is even better.  Clearly, this is a cake that benefits from wrapping up and putting into a cool place to age for a couple of days before serving.  Whatever you have to do, do it!  Just be warned:  it is LEMONY.  Exactly the way I like it."}], "datePublished": "2020-01-13", "@id": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/lemon-berry-yogurt-cake/#recipe", "isPartOf": {"@id": 226g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "2 cups (240g) confectioners\u2019 sugar", "6 ounces (170g) white chocolate, melted and slightly cooled (see note)*", "1/4 cup (60ml) heavy cream, half-and-half, or milk, at room temperature", "1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract", "1/8 teaspoon\u00a0salt", "optional:\u00a0fresh strawberries coated with 2 ounces melted white chocolate"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "and allow it to cool completely. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a rubber spatula as needed.\u00a0Beat in the egg whites on high speed until combined, about 2 minutes. Beat in the sour cream and vanilla extract. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl as needed.\u00a0With the mixer on low speed, add the dry ingredients until just incorporated. With the mixer still running on low, slowly pour and mix in the milk *just* until combined. Do not overmix. Whisk in 1/4 cup of reduced strawberry puree, making sure there are no lumps at the bottom of the bowl. Batter will be slightly thick.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/white-chocolate-strawberry-cupcakes/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour/spoon the batter into the liners. Fill only 2/3 full to avoid spilling over the sides when baking. Bake for 20\u201322 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. For about 35 mini cupcakes, bake for about 11\u201313 minutes, same oven temperature.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/white-chocolate-strawberry-cupcakes/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Allow the cupcakes to cool completely before frosting.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/white-chocolate-strawberry-cupcakes/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "When the cupcakes are nearly cool, melt the white chocolate for the frosting: Place chopped white chocolate in a microwave-safe bowl (I usually use a glass liquid measuring cup), and microwave in 20-second increments, stirring after every 20 seconds until completely smooth. Set it aside to cool at room temperature for 20 minutes. (Be sure the melted white chocolate has cooled for 20 minutes, so it&#8217;s still melted but not scorching hot, which would melt the butter.)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/white-chocolate-strawberry-cupcakes/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a blender or food processor, process the freeze-dried strawberries into a powdery crumb. You should have around 1/2 cup. Set aside. In a medium bowl using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter on medium speed for 1 minute. Switch the mixer to low speed and slowly add the confectioners\u2019 sugar and strawberry powder. Stir the cooled white chocolate so that it is smooth, and then add it to the butter/sugar mixture. Switch the mixer to medium speed and beat for 2 minutes until combined and creamy. Add the cream, vanilla extract, and salt. Beat for 1 minute until combined. Taste. Add 1 more Tablespoon of heavy cream/milk if needed to thin out, if desired. Add another pinch of salt if frosting is too sweet.", "name": "Make the frosting:\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/white-chocolate-strawberry-cupcakes/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Frost cooled cupcakes and serve. Add the egg, extra egg yolk, and vanilla extract. The mixture will be thick. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix together until combined. The dough will be soft and slick, yet thick. Fold in the chocolate chips. The chips may not stick to the dough because of the melted butter, but do your best to combine them.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/soft-chewy-chocolate-chip-cookie-bars/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Transfer dough to the prepared baking pan and press into an even layer. Add 3/4 cup (90g) confectioners&#8217; sugar and beat on medium high speed until combined and creamy. Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl as needed. Next, beat in the vanilla extract on medium-high speed until combined. Switch to low speed and slowly add the flour and salt. The dough will look dry and you may not think the flour will fully combine. Once all of the flour is added, turn the mixer up to high speed. The dough will come together. Finally, beat in the chopped pecans, if using.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/snowball-cookies-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover the cookie dough tightly and chill in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes and up to 3 days. (If chilling for 3+ hours, make sure you let the cookie dough sit at room temperature for at least 30 minutes before rolling into balls. The cookie dough will be very stiff after being in the refrigerator for that long.)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/snowball-cookies-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Place the cookies on wire racks to cool completely. The confectioners&#8217; sugar will melt a bit and get sticky; that&#8217;s ok. Once the cookies have completely cooled, roll in confectioners&#8217; sugar again. Pour cream on top and microwave for 3 minutes total, stopping and stirring every 20 seconds. It\u2019s a lot of stirring, but it\u2019s imperative to prevent the caramels from scorching. If the caramel seems too thick after 3 minutes, stir in 1-2 more Tablespoons of cream. Spoon 2 teaspoons of caramel onto the center of each cluster. Set aside as you melt the chocolate.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/white-chocolate-caramel-cashew-clusters/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Melt the chocolate in the microwave or use a double boiler. If using the microwave, place\u00a0chocolate in a medium microwave-safe bowl and microwave for 1-2 minutes, stopping and stirring every 20 seconds until completely melted and smooth. Spoon melted chocolate on top of each cluster, then top each with any crushed cashews (from step 2) and a sprinkle of sea salt.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/white-chocolate-caramel-cashew-clusters/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Allow the chocolate to completely set in the refrigerator for 30 minutes before enjoying. I followed your directions and read all the comments. The only thing I changed was to remove 1 tsp of cream thus making the caramel a bit thicker.  I placed the cookie sheets in the fridge for an hour. When I removed them from the parchment paper I placed each one in a mini cupcake/candy liner. I then stored in a container in the fridge. I used the Kraft bits. It made 65 clusters.  I made another batch and separated the chocolate into two bowls. I added a bit of red gel coloring to one dish and a bit of green to the other. While I did use the crushed cashews and sea salt on the top I also used some edible gold flakes. Very festive. The recipe used for the white cashew clusters was also very good with mixed nuts. My stupid store did not have Kraft caramels (how does that even happen?), so I used the soft Werther's and had to guess as to the numbers. Those are slightly smaller than the Kraft. I would request that the recipe includes the weight of the caramels for this reason, in addition to the count number. Also, I suspect that the people who had trouble with the carmel setting up didn't cook it long/hot enough. I let mine boil up a couple of times while stirring as directed. I had no problem with it setting up or sticking to the parchment, and due to the Werther's probably had less caramel than the recipe called for. Don't let it get to \"hard crack\" temperature though.\r\n\r\nI had never melted chocolate in a microwave, and made a mistake, even though I followed the directions. I used chips. I stirred. I *thought* I was seeing unmelted little chips still but what I was seeing is the white chocolate scortching and re-solidifying. Stir and allow the raspberries to break down, about 4 minutes. Mix in the cornstarch/water. Gently simmer for 3 minutes until the sauce begins to thicken. Set aside and let it cool to room temperature before using. You can also make it 1-2 days ahead of time. Fold strips over filling, alternating each side to resemble a twist or a braid. Fold the bottom end up to seal the filling inside. Repeat with the second half of the dough and the rest of the filling. Cut a corner off the bottom of the bag and pipe the batter into each donut cavity, filling each about halfway.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/baked-pumpkin-donuts/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for 10\u201311 minutes or until the edges and tops are lightly browned. To test, poke your finger into the top of the donut. If the donut bounces back, they\u2019re done.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/baked-pumpkin-donuts/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cool donuts in the pan for 2 minutes then transfer to a cooling rack. Re-grease the pan and bake the remaining donut batter. *For mini donuts, bake in a mini donut pan for 8\u20139 minutes. Cool donuts for at least 10 minutes before icing them.*", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/baked-pumpkin-donuts/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Combine the brown sugar, milk, and butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Stir until the butter has melted and the mixture is smooth. Bring to a simmer. Allow to simmer for 1 minute, then remove from heat and whisk in the vanilla extract and sifted confectioners&#8217; sugar until smooth and combined. Taste, then add a pinch of salt if desired\u2014I always add a tiny pinch. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/salted-caramel-chocolate-chip-cookies/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a medium bowl, whisk the melted butter, brown sugar, and granulated sugar together until no brown sugar lumps remain. Whisk in the egg, then the egg yolk. Finally, whisk in the vanilla extract. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix together with a large spoon or silicone spatula. The dough will be very soft, yet thick. Fold in the chocolate chips. They may not stick to the dough because of the melted butter, but do your best to combine them. Cover the dough and chill in the refrigerator for 3 hours or up to 3-4 days. Chilling is mandatory. I highly recommend chilling the cookie dough overnight for less spreading.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/salted-caramel-chocolate-chip-cookies/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Take the dough out of the refrigerator and allow to slightly soften at room temperature for 10 minutes.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/salted-caramel-chocolate-chip-cookies/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to\u00a0325\u00b0F (163\u00b0C). Line two large baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone baking mats.\u00a0(Always recommended\u00a0for cookies.)\u00a0Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/salted-caramel-chocolate-chip-cookies/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Roll the dough into balls, 1.5 Tablespoons each (I like to use this medium cookie scoop). You&#8217;ll have about 30 balls, give or take. The dough will be crumbly, but the warmth of your hands will allow the balls to stay intact. Make a thumbprint into one dough ball and press the Rolo inside. Cover the Rolo with another dough ball and mold the two dough balls around the Rolo, making sure it is completely wrapped inside. See photo above for a visual. Gently press down on the large cookie dough ball to *slightly* flatten and press a few more chocolate chips on top. Sprinkle with coarse sea salt or flaky sea salt. Put 7-8 balls of dough onto each cookie sheet. Put one cookie sheet into the refrigerator as you bake batch #1. Bake the cookies for 12-13 minutes. The cookies will look very soft and underbaked. They will continue to bake on the cookie sheet.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/salted-caramel-chocolate-chip-cookies/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Allow to cool on the cookie sheet for 10 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely. This recipe is also in my New York Times best-selling cookbook, Sally's Baking 101.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "chocolate mousse pie, mousse pie", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/03/sky-high-chocolate-mousse-pie-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/03/sky-high-chocolate-mousse-pie-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/03/sky-high-chocolate-mousse-pie-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/03/sky-high-chocolate-mousse-pie.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/sky-high-chocolate-mousse-pie/", "recipeIngredient": ["22 regular Oreo cookies (not Double Stuf)", "5 Tablespoons (71g)\u00a0unsalted butter, melted", "8 ounces (226g) unsweetened chocolate, finely chopped (two 4-ounce bars)", "2 Tablespoons (28g) unsalted butter", "4 large egg whites* (120g)", "1 cup (200g) granulated sugar", "1/4 teaspoon cream of tartar*", "2 cups (480g/ml) heavy cream, cold", "6 whole Oreos, crushed into crumbs (68g)", "1 cup (240g/ml) heavy cream, cold", "2 Tablespoons granulated sugar", "1/2 teaspoon pure vanilla extract", "optional: chocolate curls or shavings for topping*"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). In a food processor or blender, pulse 22 Oreos (including the cream filling) into fine crumbs. Pour the crumbs into a medium bowl. Add the melted butter and stir to combine. The mixture will be thick and quite wet. Try to smash/break up any large chunks. Pour the mixture into an ungreased 9-inch pie dish. With medium pressure using your hand, pat the crumbs down into the bottom and up the sides to make a compact, thick crust. Bake for 10 minutes, and then place on a cooling rack to cool completely.", "name": "Make the crust", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/sky-high-chocolate-mousse-pie/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Microwave the chopped chocolate and butter together in a large heat-proof bowl, stopping and stirring every 20 seconds until completely melted. Set aside.", "name": "Make the chocolate mousse layer", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/sky-high-chocolate-mousse-pie/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the egg whites, sugar, and cream of tartar in a heat-proof bowl or the upper pot of a double boiler. Set bowl over a saucepan filled with 2 inches of simmering water. Do not let the bowl touch the water. Whisking constantly, cook the egg white mixture until the sugar has dissolved and the mixture reaches 160\u00b0F (71\u00b0C) on an instant-read thermometer.", "name": "Make the meringue for the mousse layer", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/sky-high-chocolate-mousse-pie/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Transfer the mixture to a heat-safe bowl (if using a hand mixer) or the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment. Beat on high speed until soft, glossy peaks form, about 5\u20136 minutes. See photo above for a visual. Gently fold the melted chocolate into the egg white mixture until combined. Wash the mixer bowl and whisk attachment clean.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/sky-high-chocolate-mousse-pie/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment, whip the heavy cream on medium-high speed until medium-to-stiff peaks form, about 3\u20134 minutes. Gently fold whipped cream into the chocolate mixture. It may seem like a lot of whipped cream, but just keep folding and it will eventually come together. Do not over-mix; it will deflate the mousse. (No need to wash or wipe the bowl/whisk attachment clean\u2014you&#8217;ll make sweetened whipped cream in step 7.)", "name": "Make the whipped cream for the mousse layer", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/sky-high-chocolate-mousse-pie/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a small offset spatula, spread half of the mousse in the cooled pie crust. Sprinkle the crushed cookie crumbs evenly over the top. Top with the remaining chocolate mousse, mounding it in the center to create a dome shape. Place the pie in the refrigerator while you prepare the sweetened whipped cream topping.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/sky-high-chocolate-mousse-pie/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment, whip the heavy cream, sugar, and vanilla on medium-high speed until medium peaks form, about 3 minutes. You want the peaks to be somewhat soft so the whipped cream spreads nicely on the mousse.\u00a0", "name": "Make the whipped cream topping", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/sky-high-chocolate-mousse-pie/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove the pie from the refrigerator and spread the whipped cream on top\u2014keeping that dome shape in the center. Top with chocolate shavings, if using. Refrigerate the pie, uncovered, for at least 4 hours or up to 1 day. Let it sit at room temperature for 10 minutes before slicing and serving. Review the recipe notes and information about safe-to-eat flour before beginning.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "cookie dough, cookies, cupcakes", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/molten-cookie-dough-cupcakes-3-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/molten-cookie-dough-cupcakes-3-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/molten-cookie-dough-cupcakes-3-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/molten-cookie-dough-cupcakes-3.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/molten-cookie-dough-cupcakes/", "recipeIngredient": ["2 and 1/4 cups (281g) heat-treated all-purpose flour* (spooned &amp; leveled)", "2 and 1/4 teaspoons cornstarch", "3/4 teaspoon salt", "3/4 cup (12 Tbsp; 170g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "1 cup (200g) packed light or dark brown sugar", "1/3 cup (80ml) pasteurized egg whites, at room temperature*", "2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract", "1 cup (180g) mini semi-sweet chocolate chips", "1 and 3/4 cups (219g) all-purpose flour (spooned &amp; leveled)", "1 teaspoon baking powder", "1/4 teaspoon baking soda", "1/2 teaspoon salt", "1/2 cup (120ml) whole milk, at room temperature", "1/2 cup (120g) sour cream, at room temperature", "1/2 cup (8 Tbsp; 113g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "1 cup (200g) granulated sugar", "1/3 cup (80ml) pasteurized egg whites, at room temperature*", "2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract", "1 cup (16 Tbsp; 226g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract", "1 Tablespoon heavy cream or milk", "1 teaspoon salt", "3 cups (360g) confectioners&#8217; sugar, sifted", "remaining cookie dough"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a medium bowl, whisk the heat-treated flour, cornstarch, and salt together. Set aside.", "name": "Make the cookie dough", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/molten-cookie-dough-cupcakes/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, beat the butter on medium speed in a large bowl until smooth and creamy, about 2 minutes. Add the brown sugar and mix on medium until light and fluffy, about 3 full minutes. Using a silicone spatula, scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl as needed. Add the egg whites and vanilla extract and mix until fully incorporated, about 2 minutes.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/molten-cookie-dough-cupcakes/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add half of the flour mixture and mix on low just until the powdery texture of the flour disappears, about 15 seconds. Immediately add the rest of the flour mixture and mix until combined. Remove the bowl from the mixer and use a silicone spatula to fold in the chocolate chips.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/molten-cookie-dough-cupcakes/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Freeze or refrigerate the cookie dough for 15 minutes or until the dough is easy to handle. Roll the dough into 12 one-Tablespoon-size balls, place on a plate lined with parchment paper, then refrigerate until step 9. Cover the remaining cookie dough and set aside at room temperature until step 11.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/molten-cookie-dough-cupcakes/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C).\u00a0Line a 12-count muffin pan with cupcake liners.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/molten-cookie-dough-cupcakes/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together in a medium bowl. In a small bowl, whisk the milk and sour cream together until smooth. Set aside.", "name": "Make the cupcakes", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/molten-cookie-dough-cupcakes/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, beat the butter and sugar together on medium speed in a large bowl until light and fluffy, about 3 minutes. Using a silicone spatula, scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl as needed. Add the egg whites and vanilla and beat for 2 minutes, or until the mixture is totally incorporated. With the mixer on low, alternate additions of the flour mixture and the sour cream mixture, starting and ending with flour. Beat for an additional 30 seconds or until the batter appears smooth and creamy.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/molten-cookie-dough-cupcakes/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Fill cupcake liners about 3/4 full. Bake for 16-19 minutes or until the cupcake edges are golden brown and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Remove from the oven and let cool in the pan for 5 minutes.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/molten-cookie-dough-cupcakes/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove cupcakes from the pan and carefully press 1 chilled cookie dough ball into the center of each cupcake. The dough ball might not sit completely flat, so expect a little lump on top. Don&#8217;t worry, you&#8217;ll cover it with frosting. Cool cupcakes completely.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/molten-cookie-dough-cupcakes/#instruction-step-9"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "While the cupcakes cool, make the cookie dough buttercream: Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, beat the butter in a large bowl on medium speed for 3 minutes, or until light, fluffy, and completely smooth. Add the vanilla extract, milk, and salt and beat until combined. Using a silicone spatula, scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl as needed. Add the confectioners&#8217; sugar, then beat on low speed for 15 seconds. Switch to medium-high speed and beat the frosting until super light and fluffy, about 4-5 minutes. The frosting will become lighter in color as air is whipped into it.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/molten-cookie-dough-cupcakes/#instruction-step-10"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Break the remaining cookie dough into quarter-size chunks. "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/vegetarian-shepherds-pie/", "recipeIngredient": ["3 Tablespoons (45ml) extra-virgin olive oil", "1 cup (130g) diced onion", "1 cup (130g) diced carrots", "1/2 cup (65g) sliced celery", "8 ounces (227g) sliced mushrooms", "3 garlic cloves, minced", "1/2 cup (120ml) red wine", "1 teaspoon red wine vinegar (or another vinegar you have on hand)", "3 Tablespoons (50g) tomato paste", "2 cups (480ml) vegetable broth", "1 can (15 ounces/425g) white beans, drained and rinsed", "2 teaspoons chopped fresh thyme leaves (or 1 teaspoon dried)", "2 teaspoons chopped "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To save time, and ensure that the potatoes are still warm when ready to use, boil the potatoes while you prepare the filling in step 2. Place the potatoes in a large saucepan or stockpot, and add enough water to cover, so that the water line is about an inch above the potatoes. Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat to medium-high and boil until soft, about 10\u201315 minutes, depending on the size of your potatoes. Drain the potatoes and set aside.\u00a0", "name": "Cook the potatoes for the topping", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/vegetarian-shepherds-pie/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onions, carrots, celery, and mushrooms and cook, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables begin to soften, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Add the red wine and vinegar to the pan. With a silicone spatula or wooden spoon, stir and scrape up any vegetable bits sticking to the pan. Cook until most of the liquid has evaporated, about 4 minutes. Add the tomato paste, broth, beans, herbs, salt, pepper, and bay leaf and let the mixture come to a boil. (You may need to increase the heat to medium-high to help it along.) Once it starts to bubble, reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer, stirring occasionally, until the liquid has reduced and thickened into a sauce, about 20 minutes. Remove the skillet from heat. Remove and discard the bay leaf, and then stir in the frozen vegetables. If your skillet is not oven-safe, transfer the filling to a greased 2.5\u20133-quart baking dish.", "name": "Cook the filling", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/vegetarian-shepherds-pie/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C).", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/vegetarian-shepherds-pie/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the warm potatoes in a large mixing bowl. Follow your cinnamon roll recipe for preparation and initial rises, but use the freezing instructions below.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally McKenney", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "freeze cinnamon rolls", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/12/baked-cinnamon-rolls-no-icing-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/12/baked-cinnamon-rolls-no-icing-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/12/baked-cinnamon-rolls-no-icing-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/12/baked-cinnamon-rolls-no-icing.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/how-to-freeze-cinnamon-rolls/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 recipe cinnamon rolls (such as these homemade cinnamon rolls)", "Freezer-safe dish (such as this glass dish or a disposable pan)", "Plastic wrap", "Aluminum foil", "Marker to label"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "This is my preferred method because the rolls rise right before baking, which will always give you the softest, fluffiest rolls. If time allows, choose this method. Prepare the dough per your recipe, let it rise, and shape the rolls as your recipe instructs. Place them in a freezer-safe dish. Instead of letting the shaped rolls rise, cover tightly with plastic wrap. Label a piece of aluminum foil with the date (I usually put the use-by date 3 months from now), and some brief baking instructions for yourself. Freeze for up to 3 months. After freezing, thaw in the refrigerator overnight, rise at room temp for 1.5\u20132 hours. Bake at 350\u00b0F until cooked through, around 25\u201330 minutes depending on your recipe.", "name": "Method 1:\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/how-to-freeze-cinnamon-rolls/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "The second method requires you to par-bake the cinnamon rolls before freezing. This method saves you time on baking day since the rises are already done. Shape the rolls per your recipe, place them in a freezer-safe dish, let them rise per your recipe, and then bake for just 10 minutes. They should look set on top, but not browned yet. Cool completely, and then cover with a layer of plastic wrap. Label a piece of foil with the date or use-by date 3 months from now, and some brief instructions for yourself. Freeze for up to 3 months. After freezing, thaw in the refrigerator overnight. Let rise/come to room temperature for around 30 minutes, then finish baking at 350\u00b0F cooked through, around 15-20 minutes depending on your recipe.", "name": "Method 2:\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/how-to-freeze-cinnamon-rolls/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "This method requires the most time upfront, but is the quickest when it&#8217;s time to serve. Fully prepare and bake cinnamon rolls as instructed in your recipe, using a freezer-safe baking dish. However your recipe says to prepare, shape, and bake the cinnamon rolls, follow it. Cool completely, then cover with a layer of plastic wrap. Label a piece of foil with the date or use-by date 3 months from now, and some brief instructions for yourself. Freeze for up to 3 months. After freezing, thaw in the refrigerator overnight. Let rise/come to room temperature for around 30 minutes, then loosely re-cover with a fresh layer of foil, and bake at 350\u00b0F until warmed through, about 20 minutes.", "name": "Method 3:\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/how-to-freeze-cinnamon-rolls/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whichever method you choose, make the icing/topping fresh. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone baking mat. Two large sliced potatoes are usually too crowded on 1 sheet, but it depends on their size. You may need an additional sheet. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/baked-sweet-potato-fries/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Wash and peel the potatoes. Cut off the ends. With a *very*\u00a0sharp knife, cut the potatoes into thin slices about 1/4 inch wide. Place in a large bowl or ziplock bag and toss with cornstarch. You want a nice thin coating. Pour the potatoes into a strainer to get rid of any extra cornstarch. Discard the extra cornstarch out of the mixing bowl, too. Place potatoes back into the bowl and add the olive oil and seasoning(s) of choice.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/baked-sweet-potato-fries/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Line the sweet potatoes onto the baking sheet. Try not to crowd them or else they won&#8217;t bake, they&#8217;ll just steam. Bake for 15 minutes. Remove from the oven and flip. Place back into the oven for 10-15 more minutes. Make sure to rotate the pan to avoid uneven browning. Don\u2019t fret if the edges are a little brown, they will taste more caramelized than burnt.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/baked-sweet-potato-fries/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Turn the oven off and keep the fries inside as the oven cools down for about 30 minutes. Make pie dough the night before because it needs to chill in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours before rolling out and blind baking (next step).", "name": "Pie crust", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/praline-pumpkin-pie/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "On a floured work surface, roll out one of the disks of chilled dough (use the 2nd pie crust for another recipe!). Turn the dough about a quarter turn after every few rolls until you have a circle 12 inches in diameter. Carefully place the dough into a 9-inch pie dish. Tuck it in with your fingers, making sure it is completely smooth. To make a lovely thick edge, I do not trim excess dough around the edges. Instead, fold the excess dough back over the edge and use your hands to mold the edge into a nice thick rim around the pie. Crimp the edges with a fork or use your fingers to flute the edges. You can see me do this in the video tutorial above or in my detailed how to crimp and flute pie crust tutorial.\u00a0", "name": "Roll out the chilled pie dough", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/praline-pumpkin-pie/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 375\u00b0F (190\u00b0C).", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/praline-pumpkin-pie/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Line the pie crust with parchment paper. Crunching up the parchment paper is helpful so that you can easily shape it into the crust. Fill with\u00a0pie weights\u00a0or dried beans.\u00a0(Note that you will need at least 2 standard sets of pie weights to fit.)\u00a0Make sure the weights/beans are evenly distributed around the pie dish. Par-bake the crust for 10 minutes. Carefully remove the parchment paper/pie weights. Brush edges lightly with\u00a0egg wash. Prick the bottom of the crust all over with a fork to create steam vents and return crust (without weights) to the oven for 7\u20138 more minutes or until the bottom is *just* starting to brown.\u00a0(Review this how to par-bake pie crust page if you need extra help with this par-baking step.)", "name": "Pre-bake the crust", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/praline-pumpkin-pie/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the pumpkin, eggs, brown sugar, cornstarch, salt, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, cloves, black pepper, cream, and milk together in a large bowl until completely combined and smooth. If desired, you can use an electric mixer for this step.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/praline-pumpkin-pie/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour filling into warm crust. Bake for 50-55 minutes or until the center is no longer jiggly. It can still be a little sticky in the very center on top, just as long as it no longer jiggles when you lightly tap the pan. During bake time, if you find the edges of the pie crust are browning too quickly, apply a pie crust shield or a ring of aluminum foil to protect it.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/praline-pumpkin-pie/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove pie from the oven and add the topping. I like to make the topping as the pie bakes so I have it ready. Using a fork, mix the pecans and brown sugar together. Drizzle in the honey and mix until combined. Spoon on top of the pie, then *very* gently press it down with a spoon or fork so it sticks on the filling.", "name": "Topping", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/praline-pumpkin-pie/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Return pie to the oven and bake for an additional 15 minutes. Use a pie crust shield to protect the crust from over-browning, if needed.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/praline-pumpkin-pie/#instruction-step-9"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove the pie from the oven and place on a wire rack to cool completely, at least 3-4 hours. If not serving right away, cover cooled pie and store at room temperature for 1 day or in the refrigerator for up to 2 days.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/praline-pumpkin-pie/#instruction-step-10"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Serve room temperature or cold with a sprinkle of sea salt and whipped cream. Line a 12-count muffin pan with cupcake liners. Line a 2nd 12-count muffin pan with 6 liners. (This recipe yields about 18).", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/smores-brownie-cupcakes/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a food processor, grind the graham crackers, to yield about 1 1/2 cups crumbs. Pour into a medium bowl and stir in sugar and melted butter until combined. (You can also pulse it all together in the food processor.) Spoon 1 and 1/2 Tablespoons of crust into each cupcake liner. Press down tightly to create a tight and firm crust. Set aside. (No need to pre-bake.)", "name": "Make the crust", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/smores-brownie-cupcakes/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Melt the butter and chocolate together in a large heat-proof bowl. I microwave in 30-second increments, stopping and stirring after each until melted and smooth. Whisk in the granulated sugar. Allow to slightly cool for 5 minutes before adding the eggs. (So as not to cook the eggs!) Whisk in the eggs, vanilla, flour, cocoa powder, and salt. Batter will be thick. Spoon evenly into each cupcake liner on top of the graham cracker crusts, filling almost to the top of the liners.", "name": "Make the brownie cups", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/smores-brownie-cupcakes/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake brownie cups for 25\u201328 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out with only a few moist crumbs (no wet batter). Mine take around 26 minutes.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/smores-brownie-cupcakes/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove from the oven and allow to cool completely in pans.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/smores-brownie-cupcakes/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place egg whites, sugar, and cream of tartar in a heatproof bowl. Set bowl over a saucepan filled with 2 inches of simmering water. Do not let the bowl touch the water. (You can use a double boiler if you have one.) Whisk constantly until sugar is dissolved, about 4 minutes. The mixture&#8217;s temperature taken with an instant read thermometer should be 160\u00b0F (71\u00b0C). If it&#8217;s not, keep cooking and whisking until thinned out and temperature is warm enough.\u00a0Remove from heat. Add the vanilla extract, then, using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment, beat on high speed for 5 minutes until stiff, glossy peaks form. You can read more about and watch me make this in my separate marshmallow meringue frosting post.", "name": "Make the meringue", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/smores-brownie-cupcakes/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pipe onto cooled brownie cupcakes. leveled)", "3/4 cup (62g) unsweetened natural cocoa powder", "2 teaspoons baking soda", "1/2 teaspoon baking powder", "1 teaspoon espresso powder (optional)", "1/2 teaspoon salt", "1 cup (240ml) canola or vegetable oil", "1 cup (200g) granulated sugar", "3/4 cup (150g) packed light or dark brown sugar", "4 large eggs, at room temperature", "1/3 cup (80g) sour cream or plain yogurt, at room temperature", "2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract", "3 cups (about 360g) shredded zucchini (lightly blotted; see recipe Note) (2 medium zucchini, about .75\u20131 lb.)", "1 cup (180g) semi-sweet chocolate chips (regular or mini)", "1 and 1/4 cups (282g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "3 and 1/2 cups (420g) confectioners&#8217;\u00a0sugar", "3/4 cup (62g) unsweetened cocoa powder (natural or Dutch-process)", "3\u20135 Tablespoons (45\u201375ml) heavy cream (or half-and-half or whole milk), at room temperature", "1/4 teaspoon salt", "1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract", "optional for decoration: chocolate chips and/or chocolate sprinkles"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Grease two 9-inch round cake pans, line with parchment paper rounds, then grease the parchment paper. Parchment paper helps the cakes seamlessly release from the pans. (If it&#8217;s helpful, see this parchment paper rounds for cakes video &amp; post.)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-zucchini-cake/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, baking powder, espresso powder (if using), and salt together in a large bowl. In another large bowl using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the oil, granulated sugar, brown sugar, eggs, sour cream, and vanilla together until combined. Add the zucchini and mix to incorporate. Add the dry ingredients to the batter and beat on medium speed until completely combined. Fold in the chocolate chips. Batter will be slightly thick.", "name": "Make the cake:\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-zucchini-cake/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour batter evenly into cake pans. Bake for around 28\u201332 minutes or until the cakes are baked through. Or you can insert a toothpick into the center of the cake\u2014if it comes out clean, it&#8217;s done.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-zucchini-cake/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Set the cakes on a cooling rack and let cool in the pans for 1 hour. The cakes must be completely cool before frosting and assembling.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-zucchini-cake/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "With a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter on medium speed until creamy, about 2 minutes. Add confectioners\u2019 sugar, cocoa powder, 3 Tablespoons of cream, salt, and vanilla. Beat on low speed for 30 seconds, then gradually increase to high speed and beat until it&#8217;s smooth and creamy. Do not over-whip. Add 1/4 cup more confectioners\u2019 sugar or cocoa powder if frosting is too thin or 1\u20132 more Tablespoons of cream if frosting is too thick. (I usually add 1 more.) Taste. Add another pinch of salt if desired.", "name": "Make the buttercream", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-zucchini-cake/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "First, using a large serrated knife, slice a thin layer off the tops of the cakes to create a flat surface. Top with 2nd cake layer and spread the remaining frosting all over the top and sides. Pipe any leftover frosting on top. (I used Wilton 1M tip.) Sally\u2019s work has been featured on TODAY, Good Morning America, Taste of Home, People, and more.", "sameAs": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"]}, {"@context": "https://schema.org/", "@type": "Recipe", "name": "Sprinkle Slice 'n' Bake Cookies", "description": "Easy make-ahead sprinkle-loaded slice 'n' bake cookies are the perfect party dessert! A floured surface is key to help you handle the cookie dough when rolling into logs. The logs of cookie dough must be chilled in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours or even up to a few days (or even frozen!) so it's really easy to just take them out when you need them, slice, and bake the cookies.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "sprinkle slice & bake cookies, sprinkle cookies", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/funfetti-slice-n-bakes-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/funfetti-slice-n-bakes-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/funfetti-slice-n-bakes-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/funfetti-slice-n-bakes.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/sprinkle-slice-n-bake-cookies/", "recipeIngredient": ["3/4 cup (12 Tbsp; 170g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "2/3 cup (133g) packed light brown sugar", "1 large egg, at room temperature", "1 and 1/2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract", "1/2 teaspoon almond extract", "2 cups (250g) all-purpose flour (spooned &amp; leveled)", "1/4 teaspoon salt", "2/3 cup sprinkles, plus more for garnish", "optional: coarse sugar for rolling", "8 ounces (226g) white chocolate, coarsely chopped*"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl using a handheld mixer or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter for 1 minute on medium speed until completely smooth and creamy. Add the brown sugar and beat on medium high speed until fluffy and creamy. Beat in egg, vanilla and almond extracts on high speed. Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl as needed, and continue to beat until fully combined.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/sprinkle-slice-n-bake-cookies/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Beat in the\u00a0flour and salt on medium speed until fully combined. The cookie dough will be thick and slightly sticky. Switch to high speed and beat in the sprinkles. Add a little more sprinkles if you&#8217;d like a little more (I usually use between 2/3 and 3/4 cup). Turn the dough out onto a floured work surface and, with floured hands, divide into two. Shape each half into an 8-inch log, about 2.5 inches in diameter. The measurements don&#8217;t have to be exact. Tightly wrap the logs in plastic wrap and chill in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours and up to 5 days. Chilling is mandatory for this cookie dough.\u00a0I always chill mine overnight.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/sprinkle-slice-n-bake-cookies/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Line two large baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone baking mats. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/sprinkle-slice-n-bake-cookies/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove logs from the refrigerator and roll in coarse sugar, if desired. Slice each log into about 12\u00a0equally thick cookies and place on baking sheets about 2 inches apart.\u00a0Bake the cookies for 12-14 minutes or until brown around the edges. Allow to cool for 5 minutes on the cookie sheet, then transfer to cooling rack to cool completely.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/sprinkle-slice-n-bake-cookies/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Melt the chopped white\u00a0chocolate in a double boiler or (carefully!) use the microwave. For the microwave, place the chocolate in a medium heat-proof bowl.\u00a0Melt in 15 second increments, stirring after each increment until completely melted and smooth. Dip each completely cooled cookie halfway into the chocolate and place onto a parchment or silicone baking mat-lined baking sheet. Top chocolate\u00a0with extra sprinkles. Place the baking sheet into the refrigerator to help the chocolate set. Once set, enjoy!", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/sprinkle-slice-n-bake-cookies/#instruction-step-5"}], "prepTime": "PT30M", "cookTime": "PT14M", "totalTime": "PT5H", "recipeYield": ["24", "24 cookies"], "recipeCategory": "Cookies", "cookingMethod": "Baking", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "4", "ratingValue": "4.3"}, "video": {"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "VideoObject", "name": "Sprinkle Slice & Bake Cookies | Sally's Baking Recipes", "description": "Easy make-ahead sprinkle-loaded slice \u2018n\u2019 bake cookies are the perfect party dessert. The logs of cookie dough must be chilled in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours or up to a few days (or frozen for even longer), so this is a great make-ahead recipe. For best results, follow the recipe carefully and read through the directions before beginning.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "lemon blueberry vertical cake", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/vertical-layer-cake-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/vertical-layer-cake-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/vertical-layer-cake-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/vertical-layer-cake.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/vertical-cake/", "recipeIngredient": ["all-purpose flour for dusting pan and confectioners&#8217; sugar for dusting baked cake", "4 large eggs, at room temperature", "3/4 cup (150g) granulated sugar", "1 and 1/2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract", "2 Tablespoons (30ml) vegetable oil", "1 cup (125g) all-purpose flour (spooned &amp; leveled)", "1 teaspoon baking powder", "1/4 teaspoon salt", "1 teaspoon cornstarch", "2 teaspoons warm water", "1 cup (140g) fresh or frozen blueberries", "1 Tablespoon lemon juice", "1 Tablespoon granulated sugar", "1 and 1/2 cups (360ml) heavy cream", "3 Tablespoons (20g) confectioners&#8217; sugar", "1/2 cup (8 Tbsp; 113g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "4 ounces (113g) full-fat brick cream cheese, softened to room temperature", "3 cups (360g) confectioners&#8217; sugar", "2 Tablespoons (30ml) lemon juice", "1/2 teaspoon pure vanilla extract", "optional: fresh blueberries for garnish"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "For best success, follow this recipe closely, be prepared with all of the special tools you need (see recipe notes), and watch the video tutorial in the blog post.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/vertical-cake/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Grease a 12\u00d717-inch baking pan with nonstick spray or butter, line it with parchment paper, grease the parchment paper, then dust with a very light layer of flour. (A sifter helps.) Parchment paper helps the cake seamlessly release from the pan. (If it&#8217;s helpful, see this parchment paper rounds for cakes video &amp; post, but note that you&#8217;ll use a rectangular piece of parchment paper for this cake.)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/vertical-cake/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a hand mixer or a stand mixer fitted with whisk attachment, beat the eggs in a large bowl on high speed for 5 minutes until pale yellow and relatively thick. Switch the mixer to medium speed and beat in the sugar, vanilla, and oil just until combined, about 1 minute. Set aside.", "name": "Make the cake", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/vertical-cake/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the flour, baking powder, and salt together in a small bowl. In 2 or 3 additions, sift the dry ingredients over the egg mixture, gently folding together after each addition. You do NOT want to deflate the eggs. Make sure there are no pockets of dry ingredients. Batter is thick and airy.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/vertical-cake/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Spread batter evenly into prepared pan. You&#8217;ll really have to stretch the batter out to fit this pan. It will be a thin layer. Tap the whole pan on the counter a few times to pop any air bubbles on top.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/vertical-cake/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "(As the cake bakes, complete step 7.) Bake for 12-13 minutes or until cake is set and the top springs back when lightly poked with your finger. Do not over-bake.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/vertical-cake/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "As the cake bakes, place a piece of parchment paper (a little larger than the cake) or a thin kitchen towel flat on the counter. Using a sifter, dust with a light coating of confectioners&#8217; sugar.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/vertical-cake/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once the cake comes out of the oven, run a thin knife along the edges to help release the cake, then immediately invert it onto the parchment/towel. Peel off the parchment paper that was on the bottom of the cake as it baked. Using a sifter, dust surface with a light coating of confectioners&#8217; sugar. Starting with the narrow end, slowly and gently roll the cake up with the parchment/towel. The cake will be warm. Allow the cake to cool completely rolled up in the parchment/towel. Place in the refrigerator to speed it up, about 2-3 hours.", "name": "Roll the cake", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/vertical-cake/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "The blueberry sauce must be completely cool before folding into the whipped cream, so make it ahead of time or when the cake is cooling. Mix the cornstarch and water together in a very small bowl. Set aside. Combine blueberries, lemon juice, and granulated sugar together in a small saucepan over medium-low heat. Stir constantly, bursting the blueberries against the sides of the pan. Once the blueberries have released some liquid, add the cornstarch/water. Turn the heat up to medium. Stir and cook for 3 minutes. Remove from heat and allow to cool completely. Mixture will thicken as it cools. I place it in the refrigerator to cool down quicker.", "name": "As the cake cools, make the blueberry sauce:\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/vertical-cake/#instruction-step-9"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove the cake roll from the refrigerator and allow to sit on the counter for a few minutes to warm up as you prepare the whipped cream.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/vertical-cake/#instruction-step-10"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a hand mixer or a stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment, whip the heavy cream and confectioners&#8217; sugar together on medium-high speed until medium peaks form, about 3-4 minutes. Medium peaks are between soft/loose peaks and stiff peaks. Using a spoon or silicone spatula, gently fold in cooled blueberry sauce. If you want blueberry swirls as pictured, don&#8217;t completely combine the two. Only fold together a few times. Place in the refrigerator until ready to use.", "name": "Make the whipped cream:\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/vertical-cake/#instruction-step-11"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Slowly and gently unroll the cake. If you notice the cake cracking, unroll slower and gently press the cracked pieces back together. (Some cracks are fine!) Using a very sharp knife or even kitchen shears, cut the cake into 3 long strips. Cake is about 11 inches wide (it shrinks when baking and cooling), so each strip will be a little over 3.5 inches wide. Spread whipped cream evenly on top of each strip. Working with 1 strip at a time, gently roll the cake strip back up, without the parchment/towel this time. Connect the end of the first rolled strip with the next, continuing to roll and wrap the cake up. See video above if you need a visual for this step.", "name": "Assemble vertical cake", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/vertical-cake/#instruction-step-12"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Turn cake upright on its flattest end and place on a cake turntable for decorating or if you don&#8217;t wish to use a cake turntable for decorating, onto a cake stand or serving plate. Refrigerate covered or uncovered for at least 1 hour or freeze covered or uncovered for 45 minutes. Chilling helps ensure the cake holds its delicate shape.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/vertical-cake/#instruction-step-13"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl using a handheld mixer or stand mixer fitted with a whisk or paddle attachment, beat the butter and cream cheese together on medium speed until creamy and smooth, about 2 minutes. Add confectioners\u2019 sugar, lemon juice, and vanilla extract with the mixer running on low. Increase to high speed and beat for 3 minutes. Add more confectioners\u2019 sugar if frosting is too thin, more lemon juice if frosting is too thick, or a pinch of salt if frosting is too sweet.", "name": "Make the cream cheese buttercream:\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/vertical-cake/#instruction-step-14"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove cake from the refrigerator or freezer. Spread the frosting all over the top and sides. A bench scraper\u00a0and\u00a0small offset spatula are handy for decorating. Some of the whipped cream exposed on the top of the cake will mix with the buttercream, creating beautiful random swirls of purple. Garnish with fresh blueberries, if desired. If you decorated the cake on a cake turntable, use a couple thin spatulas (and a helper!) to carefully lift the cake off the turntable and onto a cake stand or server. (Decorating on a cake board is helpful for this, too.)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/vertical-cake/#instruction-step-15"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before slicing. This helps the cake hold its shape when cutting.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/vertical-cake/#instruction-step-16"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover leftover cake tightly and store in the refrigerator for up to 5 days.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/vertical-cake/#instruction-step-17"}], "prepTime": "PT1H", "cookTime": "PT12M", "totalTime": "PT4H", "recipeYield": ["8", "serves 8"], "recipeCategory": "Dessert", "cookingMethod": "Baking", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "99", "ratingValue": "4.9"}, "video": {"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "VideoObject", "name": "Vertical Cake | Sally's Baking Addiction", "description": "Assembled with vanilla sponge cake, lemon blueberry swirl whipped cream, and lemon cream cheese buttercream, this vertical cake is a beautiful masterpiece! Ideally, something slightly larger is best so that there is enough room when shaking the ingredients together. A simple <a href=\"https://amzn.to/3QPbKpw\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener sponsored nofollow\">canning jar</a> works (and here are some <a href=\"https://amzn.to/4arehwM\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener sponsored nofollow\">nifty tops</a> to make pouring a breeze), or you can use a salad dressing shaker like <a href=\"https://amzn.to/3yl6Gmd\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener sponsored nofollow\">this</a> or <a href=\"https://amzn.to/44OvP4R\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener sponsored nofollow\">this</a>.", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}, {"@type": "Question", "@id": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/homemade-italian-salad-dressing/#faq-question-1715955020929", "position": 2, "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/homemade-italian-salad-dressing/#faq-question-1715955020929", "name": "How long does Italian dressing last?", "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "Once mixed, the dressing lasts for up to 2 weeks in the refrigerator. For longer storage, you can freeze it for up to 3 months. Thaw overnight in the refrigerator before using. (Tip: You can use a <a href=\"https://amzn.to/3wERsYH\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener sponsored nofollow\">silicone ice cube tray</a> to freeze small, individual-sized portions of dressing.
