These mint chocolate chip cheesecake brownies come together with 2 simple batters. Be sure to cool the brownies completely before slicing and serving.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "mint chocolate chip cheesecake brownies", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/03/mint-cheesecake-swirl-brownies-2-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/03/mint-cheesecake-swirl-brownies-2-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/03/mint-cheesecake-swirl-brownies-2-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/03/mint-cheesecake-swirl-brownies-2.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/mint-chocolate-chip-cheesecake-brownies/", "recipeIngredient": ["1/2 cup (8 Tbsp; 113g) unsalted butter", "8 ounces (226g/two 4-ounce bars) semi-sweet chocolate, coarsely chopped*", "1 and 1/4 cups (250g) granulated sugar", "3 large eggs", "1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract", "3/4 cup (94g) all-purpose flour (spooned &amp; leveled)", "1/4 teaspoon salt", "8 ounces (226g) full-fat brick cream cheese, softened to room temperature", "1/4 cup (50g) granulated sugar", "1 large egg yolk", "1/4 teaspoon peppermint extract*", "2 drops liquid or gel green food coloring", "2/3 cup (115g) mini chocolate chips"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Adjust the oven rack to the lower-third position and preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Line the bottom and sides of an 11&#215;7-inch baking pan with parchment paper, leaving an overhang on the sides to easily lift the bars out of the pan. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/mint-chocolate-chip-cheesecake-brownies/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Melt butter and semi-sweet chocolate together in a medium saucepan on medium heat, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and let cool to room temperature, about 15 minutes. You can place the melted chocolate/butter mixture into the refrigerator for a few minutes to speed this up, if desired. Don&#8217;t refrigerate too long, as the butter will start to re-solidify.", "name": "Make the brownie batter first", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/mint-chocolate-chip-cheesecake-brownies/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk sugar into cooled chocolate/butter mixture. Add in the eggs one at a time, whisking after each addition until combined. Whisk in the vanilla, and then gently fold in the flour and salt. Pour batter into prepared pan, reserving about 1/4 cup of batter (doesn&#8217;t have to be exact).", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/mint-chocolate-chip-cheesecake-brownies/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a handheld mixer or\u00a0stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the cream cheese on medium-high speed in a large bowl until smooth and creamy, about 1 minute. Beat in the sugar, egg yolk, peppermint extract, and 2 drops of food coloring until completely smooth, about 1 minute. Feel free to add more green food coloring, if desired. Fold in the mini chocolate chips.", "name": "Make the cheesecake batter", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/mint-chocolate-chip-cheesecake-brownies/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Dollop spoonfuls of the cream cheese mixture on top of the prepared brownie batter. Spoon remaining 1/4 cup of brownie batter on top. Glide a knife through the layers, creating a swirl pattern. Add more mini chocolate chips on top, if desired.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/mint-chocolate-chip-cheesecake-brownies/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake brownies for 30\u201335 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out mostly clean with just a few moist crumbs. I recommend tenting the brownies with aluminum foil after about 20 minutes to protect the top from over-browning. Remove from the oven and place the pan on a wire rack. Cool brownies completely.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/mint-chocolate-chip-cheesecake-brownies/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Lift the brownies out using the parchment paper overhang on the sides. Add the brown sugar. On medium speed, beat until combined, scraping down the sides and bottom of the bowl as needed. Add the vanilla, flour, and salt and beat on low speed until everything is mixed. The mixture will be thick and heavy. Add the milk and beat on low for 30 seconds, then switch to high and beat for at least 2 minutes until combined and creamy. Gently fold in chocolate chips. Set aside.", "name": "To make the cookies:\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/striped-fudge-cookie-sandwiches/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl using a handheld or a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter and sugar together on high speed until completely smooth and creamy, about 2 minutes. Add the egg and vanilla and beat on high speed until combined, about 1 minute. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl and beat again as needed to combine.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/striped-fudge-cookie-sandwiches/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and mix on low until combined. Dough will be a bit soft. If the dough seems too soft and sticky for rolling, add 1 more Tablespoon of flour.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/striped-fudge-cookie-sandwiches/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Divide the dough into 2 equal parts. Place each portion onto a piece of lightly floured parchment paper or a lightly floured silicone baking mat. With a lightly floured rolling pin, roll the dough out to about 1/4-inch thickness. Use more flour if the dough seems too sticky. The rolled-out dough can be any shape, as long as it is evenly 1/4-inch thick.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/striped-fudge-cookie-sandwiches/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Lightly dust one of the rolled-out doughs with flour. Place a piece of parchment on top. (This prevents sticking.) Place the 2nd rolled-out dough on top. Cover with plastic wrap or aluminum foil, then refrigerate for at least 1-2 hours and up to 2 days.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/striped-fudge-cookie-sandwiches/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once chilled, preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (180\u00b0C). Line 2-3 large baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone baking mats.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/striped-fudge-cookie-sandwiches/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove one of the slabs of dough from the refrigerator and, using a\u00a02-inch round cookie cutter, cut into circles. Reroll the remaining\u00a0slab and continue cutting until all is used. Repeat with second slab of\u00a0dough. You should have about 64 circles.\u00a0Using a 1-inch round cookie cutter, cut a hole into the center\u00a0of 32 of them. Let\u2019s call these 32 cookies the \u201cdonut cookies\u201d because of\u00a0that center hole.\u00a0Place the whole circles and the donut cookies on separate baking sheets (because the donut cookies take 1 less minute to bake), placing all cookies 2 inches apart from one another.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/striped-fudge-cookie-sandwiches/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake the whole circles for about 10 minutes, or until lightly browned around the edges, and the donut cookies for about 9 minutes. Rotate the baking sheets halfway through bake time. Remove from the oven. Allow cookies to cool on the baking sheets for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely before assembling.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/striped-fudge-cookie-sandwiches/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place 3 ounces of chopped chocolate for the ganache into a small heatproof bowl. Heat the cream in a small saucepan over medium heat, stirring occasionally. Once cream begins to boil, immediately remove from heat and pour over the chocolate. Stir gently and slowly until the ganache is smooth. Allow it to cool for 10 minutes before adding to cookies.\u00a0During this time, it will slowly thicken.", "name": "To make the ganache", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/striped-fudge-cookie-sandwiches/#instruction-step-9"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once the ganache is ready, spread about 1/2\u00a0teaspoon on each whole circle. Carefully top each with a donut cookie and press down gently to create a cookie sandwich.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/striped-fudge-cookie-sandwiches/#instruction-step-10"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Melt the remaining chopped chocolate in a double boiler or in the microwave in 15-second increments, stopping and stirring after each until completely smooth. Add a splash of vegetable oil or melted coconut oil if chocolate isn&#8217;t thin enough to drizzle. Drizzle over each sandwich. Allow chocolate to set completely, about 30 minutes.", "name": "To make the topping", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/striped-fudge-cookie-sandwiches/#instruction-step-11"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cookies will stay fresh in an airtight container at room temperature for 2 days or in the refrigerator for up to 1 week.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/striped-fudge-cookie-sandwiches/#instruction-step-12"}], "prepTime": "PT1H", "cookTime": "PT10M", "totalTime": "PT2H45M", "recipeYield": ["32", "32 cookie sandwiches"], "recipeCategory": "Cookies", "cookingMethod": "Baking", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "7", "ratingValue": "4.7"}, "video": {"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "VideoObject", "name": "Striped Fudge Cookies | Sally's Baking Addiction", "description": "Delicious homemade striped fudge cookie sandwiches are a nod to the Keebler version and are filled with rich chocolate ganache. \n\nGet the full recipe: https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/striped-fudge-cookie-sandwiches/\n\n\u2022 Ask your recipe question or leave a review over on the recipe page.\n\n#baking #recipes #StripedFudgeCookies\n\n\u2022 More of Sally's baking recipes: https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/", "duration": "PT2M", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/2-Cq5YftlqU?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2-Cq5YftlqU", "thumbnailUrl": ["https://i.ytimg.com/vi/2-Cq5YftlqU/hqdefault.jpg"], "uploadDate": "2021-12-21T14:03:37+00:00"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Lori"}, "datePublished": "2020-05-20", "reviewBody": "I\u2019m going to be making these for a second time. Tap the fork/tool gently on the side of the bowl/measuring cup to let excess chocolate drip off. Use a toothpick to help slide the truffle off of the fork and onto a lined plate or baking sheet; or, if using the candy dipping tool, turn upside down to release. If desired, sprinkle each with flaky sea salt while the chocolate is still wet.", "name": "Coat in chocolate:\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/healthy-dark-chocolate-almond-truffles/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Refrigerate coated truffles for at least 30 minutes to set the chocolate. sugar\u00a0(close to 2 cups)", "100g almond flour\u00a0(close to 1 cup)", "120g room temperature egg whites (around 3-4 large egg whites)*", "1/8 teaspoon salt", "40g sifted granulated sugar or caster sugar (3 Tablespoons)", "1/2 cup (125g) creamy peanut butter", "2 Tablespoons (26g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "1/2 cup (60g) confectioners&#8217; sugar", "1/2 teaspoon pure vanilla extract", "1/8\u00a0teaspoon salt", "optional: 1-2 Tablespoons milk, as needed to thin"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the cocoa powder, confectioners&#8217; sugar, and almond flour in a food processor or blender and pulse or blend\u00a0for 30 seconds until thoroughly combined and fine in texture. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-peanut-butter-macarons/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a completely dry and\u00a0grease-free bowl, beat the egg whites and salt together on medium speed for 1 minute. Switch to high speed and beat *just* until stiff peaks form, about 3 minutes. Do NOT overbeat. Gently fold in\u00a0the sifted granulated sugar, 1 Tablespoon at a time.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-peanut-butter-macarons/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a metal spoon or rubber spatula, fold in the confectioners&#8217; sugar/almond flour mixture until combined. Be very gentle and light-handed while doing so. Once completely combined, the\u00a0mixture will be smooth, sticky, and glossy.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-peanut-butter-macarons/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Let the batter sit uncovered at room temperature for 10-30 minutes. Meanwhile, fit your piping bag with the piping tip. Line 2-3 baking sheets with silicone baking mats\u2014I find bare nonstick sheets and parchment paper difficult to work with; the macaron shells spread more and are harder to remove from the sheet.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-peanut-butter-macarons/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Fill the piping bag with the batter and pipe evenly sized rounds onto the baking sheets\u2014make sure you are holding the bag vertically and close to the baking sheet. While piping, the batter will slightly spread out, so keep that in mind. You want around 2-inch circles. Gently tap the bottom of the baking sheets on your counter to rid any large air bubbles. You can lightly sprinkle a few sprinkles, a dash of cinnamon, or any edible decorations onto the wet round shells at this point.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-peanut-butter-macarons/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Let the piped rounds sit for at least 45 minutes and up to 1 hour.\u00a0This\u00a0is crucial\u00a0to making macarons! The air will will help the rounds set and form a dry shell. They should not be sticky going into the oven.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-peanut-butter-macarons/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 325\u00b0F (163\u00b0C).\u00a0Bake the macarons for 10 minutes, one baking sheet at a time. \u00a0Rotate the pan at the 5 minute mark. The tops should be crisp and the macarons should have formed their signature crinkly &#8220;feet.&#8221; Allow to cool completely on the baking sheet before filling.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-peanut-butter-macarons/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle or whisk attachment, beat the\u00a0peanut butter\u00a0and\u00a0butter together on medium-high speed until smooth. On low speed, mix in the confectioners&#8217; sugar, vanilla, and salt. Increase to high speed and beat until light and\u00a0creamy. Add 1-2 Tablespoons of milk to thin out, if desired.", "name": "Make the filling", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-peanut-butter-macarons/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Fill\u00a0and sandwich two shells together to form the\u00a0macaron cookie. Leftover macarons keep well covered at room temperature or in the\u00a0refrigerator for up to 1 week. Any leftover filling? Cover tightly and store in the refrigerator for up to 5 days. It&#8217;s great on cupcakes.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-peanut-butter-macarons/#instruction-step-9"}], "prepTime": "PT2H", "cookTime": "PT10M", "totalTime": "PT2H45M", "recipeYield": ["40", "40 shells / 20 filled macarons"], "recipeCategory": "Dessert", "cookingMethod": "Baking", "recipeCuisine": "French", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "4", "ratingValue": "3.8"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "1"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Dana"}, "datePublished": "2021-07-18", "reviewBody": "Followed the recipe exactly and they turned out terrible. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a silicone spatula as needed. Beat in the egg whites on high speed until combined, about 2 minutes. Beat in the sour cream and vanilla extract. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl as needed. With the mixer on low speed, add the dry ingredients until just incorporated. With the mixer still running on low, slowly pour and mix in the milk *just* until combined. Do not overmix.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/strawberry-nutella-cupcakes/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour/spoon the batter into the liners. The piece you removed will be the shape of a cone. Spoon Nutella inside each carved out cupcake. Use as much Nutella that will fit. Slice off the pointy end of the &#8220;cone&#8221; piece you removed so that it can fit on top of the filling. Place on top of the filling. You should have around 1/3 &#8211; 1/2 cup. Set aside. With a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter on medium speed until creamy, about 2 minutes. Add the confectioners&#8217; sugar, heavy cream, vanilla extract, and salt. Beat on low speed for 30 seconds, then increase to high speed and beat for 3 full minutes. Divide buttercream in half. Beat 1/3 cup of Nutella into half and the strawberry dust into the other half. If either frosting seems too thin for piping, add an extra Tablespoon of confectioners&#8217; sugar. Add an extra Tablespoon of cream if frosting seems too thick.", "name": "Make the buttercream", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/strawberry-nutella-cupcakes/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "\u00a0Fill a piping bag with a piping tip (I used\u00a0Wilton 1M piping tip for the pictured cupcakes). Add a spoonful of the Nutella frosting, then a spoonful of the strawberry frosting, then continue alternating spoonfuls of frosting until the piping bag is filled. Pipe frosting onto cupcakes. I piped a basic tall swirl. See #2 in this piping tips post about piping a tall swirl. (I have a video tutorial in that blog post if you need a visual.) You really want it packed in tight\u2014as tight as possible. Bake for 20-22 minutes, or until lightly browned on the edges. Remove from the oven and allow to cool completely in the pan set on a wire rack for 1 hour, then transfer to the refrigerator to chill for 1 more hour. This firms up the bars which helps them stay compact. Remove bars from the pan using the overhang on the sides and cut into bars. You can drizzle with chocolate before or after cutting.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-peanut-butter-snack-bars/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Individually wrap each bar in plastic wrap or parchment. Add the vanilla and molasses and mix on high until combined.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/magic-5-cookies/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and mix on low until combined. With the mixer running on low speed, add the chocolate chips, butterscotch morsels, coconut, and pecans.\u00a0Dough will be thick, yet very sticky.\u00a0Chill the dough for 1 hour\u00a0in the refrigerator (and up to 2-3 days). If chilling for longer than a few hours, though, allow to sit at room temperature for at least\u00a030\u00a0minutes before rolling and baking because the dough will be quite hard.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/magic-5-cookies/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). The centers will look very soft.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/magic-5-cookies/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove from the oven and let cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely. "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/4th-of-july-desserts/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 baked and cooled quarter sheet cake (such as vanilla sheet cake)", "1 cup (226g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "4 and 1/2 cups (540g) confectioners\u2019 sugar", "1/3 cup (80ml)\u00a0heavy cream", "2 teaspoons\u00a0pure vanilla extract", "salt, to taste", "1/2 cup (70g) fresh blueberries", "2-3 cups (380\u2013560g) halved fresh strawberries"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake and cool any 9&#215;13-inch quarter sheet cake, whatever flavor you enjoy with vanilla frosting and berries. You can follow steps 1\u20134 for making my vanilla sheet cake, which is the cake pictured. Cool cake completely before decorating.", "name": "Cake", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/4th-of-july-desserts/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "With a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter on medium speed until creamy, about 2 minutes. Add confectioners\u2019 sugar, heavy cream, and vanilla extract. Beat on low speed for 30 seconds, then increase to medium-high speed and beat for 4 full minutes. Add up to 1/4 cup more confectioners\u2019 sugar if frosting is too thin or another Tablespoon of cream if frosting is too thick. Add a pinch of salt if frosting is too sweet. (I add 1/8 teaspoon salt.) Frosting should be extra fluffy.", "name": "Make the buttercream:\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/4th-of-july-desserts/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Spread 2/3 of the frosting all over the cake (I use and recommend an offset spatula), reserving the remaining 1/3 for piping detail. Place whole fresh blueberries and halved fresh strawberries to mimic the stars and stripes on an American flag. Using a piping bag (disposable or reusable) and piping tips, fill in the space between the stars and stripes. I used Ateco 32 piping tip for the piping between the blueberry &#8220;stars&#8221; and Ateco 844 piping tip for the piping between the strawberry &#8220;stripes.&#8221;\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/4th-of-july-desserts/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Slice and serve. Your guests will beg for seconds!", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "blueberry swirl cheesecake, blueberry cheesecake", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/06/Blueberry-Swirl-Cheesecake-10-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/06/Blueberry-Swirl-Cheesecake-10-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/06/Blueberry-Swirl-Cheesecake-10-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/06/Blueberry-Swirl-Cheesecake-10.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blueberry-swirl-cheesecake/", "recipeIngredient": ["2 teaspoons (6g) cornstarch", "1 teaspoon fresh lemon juice", "1 Tablespoon (15ml) warm water", "2 cups (280g) fresh or frozen blueberries*", "2 Tablespoons (25g) granulated sugar", "1 and 1/2 cups (180g) graham cracker crumbs (about 12 full sheet graham crackers)", "1/4 cup (50g) granulated sugar", "5 Tablespoons (71g) unsalted butter, melted", "24 ounces (678g) full-fat brick cream cheese, softened to room temperature", "1 cup (200g) granulated sugar", "1 cup (240g) full-fat sour cream (or yogurt), at room temperature", "2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract", "3 large eggs, at room temperature"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Adjust oven rack to the lower third position and preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Spray a 9-inch springform pan with nonstick cooking spray. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blueberry-swirl-cheesecake/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the cornstarch, lemon juice, and warm water together in a small bowl until the cornstarch has dissolved. Set aside. Warm the blueberries and sugar together in a small saucepan over medium heat. Stir continuously for 3 minutes until the blueberry juices begin to release. Add the cornstarch mixture and continue to stir for another 2\u20133 minutes, smashing some blueberries as you go. The mixture will start to thicken. Remove from heat and put the mixture through a fine mesh strainer into a small bowl (to separate the cooked berries and the juice). Keep separated and set both (the cooked berries and the juice) aside.", "name": "Make the blueberry sauce first:\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blueberry-swirl-cheesecake/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "If you\u2019re starting out with full graham crackers, use a\u00a0food processor or blender to grind them into fine crumbs. Pour into a medium bowl and stir in sugar until combined, and then stir in the melted butter. Mixture will be sandy. Try to smash/break up any large chunks. Pour into prepared pan and with medium pressure using your hand, pat the crumbs down into the bottom and partly up the sides to make a compact crust. Do not pack down with heavy force because that makes the crust too hard. Simply pat down until the mixture is no longer crumby/crumbly. Tips: You can use a small flat-bottomed measuring cup to help press down the bottom crust and smooth out the surface, but do not pack down too hard. For more shaping technique tips, see the graham cracker crust recipe page.", "name": "Make the crust", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blueberry-swirl-cheesecake/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Wrap aluminum foil on the bottom and tightly around the outside walls of the springform pan. Bake the crust for 10 minutes. Allow to slightly cool as you prepare the filling.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blueberry-swirl-cheesecake/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the cream cheese and granulated sugar together on medium speed in a large bowl\u2014about 3 full minutes until the mixture is smooth and creamy. Add the sour cream and vanilla, beat until combined. On low speed, add the eggs one at a time, beating after each addition until just blended. Do not over-mix the filling after you have added the eggs.", "name": "Make the filling:\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blueberry-swirl-cheesecake/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour the filling into the crust. Drop spoonfuls of the smooth blueberry sauce onto the batter.\u00a0 Using a knife, gently swirl as shown in the photo above. If you have leftover blueberry sauce, mix it with the cooked blueberries you set aside. Save for topping the baked cheesecake.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blueberry-swirl-cheesecake/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "\u00a0If needed for extra visuals, see my\u00a0How to Make a Cheesecake Water Bath; the visual guide will assist you in this step. Boil a pot of water. You need 1 inch of water in your roasting pan for the water bath, so make sure you boil enough. I use an entire kettle of hot water. As the water is heating up, wrap the aluminum foil around the springform pan. Place the pan inside of a large roasting pan. Pour the cheesecake batter on top of the crust. Use a rubber spatula or spoon to smooth it into an even layer. Carefully pour the hot water inside of the pan and place in the oven.\u00a0(Or you can place the roasting pan in the oven first, then pour the hot water in. Whichever is easier for you.)", "name": "Prepare the simple water bath (see note)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blueberry-swirl-cheesecake/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for 50\u201360 minutes or until the center is almost set.* Turn the oven off and open the door slightly. Let the cheesecake sit in the oven for 1 hour. Remove from the oven and allow to cool completely at room temperature. Refrigerate for at least 6 hours or overnight (preferred). Loosen the cheesecake from the rim of the pan and remove the rim. Cut into slices and serve chilled. Top with remaining chunky blueberry sauce, if desired. Cover leftover cheesecake and store in the refrigerator for up to 4 days.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blueberry-swirl-cheesecake/#instruction-step-8"}], "prepTime": "PT45M", "cookTime": "PT1H", "totalTime": "PT2H45M", "recipeYield": ["12", "serves 12"], "recipeCategory": "Cake", "cookingMethod": "Baking", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "28", "ratingValue": "4.8"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Mike C"}, "datePublished": "2023-08-26", "reviewBody": "I have made this recipe several times and finally got around to rating it. Everyone I've shared it with has loved it! One thing I have started doing is as soon as I finish pre-baking the crust I start the water bath. By the time I mix the filling and add it to the crust the water bath is warm and steamy. Here are 2 methods to freeze: (1) Store in a tightly sealed freezer-friendly container. OR (2) Refrigerate the freshly made cinnamon butter until solid and then spoon it onto a piece of plastic wrap. Wrap it up tightly with a couple layers of plastic wrap and freeze. After either method of freezing, thaw it in the refrigerator before using. Add the sugar and beat on high speed for 2 minutes until creamed together. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a silicone spatula as needed. Add the egg whites and vanilla. Beat on medium-high speed until combined, then beat in the sour cream. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl as needed. With the mixer on low speed, add the dry ingredients until just incorporated. With the mixer still running on low, slowly pour in the milk until combined. Do not overmix. You may need to whisk it all by hand to make sure there are no lumps at the bottom of the bowl. Add the pumpkin and beat on high until combined. Add the graham cracker crumbs, pumpkin pie spice, cinnamon, and melted chocolate. Beat on medium speed for 2 minutes until everything is combined. The mixture is supposed to be soft and thick. Cover mixture tightly and refrigerate for 1 hour or up to 24 hours. Chilling is mandatory.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/how-to-make-pumpkin-spice-truffles/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Line two large baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone baking mats. You should have around 35 total.\u00a0Chill balls in the refrigerator for 30 minutes or up to 24 hours.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/how-to-make-pumpkin-spice-truffles/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "During the last few minutes of the chilling time, begin melting the chocolate. You can melt the chocolate in a double boiler or the microwave. If using the microwave: place the chocolate in a medium heat-proof bowl. I like to use a liquid measuring cup. Its depth\u00a0makes it easier for dipping the truffles. Melt in 30 second increments in the microwave, stirring after each increment until completely melted and smooth. Let the warm chocolate sit for 5 minutes to slightly cool before dipping. Alternatively, you can temper the chocolate. If tempering, do not place or store truffles in the refrigerator.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/how-to-make-pumpkin-spice-truffles/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove balls from the refrigerator and dip them\u00a0in the chocolate using a dipping tool. When lifting the truffle\u00a0out of the chocolate, remember to tap the dipping tool gently on the side of the bowl to allow excess chocolate to drip off. Top truffles with a sprinkle of graham cracker crumbs, if desired.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/how-to-make-pumpkin-spice-truffles/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place balls back onto the baking sheet after you dip each one. Using a food processor or blender, grind graham crackers into fine crumbs. (Alternatively, you can crush them in a plastic bag with a rolling pin.) In a medium bowl, mix graham cracker crumbs, melted butter, and granulated sugar until combined. (The mixture will be thick, coarse, and sandy.) Press crumbs evenly into each tartlet pan, making sure the crust is tight and compact. Pre-bake crusts for 10 minutes, then let cool.", "name": "Make the crust", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/smores-tartlets/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place chocolate and butter in a large bowl and set aside. Using a wooden spoon, slowly stir until chocolate and butter are completely melted and ganache is smooth.", "name": "Make the filling", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/smores-tartlets/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour the filling evenly into each crust and place each tartlet pan in the refrigerator. Chill at least 2 hours (and up to 1\u20132 days) or until completely firm.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/smores-tartlets/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place egg whites, sugar, and cream of tartar in the heatproof bowl of an electric mixer. Set bowl over a saucepan containing about 2 inches of simmering water (making sure the bowl isn&#8217;t touching the water below). Whisk constantly until sugar is dissolved and egg whites are warm to the touch, about 4 minutes. Transfer the mixing bowl to an electric mixer fitted with a whisk attachment. Beat on high speed for 4\u20135 minutes until soft, glossy peaks form. Add vanilla and beat on high until just combined.", "name": "Just before serving, prepare topping", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/smores-tartlets/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove tartlets from the refrigerator. I live in a very arid environment so I know humidity isn't the problem, but I wonder if altitude is? I live at almost 6,000 feet above sea level. The first time I made it was with the 1/8 tsp of cream of tartar as was cled for in the recipe. It was wet and runny like milk, so I tossed it and tried again. The second time, I used 1/4 tsp of cream of tartar and it made it a little fluffier, but it was still pretty loose so I added about an 1/8 more while beating it. It thickened a little bit but not enough so I put it on the tartlets and put them in my freezer for a few hours and it stiffened up a little bit. It was flat across the top like a melted marshmallow. I let it thaw before we ate it and it was very gooey, but not runny. Even though the topping was a flop, everyone seemed to love it. \r\nNext time I make this, I am going to try 1 tsp of cream of tartar."}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Kristen"}, "datePublished": "2021-03-18", "reviewBody": "Followed the recipe exactly to make mini tarts in mini cupcake liners. Most of the \"work\" is completely hands off as the dough rises. If you\u2019re new to working with yeast, reference my\u00a0Baking with Yeast Guide\u00a0for answers to common yeast FAQs.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "no knead honey oat bread", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/05/no-knead-honey-oat-bread-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/05/no-knead-honey-oat-bread-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/05/no-knead-honey-oat-bread-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/05/no-knead-honey-oat-bread.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/no-knead-homemade-honey-oat-bread/", "recipeIngredient": ["3 cups + 2 Tablespoons (410g)\u00a0bread flour\u00a0(spooned &amp; leveled), divided", "1 cup\u00a0(85g) old-fashioned whole oats\u00a0or\u00a0quick oats (not instant)", "1 and 1/2 teaspoons (4g) Platinum Yeast from Red Star or any instant\u00a0or\u00a0active dry yeast", "1 and 1/2 teaspoons salt", "1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon", "1 and 1/2 cups (360ml) water, close to room temperature at about 70\u00b0F (21\u00b0C)", "6 Tablespoons (128g) honey", "2 Tablespoons (30ml) vegetable oil (or other neutral tasting oil)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large ungreased bowl, whisk 3 cups (390g) bread flour, the oats, yeast, salt, and cinnamon together. Set aside. In a medium bowl or large liquid measuring cup, whisk the water, honey, and oil together. Pour water mixture into flour mixture and gently stir together with a silicone spatula or wooden spoon to combine. Dough will be heavy and very wet/sticky. Do not overwork dough. (Tip: Stir dough by hand. Dough is too sticky for a mixer.)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/no-knead-homemade-honey-oat-bread/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover the dough tightly with plastic wrap or aluminum foil and set on the counter at room temperature\u2014honestly any normal room temperature is fine. Allow to rise for 12-18 hours. (See note if you need to extend this time.) Depending on the size of your mixing bowl, the dough will mostly rise out to the sides of the bowl instead of rising up. Some upward rise is normal if your bowl is on the smaller side. The dough will stick to the sides of the bowl and have a lot of air bubbles. You want it to almost double in size during this time.", "name": "1st rise", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/no-knead-homemade-honey-oat-bread/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Grease a 9\u00d75-inch loaf pan.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/no-knead-homemade-honey-oat-bread/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "After rising, uncover dough and gently fold in remaining 2 Tablespoons (about 20g) of bread flour. Dough is very sticky, but the extra flour makes it more manageable. Pour dough (and any excess flour that is not mixing in) onto work surface. Using lightly floured hands, gently form into a loaf shape, about 8&#215;4 inches. Does not have to be perfect, so don&#8217;t over-think the shape or overwork the dough. Place in greased pan and using a very sharp knife or bread lame (some even use kitchen shears), score the bread loaf with 1 slash down the center or off-center, about 1/2 inch deep. (\u201cScore\u201d = shallow cut.)", "name": "Gently shape", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/no-knead-homemade-honey-oat-bread/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Loosely cover loaf with plastic wrap or aluminum foil and set on the counter at room temperature for 1 hour or until dough rises slightly above the rim of the pan.", "name": "2nd rise", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/no-knead-homemade-honey-oat-bread/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Meanwhile, towards the end of the 2nd rise, preheat oven to 375\u00b0F (191\u00b0C).", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/no-knead-homemade-honey-oat-bread/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "After rising, remove plastic wrap/covering from bread and bake for 50-60 minutes. The loaf will begin to heavily brown on top, so tent it with aluminum foil after 30 minutes. How to test for doneness\u2014give the loaf a light tap. If it sounds hollow, it\u2019s done. For a more accurate test, the bread is done when an instant read thermometer reads the center of the loaf as 195\u00b0F (90\u00b0C). (Tip: Keep in mind that the bread will continue to cook for a few minutes as it cools.)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/no-knead-homemade-honey-oat-bread/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove from the oven and allow bread to cool for at least 15 minutes in the pan set on a wire rack before slicing and serving. Generously spray an 11&#215;7-inch baking pan with cooking spray or line with aluminum foil. Set aside. Melt butter and semi-sweet chocolate in a medium saucepan on medium heat, stirring constantly (about 6 minutes). Remove from heat and stir in sugar. Add in the eggs one at a time, whisking until smooth after each addition. Whisk in the vanilla. Gently fold in the flour and salt. Pour batter into prepared pan, smoothing the top with a knife. Bake for 30 minutes.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/peanut-butter-cup-crunch-brownies-2/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove brownies from the oven and sprinkle the top with the peanuts and chopped peanut butter cups. Refrigerate for 2 hours before cutting into 24 squares. This recipe yields 2 pounds of dough.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "breakfast pastries, danishes, pastry", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/breakfast-pastries-2-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/breakfast-pastries-2-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/breakfast-pastries-2-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/breakfast-pastries-2.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/breakfast-pastries/", "recipeIngredient": ["1/4 cup\u00a0(60ml) warm\u00a0water (between 100-110\u00b0F, 38-43\u00b0C)", "2\u00a0and 1/4 teaspoons\u00a0Platinum Yeast from Red Star\u00a0(1\u00a0standard packet)*", "1/4 cup\u00a0(50g)\u00a0granulated sugar", "1/2 cup (120ml) whole milk, at room temperature (between 68\u201372\u00b0F, 20-22\u00b0C)", "1\u00a0large\u00a0egg, at room temperature", "1 teaspoon\u00a0salt", "14 Tablespoons (196g) unsalted butter, cold", "2 and 1/2 cups (313g) all-purpose flour\u00a0(spooned &amp; leveled), plus more for generously flouring hands, surface, and dough", "2/3 cup filling (see recipe notes for options &amp; cheese filling)", "1\u00a0large\u00a0egg", "2 Tablespoons (30ml)\u00a0milk", "1 cup\u00a0(120g)\u00a0confectioners\u2019 sugar", "2 Tablespoons (30ml)\u00a0milk\u00a0or\u00a0heavy cream", "1 teaspoon\u00a0pure vanilla extract"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To help guarantee success, I recommend reading through the recipe, watching the video tutorial, and reading the explanations below this recipe. (All answer many FAQs.) Do not use an electric mixer for this dough. It&#8217;s best if the dough is folded together with a wooden spoon or rubber spatula since it is so sticky. There is very minimal mixing required.", "name": "Preliminary note", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/breakfast-pastries/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the warm water, yeast, and 1 Tablespoon (6g) of sugar together in a large bowl. Cover and allow to rest until foamy on top, about 5 minutes. If the surface doesn&#8217;t have bubbles on top or look foamy after 15 minutes (it should if the yeast isn&#8217;t expired), start over with a fresh packet of yeast. Whisk in remaining sugar, the milk, egg, and salt. Once these wet ingredients are mixed together, lightly cover and set the bowl aside as you work on the next step.", "name": "Make the Pastry Dough", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/breakfast-pastries/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cut the cold butter into 1/4 inch slices and add to a food processor or blender. Top with 2 and 1/2 cups flour. Pulse the mixture 12-15 times, until butter is crumbled into pea-size bits. See photo below for a visual. Using a food processor or blender is best for this dough. Keeping that in mind, if you don&#8217;t have one, you can use a pastry cutter to work in the butter.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/breakfast-pastries/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour the flour mixture into the wet yeast mixture. Very gently fold everything together using a rubber spatula or wooden spoon. Fold *just until* the dry ingredients are moistened. The butter must remain in pieces and crumbles, which creates a flaky pastry. Turn the sticky dough out onto a large piece of plastic wrap, parchment paper, aluminum foil, or into any container you can tightly cover.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/breakfast-pastries/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Wrap the dough/cover up tightly and refrigerate for at least 4 hours and up to 48 hours.", "name": "1st Refrigeration", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/breakfast-pastries/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Take the dough out of the refrigerator to begin the \u201crolling and folding\u201d process. If the dough sat for more than 4 hours, it may have slightly puffed up and that&#8217;s ok. (It will deflate as you shape it, which is also ok.) Very generously flour a work surface. The dough is very sticky, so make sure you have more flour nearby as you roll and fold. Using the palm of your hands, gently flatten the dough into a small square. Using a rolling pin, roll out into a 15&#215;8 inch rectangle. When needed, flour the work surface and dough as you are rolling. Fold the dough into thirds as if it were a business letter. (See photos and video tutorial.) Turn it clockwise and roll it out into a 15 inch long rectangle again. Then, fold into thirds again. Turn it clockwise. You\u2019ll repeat rolling and folding 1 more time for a total of 3 times.", "name": "Roll &amp; Fold", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/breakfast-pastries/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Wrap up/seal tightly and refrigerate for at least 1 hour and up to 24 hours. You can also freeze the dough at this point. See freezing instructions.", "name": "2nd Refrigeration", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/breakfast-pastries/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Line two large baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone baking mats. Rimmed baking sheets are best because butter may leak from the dough as it bakes. If you don&#8217;t have rimmed baking sheets, when it&#8217;s time to preheat the oven, place another baking sheet on the oven rack below to catch any butter that may drip.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/breakfast-pastries/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Take the dough out of the refrigerator and cut it in half. (You can freeze half of the dough at this point, use the freezing instructions below.)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/breakfast-pastries/#instruction-step-9"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cut the first half of dough into 8 even pieces. This will be about 1/4 cup of dough per pastry. Roll each into balls. Flatten each into a 2.5 inch circle. Use your fingers to create a lip around the edges. See photos and video tutorial if needed. Press the center down to flatten the center as much as you can so you can fit the filling inside. (Center puffs up as it bakes.) Arrange pastries 3 inches apart on a lined baking sheet. Repeat with second half of dough.", "name": "Shape into rounds", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/breakfast-pastries/#instruction-step-10"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Spoon 2 teaspoons of fruity filling or 1 Tablespoon of cheese filling inside each.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/breakfast-pastries/#instruction-step-11"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the egg wash ingredients together. The powdered coffee creamer is a non-negotiable in the filling, because it adds a creamy-like texture. Top the soft and sprinkle-loaded rolls with vanilla or cream cheese icing. You can make the birthday rolls within a few hours, or get started the night before using the overnight option in the Note below.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "cake batter cinnamon rolls, birthday cinnamon rolls", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/09/funfetti-birthday-cake-cinnamon-rolls-3-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/09/funfetti-birthday-cake-cinnamon-rolls-3-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/09/funfetti-birthday-cake-cinnamon-rolls-3-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/09/funfetti-birthday-cake-cinnamon-rolls-3.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cake-batter-cinnamon-rolls-without-cake-mix/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 cup (240ml) whole milk, warmed to about 100\u00b0F (38\u00b0C)", "2/3 cup (135g) granulated sugar, divided", "1 and 1/2 Tablespoons (14g) active dry or instant yeast (2 standard size packets)*", "1/2 cup (113g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature and cut into 4 pieces", "2 large eggs, at room temperature", "1/2 teaspoon pure vanilla extract or vanilla bean paste", "1/2 teaspoon salt", "4 and 1/2 cups (563g) all-purpose flour or bread flour (spooned &amp; leveled), plus more as needed", "2 teaspoons canola, vegetable, or olive oil for bowl (or use nonstick spray)", "1/2 cup (113g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature &amp; divided", "2/3 cup (84g) all-purpose flour (spooned &amp; leveled)", "1/4 cup (50g) granulated sugar", "1/4 cup (50g) packed light or dark brown sugar", "2 Tablespoons (16g) powdered coffee creamer or nonfat instant dry milk (do *not* omit)", "1/4 teaspoon salt", "1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract", "1/2 cup (85g) rainbow sprinkles (not nonpareils)", "2 teaspoons ground cinnamon", "4 ounces (113g) full-fat brick cream cheese, softened to room temperature", "1 cup (120g) confectioners&#8217; sugar", "1 Tablespoon (30ml) whole milk or heavy cream", "1/2 teaspoon pure vanilla extract or vanilla bean paste", "optional: extra sprinkles for garnish"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the warm milk, 2 Tablespoons sugar, and the yeast together in the bowl of your stand mixer fitted with a dough hook or paddle attachment. Cover and allow mixture to sit for about 5 minutes or until foamy on top. *If you do not own a mixer, you can do this in a large mixing bowl and in the next step, mix the dough together with a large wooden spoon/silicone spatula. It will take a bit of arm muscle. A hand mixer works, but the sticky dough repeatedly gets stuck in the beaters. Mixing by hand with a wooden spoon or silicone spatula is a better choice.*", "name": "Prepare the dough", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cake-batter-cinnamon-rolls-without-cake-mix/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "On medium speed, beat in the remaining sugar (which should be 1/2 cup/100g) and the softened butter until it is slightly broken up. Add the eggs, vanilla, and salt and beat on medium speed until combined. The butter won&#8217;t really be mixing into the mixture, so don&#8217;t be alarmed if it stays in pieces. Switch the mixer down to low speed and with it running, add 1 cup of flour at a time, making sure it&#8217;s fully incorporated before adding the next. After 4 cups have been added, add the last 1/2 cup and beat until the dough comes together and pulls away from the sides of the bowl, about 3 minutes. Dough will be soft.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cake-batter-cinnamon-rolls-without-cake-mix/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Keep the dough in the mixer (and switch to the dough hook if you used the paddle) and beat for an additional 5 full minutes, or knead by hand on a lightly floured surface for 5 full minutes. (If you\u2019re new to bread-baking, my How to Knead Dough video tutorial can help here.) If the dough becomes too sticky during the kneading process, sprinkle 1 teaspoon of flour at a time on the dough or on the work surface/in the bowl to make a soft, slightly tacky dough. Do not add more flour than you need because you do not want a dry dough. After kneading, the dough should still feel a little soft. Poke it with your finger\u2014if it slowly bounces back, your dough is ready to rise. You can also do a \u201cwindowpane test\u201d to see if your dough has been kneaded long enough: tear off a small (roughly golfball-size) piece of dough and gently stretch it out until it\u2019s thin enough for light to pass through it. Hold it up to a window or light. Does light pass through the stretched dough without the dough tearing first? If so, your dough has been kneaded long enough and is ready to rise. If not, keep kneading until it passes the windowpane test.", "name": "Knead the dough", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cake-batter-cinnamon-rolls-without-cake-mix/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Lightly grease a large bowl with oil or use nonstick spray. Place the dough in the bowl, turning it to coat all sides in the oil. Cover the bowl with aluminum foil, plastic wrap, or a clean kitchen towel. Allow the dough to rise in a relatively warm environment for 2 hours or until double in size. (I always let it rise on the counter and it takes about 2 hours. For a tiny reduction in rise time, see my answer to Where Should Dough Rise?\u00a0in my\u00a0Baking with Yeast Guide.)", "name": "1st Rise", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cake-batter-cinnamon-rolls-without-cake-mix/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Grease the bottom and sides of a metal or glass 9&#215;13-inch baking dish or line with parchment paper.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cake-batter-cinnamon-rolls-without-cake-mix/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Punch down the dough to release the air. Place dough on a lightly floured work surface and using a lightly floured rolling pin, roll dough into a 12&#215;18-inch rectangle. Make sure the dough is smooth and evenly thick. If the dough keeps shrinking as you roll it out, stop what you&#8217;re doing, cover it lightly, and let it rest for 10 minutes to relax the gluten. When you return to the dough, it should stretch out much easier.", "name": "Roll out the dough", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cake-batter-cinnamon-rolls-without-cake-mix/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Melt 2 Tablespoons (28g) of the butter. Reserve the rest for step 8. Whisk the flour, sugar, brown sugar, powdered coffee creamer, and salt together. Using a fork, mix in the melted butter and the vanilla extract until crumbly. Mix in the sprinkles. (*You will use the cinnamon in the next step.*)", "name": "Make the filling", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cake-batter-cinnamon-rolls-without-cake-mix/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Spread dough with the remaining butter (6 Tablespoons). Sprinkle evenly with the cinnamon, and then the sprinkle filling mixture evenly on top. Tightly roll up the dough to form an 18-inch-long log. With an extra sharp knife, cut into 12 even rolls, about 1.5 inches each. Arrange in the prepared baking pan.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cake-batter-cinnamon-rolls-without-cake-mix/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover the rolls tightly and allow to rise until puffy, about 1 hour. (Or use the overnight option in the Notes below.)", "name": "2nd Rise", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cake-batter-cinnamon-rolls-without-cake-mix/#instruction-step-9"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C).", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cake-batter-cinnamon-rolls-without-cake-mix/#instruction-step-10"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for about 25\u201328 minutes or until they are lightly browned on top. About halfway through baking time, tent a piece of aluminum foil over the pan to prevent the tops from browning too quickly. Remove pan from the oven and place pan on a wire rack for about 10 minutes as you make the icing.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cake-batter-cinnamon-rolls-without-cake-mix/#instruction-step-11"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a medium bowl using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle or whisk attachment, beat the cream cheese on medium speed until smooth and creamy. Add the confectioners&#8217; sugar, cream/milk, and vanilla. Beat on low speed for 30 seconds, then switch to high speed and beat for 1 minute. Spread the icing over the warm rolls, garnish with extra sprinkles if desired, and serve immediately.", "name": "Make the icing", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cake-batter-cinnamon-rolls-without-cake-mix/#instruction-step-12"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover leftover frosted or unfrosted rolls tightly and store at room temperature for up to 2 days or in the refrigerator for up to 5 days.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cake-batter-cinnamon-rolls-without-cake-mix/#instruction-step-13"}], "prepTime": "PT3H30M", "cookTime": "PT25M", "totalTime": "PT4H", "recipeYield": ["12", "12 rolls"], "recipeCategory": "Breakfast", "cookingMethod": "Baking", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "13", "ratingValue": "4.8"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "okidoki"}, "datePublished": "2025-01-27", "reviewBody": "amazing recipe . Add more confectioners&#8217; sugar if frosting is too thin or more cream if frosting is too thick. Add a pinch of salt if frosting is too sweet. Add the granulated sugar and lemon zest and beat on high speed for 3 minutes until creamed. (Here\u2019s a helpful tutorial if you need guidance on\u00a0how to cream butter and sugar.) Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl as needed. Add the oil and mix on medium speed to combine. With the mixer running on low speed, add the eggs one at a time, then add sour cream and the vanilla and coconut extracts. Beat on medium-high speed until combined. You can also leave off the sugared cranberries.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "pumpkin pie", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/10/great-pumpkin-pie-2-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/10/great-pumpkin-pie-2-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/10/great-pumpkin-pie-2-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/10/great-pumpkin-pie-2.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/the-great-pumpkin-pie-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 cup (100g) fresh cranberries (do not use frozen)", "3/4 cup (180ml) water", "1 and 1/4 cups (250g) granulated sugar, divided", "Homemade Pie Dough\u00a0(full recipe makes 2 crusts: 1 for bottom, 1 for leaf decor)", "egg wash: 1 large egg beaten with 1 Tablespoon\u00a0milk", "one 15-ounce can (425g) pumpkin puree*", "3 large eggs", "1 and 1/4 cups (250g) packed light or dark brown sugar", "1 Tablespoon (8g) cornstarch", "1/2 teaspoon salt", "1 and 1/2 teaspoons ground cinnamon", "1/2 teaspoon ground ginger*", "1/4 teaspoon ground or freshly grated nutmeg*", "1/8 teaspoon ground cloves*", "1/8 teaspoon fresh ground black pepper", "1 cup (240ml) heavy cream", "1/4 cup (60ml) milk"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "If you want to decorate the pie with sugared cranberries, start them the night before because they need to sit for several hours.\u00a0 Place cranberries in a large heatproof bowl. Set aside. In a medium saucepan set over medium heat, bring the water and 3/4 cup (150g) of sugar to a simmer, whisking until the sugar has dissolved. Remove the pan from heat and allow to cool for 5 minutes. Pour the sugar syrup over the cranberries and stir. Cover the bowl and set aside for 15 minutes. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone baking mat. Using a slotted spoon, transfer the cranberries from the sugar syrup and place them on the prepared baking sheet. Allow to dry, uncovered, for 1 hour. Pour remaining 1/2 cup (100g) sugar into a large bowl. Toss the cranberries in the sugar, coating them all the way around. Place on a parchment paper- or silicone baking mat-lined baking sheet and let them dry uncovered for at least 1 hour at room temperature or in the refrigerator. Cover tightly and store in the refrigerator for up to 3 days. For more uses, see how to make sugared cranberries.", "name": "If garnishing with sugared cranberries, make those first:\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/the-great-pumpkin-pie-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make the pie crust through step 5 according to my directions and video tutorial in my pie crust recipe. Or use your favorite pie dough or store-bought.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/the-great-pumpkin-pie-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 375\u00b0F (190\u00b0C).", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/the-great-pumpkin-pie-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove 1 disc of pie dough from the refrigerator. On a lightly floured work surface, roll the dough out into a 12-inch circle. Make sure to turn the dough about a quarter turn after every few rolls. Carefully place the dough into a 9&#215;2-inch deep dish pie dish (this is the one I use; it is 1.75-inches deep). Tuck it in with your fingers, making sure it&#8217;s tightly pressed into the pie dish. Fold any dough overhang back into the dish to form a thick rim around the edges. Crimp the edges with a fork or flute the edges with your fingers. Review my how to crimp and flute pie crust tutorial if you need extra help with this step. Brush edges lightly with egg wash mixture.", "name": "Roll out the chilled pie crust:\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/the-great-pumpkin-pie-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Line the pie crust with parchment paper. Crunching up the parchment paper is helpful so that you can easily shape it into the crust. Fill with pie weights or dried beans. (Note that you will need at least 2 standard sets of pie weights to fit.) Make sure the weights/beans are evenly distributed around the pie dish. Par-bake the crust for 10 minutes. Carefully remove the parchment paper/pie weights. Prick the bottom of the crust all over with a fork to create steam vents and return crust (without weights) to the oven for 7-8 more minutes or until the bottom is *just* starting to brown. (Review this how to par-bake pie crust page if you need extra help with this par-baking step.)", "name": "Par-bake the crust", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/the-great-pumpkin-pie-recipe/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the pumpkin, 3 eggs, and brown sugar together until combined. Vigorously whisk until everything is combined.", "name": "Make the pumpkin pie filling", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/the-great-pumpkin-pie-recipe/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour pumpkin pie filling into the warm crust. Only fill the crust about 3/4 of the way up. (If using a deep dish pie dish as instructed, you should only have a little filling leftover. Use extra to make mini pies with leftover pie dough scraps if you&#8217;d like.) Bake the pie until the center is almost set, about 55-60 minutes give or take. A small part of the center will be wobbly\u2014that&#8217;s ok. After 25 minutes of baking, be sure to cover the edges of the crust with aluminum foil or use a pie crust shield to prevent the edges from getting too brown. Check for doneness at minute 50, and then 55, and then 60, etc.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/the-great-pumpkin-pie-recipe/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once done, transfer the pie to a wire rack and allow to cool completely for at least 3 hours before garnishing and serving.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/the-great-pumpkin-pie-recipe/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Decorate with sugared cranberries and pie crust leaves (see note). Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/christmas-cookie-sparkles/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter and cream cheese together on high speed until relatively smooth, about 2 minutes. Add the granulated sugar and beat until combined and creamy. Add the egg, vanilla extract, and almond extract and beat on high speed until combined, about 1 minute. Set aside. In a medium bowl or in the bowl of your stand mixer, mash the bananas. Then whisk in the eggs, oil, maple syrup, milk, and vanilla together until combined. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients, stir a few times, then add the nuts. Fold everything together gently just until combined and no flour pockets remain.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/whole-wheat-banana-nut-muffins/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Spoon the batter into liners, filling them all the way to the top. Top with oats and a light sprinkle of coconut sugar, if desired. Bake for 5 minutes at 425 then, keeping the muffins in the oven, reduce the oven temperature to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Bake for an additional 15-16 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. The total time these muffins take in the oven is about 20-21 minutes, give or take. (For mini muffins, bake 11-13 minutes at 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C) the whole time.) The filling holds its shape and the crust is buttery and flaky!", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "peach crumble pie, peach crumble", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/peach-crumble-pie-recipe-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/peach-crumble-pie-recipe-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/peach-crumble-pie-recipe-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/peach-crumble-pie-recipe.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/brown-sugar-peach-crumble-pie/", "recipeIngredient": ["Homemade pie crust\u00a0(recipe makes 2 crusts; you can halve the crust recipe\u00a0or freeze the 2nd half)", "7 cups (around 1225g) peeled chopped peaches, cut into 1-inch chunks", "1/2 cup (100g) packed light or dark brown sugar", "1/2 cup (63g) all-purpose flour OR 1/4 cup instant tapioca*", "2 teaspoons fresh lemon juice", "1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon", "1/2 cup (100g) packed light or dark brown sugar", "1 teaspoon ground cinnamon", "3/4 cup (94g) all-purpose flour\u00a0(spooned &amp; leveled)", "5 Tablespoons (71g) unsalted butter, melted and slightly cooled", "optional:\u00a01/2 cup (63g) chopped walnuts"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Prepare my pie crust recipe through step 5.", "name": "The crust", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/brown-sugar-peach-crumble-pie/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl, stir\u00a0the peach\u00a0chunks, brown sugar, flour, lemon juice, and cinnamon\u00a0together until thoroughly combined. Set filling aside as the oven preheats.", "name": "Make the filling", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/brown-sugar-peach-crumble-pie/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to\u00a0400\u00b0F (204\u00b0C).", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/brown-sugar-peach-crumble-pie/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "On a floured work surface, roll out one of the discs of chilled dough (if you made the entire pie dough recipe, you can freeze the other half of the dough at this time). Turn the dough about a quarter turn after every few rolls until you have a circle 12 inches in diameter. Carefully place the dough into a 9-inch pie dish. Tuck it in with your fingers, making sure it is smooth. Spoon the peach filling into the crust, leaving any liquid behind in the bowl\u2014you don&#8217;t want all that in the pie. Use a small paring knife to trim excess dough off the edges. Crimp or flute the pie crust edges.", "name": "Roll out the chilled pie dough", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/brown-sugar-peach-crumble-pie/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a medium bowl, combine the brown sugar, cinnamon, and flour. Stir in the butter and walnuts. The crumble topping will be thick and crumbly. Sprinkle over peaches.", "name": "Make the crumble topping:\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/brown-sugar-peach-crumble-pie/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the pie onto a large baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes. Keeping the pie in the oven, turn the temperature down to 375\u00b0F (190\u00b0C) and bake for an additional 30-35 minutes or until peach juices are bubbling on the sides and the top is lightly browned. After the first 20 minutes of bake time, I place a pie crust shield on top of the pie to prevent the edges from browning too quickly.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/brown-sugar-peach-crumble-pie/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Allow the pie to cool for 3\u00a0full hours at room temperature before serving. This time allows the filling to thicken up; I actually place it in the refrigerator during this time so the filling is super sturdy. Serve with vanilla ice cream if desired. Cover pie leftovers tightly and store\u00a0in the refrigerator for up to 5 days.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/brown-sugar-peach-crumble-pie/#instruction-step-7"}], "prepTime": "PT3H", "cookTime": "PT55M", "totalTime": "PT7H", "recipeYield": ["1", "1 9-inch pie"], "recipeCategory": "Pie", "cookingMethod": "Baking", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "65", "ratingValue": "4.8"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Peter"}, "datePublished": "2024-07-06", "reviewBody": "Loved the recipe. Hints for those who want to fix soggy crust without blind baking: First use a metal pie pan. Second, put a baking sheet in the oven while you are heating it; bake the pie into the oven on top of the heated baking sheet. You should find that your bottom crust comes out delightfully crispy."}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Toni"}, "datePublished": "2024-07-08", "reviewBody": "I made this for a Pie Fundraiser at my church and it received rave reviews! Add the confectioners\u2019 sugar, vanilla extract, and a pinch of salt. Beat on low speed for 30 seconds, then increase to high speed and beat for 3 minutes until completely combined and creamy. Add more confectioners\u2019 sugar if frosting is too thin, a little milk if frosting is too thick, or an extra pinch of salt if frosting is too sweet. Frosting should be soft, but not runny.", "name": "Make the frosting:\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/hummingbird-cake/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "First, using a large serrated knife or cake leveler, layer off the tops of the cakes to create a flat surface. The recipe is slightly adapted from King Arthur Baking Company The Essential Cookie Companion cookbook.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "peanut butter chocolate half moon cookies", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/12/peanut-chocolate-half-moons-2-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/12/peanut-chocolate-half-moons-2-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/12/peanut-chocolate-half-moons-2-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/12/peanut-chocolate-half-moons-2.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/peanut-butter-chocolate-half-moon-cookies/", "recipeIngredient": ["1/2 cup (8 Tbsp; 113g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "1 cup (213g) packed light or dark brown sugar", "1/4 teaspoon salt", "1 teaspoon vanilla extract", "1/2 teaspoon baking soda", "1 large egg, at room temperature", "1/2 cup (135g) peanut butter, creamy or chunky*", "1 cup (120g) unbleached all-purpose flour", "1 cup (170g) peanuts, peanut butter chips, butterscotch chips, or chocolate chips, or a combination*", "two\u00a04-ounce\u00a0semi-sweet\u00a0or\u00a0bittersweet chocolate bars\u00a0(226g\u00a0total), chopped (about 1 and\u00a01/2 cups)*", "2 Tablespoons (28g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "2 Tablespoons (40g) light corn syrup", "optional garnish: flaky sea salt or finely chopped peanuts"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large mixing bowl using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, cream together the butter, brown sugar, salt, vanilla, and baking soda on medium-high speed. (Here\u2019s a helpful tutorial if you need guidance on\u00a0how to cream butter and sugar.) Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl and beat again as needed to combine. Add the egg and beat until light and fluffy. Add the peanut butter, beating until well blended. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl and beat again as needed to combine. Beat in the flour and peanuts/chips on low speed until the dough is cohesive. Dough will be soft and creamy.", "name": "Make the cookies", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/peanut-butter-chocolate-half-moon-cookies/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover cookie dough and chill in the refrigerator for 1 hour and up to 3 days before baking. If chilling for longer than 2 hours, allow the dough to sit at room temperature for at least 20-30 minutes before baking.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/peanut-butter-chocolate-half-moon-cookies/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Towards the end of chill time, preheat oven to 375\u00b0F (191\u00b0C). Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/peanut-butter-chocolate-half-moon-cookies/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Drop the dough by the Tablespoonful onto the prepared baking sheets. Bake the cookies for 9-10 minutes or until very lightly browned around the edges. Cookies will appear very soft, but will become chewy and slightly crispy as they cool. Remove from the oven and allow cookies to cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/peanut-butter-chocolate-half-moon-cookies/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a double boiler, melt the chocolate and butter together stirring constantly over low heat. OR microwave in a medium heat-proof bowl in 20 second increments, stirring after each until completely melted. Stirring is essential as the butter/chocolate may separate otherwise. Once smooth, remove from heat and stir in the corn syrup. Dip half of each cooled cookie into the chocolate (to make a half-moon effect) and, if desired, lightly sprinkle crushed peanuts or flaky sea salt on the chocolate. Return the cookies to the cooling rack to set, about 1-2 hours. Feel free to place cookies in the refrigerator to speed up the setting time.", "name": "Make the icing", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/peanut-butter-chocolate-half-moon-cookies/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Dipped cookies stay fresh covered at room temperature for up to 2 days or in the refrigerator for up to 1 week.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/peanut-butter-chocolate-half-moon-cookies/#instruction-step-10"}], "prepTime": "PT1H20M", "cookTime": "PT10M", "totalTime": "PT3H30M", "recipeYield": ["30", "30 cookies"], "recipeCategory": "Cookies", "cookingMethod": "Baking", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "23", "ratingValue": "4.5"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "4"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Meg"}, "datePublished": "2022-01-27", "reviewBody": "These were a hit with my family. My chocolate was too thick though. It was more of a scoop than a dip. No one else noticed (or cared) but I'm curious as to why that happened. The only difference was that I substituted organic blue agave for the corn syrup. I will definitely make these again even if I never solve the thickness problem. Whisk constantly until the butter has melted and everything is smooth and combined. Set aside. Pour the chocolate batter into the sheet pan.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-sheet-cake-with-creamy-peanut-butter-frosting/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for 15-20 minutes. (Mine takes exactly 17 minutes.) Use a toothpick to test for doneness: stick it into the cake. If the toothpick comes out clean, the cake is done. If not, continue baking. Remove cake from the oven and set the pan on a wire rack. Allow the cake to cool completely in the pan before frosting. The refrigerator helps speed things up, if you have room for the large pan!", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-sheet-cake-with-creamy-peanut-butter-frosting/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment, beat softened butter and peanut butter together on medium-high speed for 2 minutes until completely smooth and creamy. Add the confectioners&#8217; sugar, cream, vanilla extract, and salt. Beat on low speed for about 20 seconds, then gradually increase to high speed. Beat on high for 1 minute until combined and frosting is fluffy. Taste; add more salt if needed. To thicken, add more confectioners&#8217; sugar and to thin, add more cream.
