It looks like a lot of ingredients but the filling and topping ingredients are mostly the same. Read the recipe before starting so you're prepared for the rolling and twisting step.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "cinnamon, bread, cinnamon crunch bread", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/02/cinnamon-crunch-bread-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/02/cinnamon-crunch-bread-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/02/cinnamon-crunch-bread-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/02/cinnamon-crunch-bread.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cinnamon-crunch-bread/", "recipeIngredient": ["1/2 cup\u00a0(120ml)\u00a0buttermilk, warmed to about 110\u00b0F", "1/3 cup\u00a0(80ml)\u00a0water, warmed to about 110\u00b0F", "2 and 1/4 teaspoons (7g)\u00a0instant\u00a0or\u00a0active dry yeast\u00a0(1 standard packet)", "1/4 cup (50g) granulated sugar, divided", "5 Tablespoons\u00a0(71g)\u00a0unsalted butter, melted + slightly cooled", "1\u00a0large\u00a0egg, at room temperature", "1 teaspoon\u00a0salt", "3 cups\u00a0(390g)\u00a0bread flour\u00a0(spooned &amp; leveled), plus more as needed for hands/work surface", "3 Tablespoons (43g)\u00a0unsalted butter, extra soft", "1/3 cup (67g) packed light or dark brown sugar", "1 and 1/2 teaspoons ground cinnamon", "2 Tablespoons (28g)\u00a0unsalted butter, melted", "1/3 cup (67g) packed light or dark brown sugar", "1 and 1/2 teaspoons ground cinnamon", "2 teaspoons all-purpose flour or bread flour"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the warm buttermilk, warm water, yeast, and 2 Tablespoons sugar together in the bowl of your stand mixer fitted with a dough hook or paddle attachment. Cover and allow to sit for 5 minutes or until foamy on top.", "name": "Prepare the dough", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cinnamon-crunch-bread/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the remaining sugar, the butter, egg, salt, and 1 cup flour. Beat on low speed for 30 seconds, scrape down the sides of the bowl with a silicone spatula, then add the remaining flour. Beat on low speed until the dough comes together and pulls away from the sides of the bowl, about 2 minutes. *If you do not own a mixer, you can mix this dough with a large wooden spoon or silicone spatula. It will take a bit of arm muscle.*", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cinnamon-crunch-bread/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "\u00a0Keep the dough in the mixer (and switch to the dough hook if using the paddle) and beat for an additional 5 full minutes, or knead by hand on a lightly floured surface for 5 full minutes. (If you\u2019re new to bread-baking, my How to Knead Dough video tutorial can help here.) If the dough becomes too sticky during the kneading process, sprinkle 1 teaspoon of flour at a time on the dough or on the work surface/in the bowl to make a soft, slightly tacky dough. Do not add more flour than you need because you do not want a dry dough. After kneading, the dough should still feel a little soft. Poke it with your finger\u2014if it slowly bounces back, your dough is ready to rise. You can also do a \u201cwindowpane test\u201d to see if your dough has been kneaded long enough: tear off a small (roughly golfball-size) piece of dough and gently stretch it out until it\u2019s thin enough for light to pass through it. Hold it up to a window or light. Does light pass through the stretched dough without the dough tearing first? If so, your dough has been kneaded long enough and is ready to rise. If not, keep kneading until it passes the windowpane test.", "name": "Knead the dough", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cinnamon-crunch-bread/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Lightly grease a large bowl with oil or nonstick spray. Place the dough in the bowl, turning it to coat all sides in the oil. Cover the bowl with aluminum foil, plastic wrap, or a clean kitchen towel. Allow the dough to rise in a relatively warm environment for 1.5-2 hours or until double in size. (I always let it rise on the counter. Takes about 2 hours. For a tiny reduction in rise time, see my answer to Where Should Dough Rise?\u00a0in my\u00a0Baking with Yeast Guide.)", "name": "1st Rise", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cinnamon-crunch-bread/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Grease a 9\u00d75-inch loaf pan.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cinnamon-crunch-bread/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Punch down the dough to release the air. Place dough on a lightly floured work surface and with a floured rolling pin, roll the dough out into a 9\u00d715 inch rectangle (approximately).", "name": "Roll out the dough", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cinnamon-crunch-bread/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Spread softened butter all over the top of the dough, leaving a 1/2 inch border uncovered. The softer the butter is, the easier it is to spread in this step. (Microwave it for a few seconds to soften if needed.) Mix the brown sugar and cinnamon together, then sprinkle evenly all over the butter.", "name": "For the filling", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cinnamon-crunch-bread/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "If you need a visual, watch the video to see exactly how I do this step. Tightly roll the dough into a 15-inch log. Place the log on its seam. Using a sharp knife, cut the log in half lengthwise. I find a serrated knife works best. Criss-cross one half on top of the other half\u2014forming an X. Tightly twist the two together. Pinch the outer edges to seal as best you can. Place in prepared loaf pan and cover with aluminum foil, plastic wrap, or a clean kitchen towel. (This step can get a little messy!) Allow the covered loaf to rest for 30 minutes. It will slightly rise during this time.", "name": "Roll and twist the dough", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cinnamon-crunch-bread/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Adjust the oven rack to the lower third position. Place a baking sheet on the lower rack to catch any cinnamon/sugar that may drip down. Preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C).", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cinnamon-crunch-bread/#instruction-step-9"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the melted butter, brown sugar, cinnamon, and flour together. Spoon over loaf right before baking.", "name": "For the cinnamon crunch topping", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cinnamon-crunch-bread/#instruction-step-10"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake until golden brown and, when gently tapped, the top of the loaf sounds hollow, about 45-55 minutes. The top browns quickly as it bakes, so tent the entire loaf with aluminum foil. (I usually place foil on top after about 20 minutes.) Remove finished bread the oven and place on a wire rack. Cool for 10 minutes in the pan, then remove from the pan and cool loaf on the wire rack.", "name": "Bake", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cinnamon-crunch-bread/#instruction-step-11"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Slice and serve warm or at room temperature. Covered in a simple lemon cream cheese frosting, these rolls use my quick sweet roll dough\u2014only 1 rise.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "lemon sweet rolls", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/03/sweet-lemon-rolls-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/03/sweet-lemon-rolls-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/03/sweet-lemon-rolls-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/03/sweet-lemon-rolls.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/lemon-sweet-rolls/", "recipeIngredient": ["2 and 3/4 cups (344g) all-purpose flour (spooned &amp; leveled)", "1/4 cup (50g) granulated sugar", "1/2 teaspoon salt", "1 teaspoon lemon zest", "3/4 cup (180ml) whole milk", "3 Tablespoons (43g) unsalted butter", "2 and 1/4 teaspoons Platinum Yeast from Red Star or any instant yeast (1 standard packet)", "1 large egg, at room temperature", "1/4 cup (4 Tbsp; 56g) unsalted butter, extra softened", "3/4 cup (150g) granulated sugar", "1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract (or vanilla bean paste)", "1 Tablespoon lemon zest (packed Tablespoon, it&#8217;s a lot of zest!)", "4 ounces (113g) full-fat brick cream cheese, softened to room temperature", "1 Tablespoon (14g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "3/4 cup (90g) confectioners&#8217; sugar", "2 Tablespoons (30ml) lemon juice", "optional: extra lemon zest for garnish"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the flour, sugar, salt, and lemon zest together in a large bowl. Set aside.", "name": "Make the dough", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/lemon-sweet-rolls/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Combine the milk and butter together in a heatproof bowl. Microwave or use the stove and heat until the butter has melted and the mixture is warm to the touch (about 110\u00b0F/43\u00b0C, no higher). Whisk in the yeast until it has dissolved. Pour mixture into the dry ingredients, add the egg, and stir with a sturdy silicone spatula or wooden spoon, OR use a stand mixer with a paddle attachment on medium speed. Mix until a soft dough forms.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/lemon-sweet-rolls/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Transfer dough to a lightly floured surface. Using floured hands, knead the dough for 3\u20135 minutes. You should have a smooth ball of dough. If the dough is super soft or sticky, you can add a little more flour. Place in a lightly greased bowl (I use nonstick spray), cover loosely, and let the dough rest for about 10 minutes as you get the filling ingredients ready.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/lemon-sweet-rolls/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "After 10 minutes, roll the dough out in a 14&#215;8-inch (36x20cm) rectangle. Spread the softened butter on top. Mix together the sugar, vanilla, and lemon zest. Sprinkle it all over the dough. Roll up the dough to make a 14-inch log. Cut into 10\u201312 even rolls and arrange in a lightly greased 9- or 10-inch round cake pan, pie dish, or square baking pan.", "name": "Fill the rolls:\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/lemon-sweet-rolls/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover the pan with aluminum foil, plastic wrap, or a clean kitchen towel. Allow the rolls to rise in a relatively warm environment for 60\u201390 minutes or until double in size. (For a tiny reduction in rise time, see my answer to Where Should Dough Rise?\u00a0in my\u00a0Baking With Yeast Guide.)", "name": "Rise", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/lemon-sweet-rolls/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "After the rolls have nearly doubled in size, preheat the oven to 375\u00b0F (190\u00b0C). Bake for 24\u201325 minutes, or until lightly browned. If you notice the tops are getting too brown too quickly, loosely tent the pan with aluminum foil and continue baking. If you want to be precise about their doneness, the rolls&#8217; internal temperature taken with an instant-read thermometer should be around 195\u2013200\u00b0F (91\u201393\u00b0C) when done. Remove pan from the oven and place pan on a wire rack as you make the icing. (You can also make the icing as the rolls bake.)", "name": "Bake the rolls", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/lemon-sweet-rolls/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a medium bowl using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle or whisk attachment, beat the cream cheese on high speed until smooth and creamy. Add the butter and beat until smooth and combined, then beat in the confectioners\u2019 sugar and lemon juice until combined. Using a knife or icing spatula, spread the icing over the warm rolls and serve immediately. (Light-colored helps you determine when the butter begins browning.) Stir or whisk the butter constantly as it melts. Once melted, the butter will begin to foam. Keep stirring. After 5\u20138 minutes, the butter will begin browning\u2014you&#8217;ll notice lightly browned specks begin to form at the bottom of the pan and it will have a nutty aroma. As soon as the butter has browned, immediately remove from heat and pour it into a heat-safe glass bowl or liquid measuring cup. Be sure to scrape out all the browned solids at the bottom of the skillet and include them as well. Transfer 3 Tbsp (43g) of the browned butter to a small bowl and reserve for the icing in step 7. The rest will go into the blondie batter in step 5. Because of moisture lost during the browning process, you will now have less butter than you started with\u2014this is expected. Allow brown butter to slightly cool while you continue.\u00a0", "name": "Brown the butter for the blondies and the icing", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/brown-butter-apple-blondies/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Meanwhile, return the pan to the stove. (No need to rinse out!) Add the apples, maple syrup/brown sugar, and cinnamon. Stir and cook over medium heat until apples have slightly softened, about 3\u20135 minutes. Set apples aside.", "name": "Prepare the apples", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/brown-butter-apple-blondies/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until combined. Fold in the apples. Batter will be thick.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/brown-butter-apple-blondies/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Spread batter evenly into the prepared pan. Bake for about 35 minutes or until the top is lightly browned and a toothpick comes out *mostly* clean. Remove from the oven and allow the blondies to cool completely in the pan set on a cooling rack.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/brown-butter-apple-blondies/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "If the brown butter you set aside for the icing has solidified, warm it in the microwave for a few seconds to melt it back into liquid, then whisk together with the confectioners&#8217; sugar, milk, vanilla extract, and salt. If needed, add more confectioners&#8217; sugar to thicken, or more milk to thin out. Thanks for a great recipe."}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "4"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Karen M."}, "datePublished": "2025-10-25", "reviewBody": "I have made these twice now this week. An important note: do not substitute salted butter. I frequently substitute salted butter when I don\u2019t have unsalted in the house. In a cookie recipe it works great; in this recipe it was absolutely wrong. The salt prevents the butter from browning properly. Basically I\u2019m saying, follow the recipe. The result is beautiful and delicious. Oh, I ran out of powdered sugar the second time, so the icing only had a cup of confectioners sugar, 3 T brown butter and 2 T milk (vanilla and salt). It was just enough to glaze the blondies. Excellent!"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Kristina"}, "datePublished": "2025-10-30", "reviewBody": "I make these every fall and I look forward to them all year! Mix in egg and vanilla extract. Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl as needed.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/salted-caramel-pecan-chocolate-chip-cookies/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a separate bowl, combine flour, cornstarch, baking soda and salt. On low speed, slowly mix into the wet ingredients until combined. The cookie dough will be thick. Add the chocolate chips and pecans, then mix until evenly distributed. Cover dough tightly with aluminum foil or plastic wrap and chill for at least 1 hour and up to 3-4 days. Chilling is mandatory for this cookie dough so the cookies don&#8217;t over-spread.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/salted-caramel-pecan-chocolate-chip-cookies/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove cookie dough from the refrigerator and allow to sit at room temperature for 10 minutes. (Always recommended\u00a0for cookies.)\u00a0Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/salted-caramel-pecan-chocolate-chip-cookies/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "The cookie dough will be slightly crumbly, but will come together as you roll into individual balls with your hands. Roll balls of dough, about 1.5 Tablespoons of dough each (a medium cookie scoop is helpful), and arrange 3 inches apart on the prepared baking sheets. Press a few pieces of caramel onto the tops of the cookies and sprinkle each with sea salt.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/salted-caramel-pecan-chocolate-chip-cookies/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for 11-12 minutes, until barely golden brown around the edges. Use your hands to make sure everything is combined, if needed.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/healthy-peanut-butter-chunk-oatmeal-bars/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once dough is completely combined, press it lightly into the prepared baking dish. For best success, review recipe notes before starting and don't skip chilling the cookie dough.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "dark chocolate pecan cookies", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/brown-butter-dark-chocolate-pecan-cookies-2-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/brown-butter-dark-chocolate-pecan-cookies-2-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/brown-butter-dark-chocolate-pecan-cookies-2-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/brown-butter-dark-chocolate-pecan-cookies-2.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/dark-chocolate-pecan-cookies/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 cup (16 Tbsp; 226g)\u00a0unsalted butter", "1 cup\u00a0(200g) packed light or dark\u00a0brown sugar", "1/2 cup\u00a0(100g)\u00a0granulated sugar", "2\u00a0large\u00a0eggs, at room temperature", "2 teaspoons\u00a0pure vanilla extract", "2\u00a0and 1/2 cups (313g)\u00a0all-purpose flour\u00a0(spooned &amp; leveled)", "1 teaspoon\u00a0baking soda", "1 teaspoon ground cinnamon", "1/2 teaspoon\u00a0salt", "two 4-ounce\u00a0semi-sweet or bittersweet chocolate bars (226g total), chopped (about 1 and 1/2 cups)*", "1 cup (130g) roughly chopped pecans*"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Set out a medium heat-proof bowl because you\u2019ll need it at the end of this step. Slice the butter into Tablespoon-size pieces and place in a light-colored skillet or large pot. Light colored helps you determine when the butter begins browning. (See note if using a dark skillet or pot.) Melt the butter over medium heat and stir or whisk constantly. Once melted, the butter will begin to foam. Keep stirring/whisking. After 5-7 minutes, the butter will begin browning and you\u2019ll notice lightly browned specks begin to form at the bottom of the pan. It will have a nutty aroma. Once browned, remove from heat immediately and pour into the bowl, including any solids that have formed on the bottom of the pan. (You want those solids for flavor.) Cool brown butter for 5 minutes. Don&#8217;t cool longer than that because the butter will begin to thicken and, as a result, the cookie dough will be difficult to mix and its texture will be very crumbly.", "name": "Brown the butter", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/dark-chocolate-pecan-cookies/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the brown sugar and granulated sugar into the brown butter and then whisk in the eggs and vanilla extract. Set aside. In a large bowl, whisk the flour, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt together. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients, add the chopped chocolate and pecans, then stir together with a large spoon or rubber spatula. Dough will be greasy, thick, and even slightly crumbly.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/dark-chocolate-pecan-cookies/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover cookie dough and chill in the refrigerator for 2 hours and up to 3 days before baking. (You can also freeze the dough balls, see Freezing Instructions below.) If chilling for longer than 2 hours, allow the dough to sit at room temperature for at least 20-30 minutes before rolling and baking in the next step. The cookie dough is quite firm otherwise.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/dark-chocolate-pecan-cookies/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Towards the end of chill time, preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Line large baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone baking mats. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/dark-chocolate-pecan-cookies/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Roll or scoop the dough into balls, 1.5 Tablespoons of dough each. I recommend a\u00a0medium cookie scoop. Place 3 inches apart on the baking sheets and bake for 13-14 minutes or until the edges appear set. Baked, not fried-- and you don't need a mixer!", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "maple glazed donuts", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/09/baked-maple-glazed-donuts-2-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/09/baked-maple-glazed-donuts-2-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/09/baked-maple-glazed-donuts-2-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/09/baked-maple-glazed-donuts-2.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/maple-glazed-donuts/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 cup (125g) all-purpose flour (spooned &amp; leveled)", "1 teaspoon baking powder", "1/4 teaspoon baking soda", "1 teaspoon ground cinnamon", "1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg", "1/8 teaspoon ground cloves", "1/4 teaspoon salt", "2 Tablespoons (28g) unsalted butter, melted and slightly cooled", "1 large egg, at room temperature", "1/3 cup (65g) packed light brown sugar", "1/4 cup (60ml) milk, at room temperature", "1/4 cup (60g) yogurt or sour cream, at room temperature", "1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract", "2 Tablespoons (28g) unsalted butter", "1/3 cup (80ml) pure maple syrup", "1 cup (112g) sifted confectioners&#8217; sugar", "1/4 teaspoon maple extract (optional, but recommended)", "pinch of salt, to taste"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Spray donut pan with non-stick spray. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/maple-glazed-donuts/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, and salt together in a large bowl. Set aside. Whisk the melted butter, egg, brown sugar, milk, yogurt, and vanilla together until completely combined. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and whisk until just combined. Do not overmix. The batter will be thick.", "name": "Make the donuts", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/maple-glazed-donuts/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Spoon the batter into the donut cavities\u2014I highly recommend using a large zipped-top bag for ease. Cut a corner off the bottom of the bag and pipe the batter into each donut cup, filling about halfway. (If you only have 1 donut pan that bakes less than 8 donuts, keep the remaining batter in the bowl at room temperature until you can bake the next batch.)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/maple-glazed-donuts/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for 10-11 minutes or until the edges and tops are lightly browned. Gently poke a donut with your finger. If it bounces back, the donuts are done. Allow donuts to cool for a few minutes in the pan, then transfer to a wire rack set on a large piece of parchment paper. Bake the remaining donut batter and once baked, transfer to the wire rack.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/maple-glazed-donuts/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a small saucepan over low heat, melt the butter and maple syrup together, whisking occasionally. Once the butter has melted, remove from heat and whisk in the sifted confectioners\u2019 sugar and maple extract. Taste. Add a pinch of salt if desired. Cool for 2-3 minutes, then dip each donut into the icing. The icing quickly thickens, so feel free to place it back over heat as you dip. Place dipped donuts back onto cooling rack as excess icing drips down. Feel free to double dip them (I usually do!).", "name": "Make the icing", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/maple-glazed-donuts/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Donuts are best served immediately. My donut pans are for six donuts. One is Nordic Ware\u2014one of the best bakeware manufacturers, the other from Target. They are not unusual sizes. They\u2019re are all in multiple of six. The recipes online usually made a dozen. Although I made only two donuts in my second pan, it seems to be a waste when I could have made a dozen donuts. The mixture should be thick, pale, and form ribbons when you lift the beater(s). Do not stir it\u2014we don&#8217;t want to deflate it. Spoon 1 Tablespoon of batter into the center of each scalloped well. No need to spread it to the edges. Just plop it in the center. (Cover and refrigerate remaining batter if you do not have 2 madeleine pans to bake the batter all at once.)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-peppermint-madeleines/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for 3 minutes at 425\u00b0F; then, without opening the oven, reduce the temperature to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C) and bake for 6-7 more minutes. To test for doneness, lightly press on the top of a madeleine. If it springs back, they&#8217;re done. If your finger leaves an indent, let them bake for another minute and then test again.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-peppermint-madeleines/#instruction-step-9"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cool the madeleines in the pan for 5 minutes, and then invert the pan onto the cooling rack. (Or you can use a\u00a0double boiler.)\u00a0Dip the tops of the cooled madeleines in the melted chocolate and place them on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/vanilla-bean-shamrock-cookies/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl using a handheld or a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter and sugar together on high speed, about 3 minutes. (Here\u2019s a helpful tutorial if you need guidance on\u00a0how to cream butter and sugar.) Add the vanilla bean seeds and beat again until combined and butter is creamy, about 1-2 more minutes. Add the egg and vanilla extract and beat on high speed until combined, about 1 minute. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl and beat again as needed to combine.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/vanilla-bean-shamrock-cookies/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and beat on low speed until combined. Dough will be a bit soft. If the dough seems too soft and sticky for rolling, add 1 more Tablespoon of flour.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/vanilla-bean-shamrock-cookies/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Divide the dough into 2 equal portions. Place each portion on a piece of lightly floured parchment paper or a lightly floured silicone baking mat. With a lightly floured rolling pin, roll the dough out to about 1/4-inch thickness. Use more flour if the dough seems too sticky. The rolled-out dough can be any shape, as long as it is evenly 1/4-inch thick.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/vanilla-bean-shamrock-cookies/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Lightly dust one of the rolled-out doughs with flour. Place a piece of parchment on top. (This prevents sticking.) Place the 2nd rolled-out dough on top. Cover with plastic wrap or aluminum foil and then refrigerate for at least 1-2 hours and up to 2 days.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/vanilla-bean-shamrock-cookies/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once chilled, preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Line 2-3 large baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone baking mats. Carefully remove the top dough piece from the refrigerator. If it&#8217;s sticking to the bottom, run your hand under it to help remove it. Using a cookie cutter, cut the dough into shapes. Re-roll the remaining dough and continue cutting until all is used. Repeat with 2nd piece of dough. (Note: It doesn&#8217;t seem like a lot of dough, but you get a lot of cookies from the dough scraps you re-roll.)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/vanilla-bean-shamrock-cookies/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Arrange cookies on baking sheets 3 inches apart. Bake for 11-12 minutes or until lightly browned around the edges. If your oven has hot spots, rotate the baking sheet halfway through bake time. Allow cookies to cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes and then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely before decorating.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/vanilla-bean-shamrock-cookies/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "With a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter and vanilla bean seeds together on medium speed until butter is creamy, about 2 minutes. Add confectioners\u2019 sugar, heavy cream, and vanilla extract. Beat on low speed for 30 seconds and then increase to medium-high speed and beat for 2 full minutes. Taste. Add a pinch of salt if frosting is too sweet. To color the frosting, divide the frosting between 2-3 bowls (or however many colors of frosting you want). Stir in 1-2 tiny drops of gel food coloring (or more, depending on your desired color).", "name": "Make the buttercream frosting", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/vanilla-bean-shamrock-cookies/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "You can decorate the cookies with a knife, icing spatula, or use a piping bag and piping tip. Top with sprinkles, if desired. In the pictured cookies, I filled a piping bag with spoonfuls of both green and uncolored frosting and used Ateco 30 piping tip. Pipe hearts as the 3 leaves and a line as the stem.", "name": "Frost the cooled cookies", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/vanilla-bean-shamrock-cookies/#instruction-step-9"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Frosting does not harden or crust very much, though you could gently stack 1 frosted cookie on top of another, but expect some slight squishing. Store frosted cookies covered at room temperature for up to 1 day or in the refrigerator for up to 1 week. Slice the butter into pieces and place in a light-colored skillet. The light colored helps you determine when the butter begins browning. Melt the butter over medium heat and stir or whisk constantly. Once melted, the butter will begin to foam. Keep stirring/whisking. After 5-7 minutes, the butter will begin browning and you&#8217;ll notice lightly browned specks begin to form at the bottom of the pan, which are the milk solids toasting. Cook until it is golden in color. Once browned, remove from heat immediately and pour into dish. Cover tightly, place in the refrigerator, and chill until solid, about 2-3 hours (or up to 1 day). A large flat dish, as opposed to a bowl, helps the butter solidify quicker.", "name": "Brown the butter", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/brown-butter-chocolate-chip-cookies/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove solid brown butter from the refrigerator and spoon into a large bowl (or the bowl of your stand mixer). Using a handheld mixer or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the chilled brown butter for 1 minute on medium speed until completely smooth and creamy. Add the granulated sugar and brown sugar and beat on medium high speed until light in color and combined, about 2 minutes. Beat in egg, egg yolk, and vanilla extract on high speed. Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl as needed.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/brown-butter-chocolate-chip-cookies/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a separate bowl,\u00a0whisk the\u00a0flour, cornstarch, baking soda and salt together until combined. On low speed, slowly mix into the wet ingredients until combined, then beat in the milk on medium speed. The cookie dough will be thick. Add the chocolate chips and\u00a0mix on low for about 5-10 seconds until combined. Cover dough tightly with aluminum foil or plastic wrap and chill for at least 2-3 hours and up to 3 days. Chilling is mandatory for this cookie dough or else the cookies will over-spread.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/brown-butter-chocolate-chip-cookies/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove cookie dough from the refrigerator and allow to sit at room temperature for 10 minutes as you preheat the oven. This makes the cookie dough easier to scoop and roll. (If the cookie dough chilled longer than 3 hours, let it sit at room temperature for about 30 minutes.)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/brown-butter-chocolate-chip-cookies/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Line two large baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone baking mats. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/brown-butter-chocolate-chip-cookies/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once chilled, the dough may be slightly crumbly, but will come together if you work the dough with your hands as you roll into individual balls. Scoop and roll dough, about 1.5 Tablespoons of dough each (I use this medium cookie scoop), into balls.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/brown-butter-chocolate-chip-cookies/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake the cookies for 12-14 minutes, or until slightly golden brown around the edges. My oven has hot spots and yours may too so be sure to rotate the pan once during bake time. The baked cookies will look soft in the centers when you remove them from the oven. Allow to cool for 5 minutes on the cookie sheet. If the cookies are too puffy, try gently pressing down on them with the back of a spoon. During this time, you can press a few extra chocolate chips into the top of the warm cookies. This is just for looks! The cookies will slightly deflate as you let them cool.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/brown-butter-chocolate-chip-cookies/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "After 5 minutes, transfer cookies to a cooling rack to cool completely.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/brown-butter-chocolate-chip-cookies/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cookies stay fresh covered at room temperature for up to 1 week.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/brown-butter-chocolate-chip-cookies/#instruction-step-9"}], "prepTime": "PT7H", "cookTime": "PT12M", "totalTime": "PT8H", "recipeYield": ["24", "24 cookies"], "recipeCategory": "Cookies", "cookingMethod": "Baking", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "63", "ratingValue": "4.8"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Michelle"}, "datePublished": "2025-06-24", "reviewBody": "Making this again for the second time! You&#8217;ll need hot water to pour into the baking sheet for the water bath.)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/creme-brulee/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Heat the heavy cream, espresso powder, and salt together in a medium saucepan over medium heat. As soon as it begins to simmer, remove from heat. Stir in the vanilla extract. Remove about 1/2 cup of warm heavy cream and, in a slow and steady stream, whisk into the egg yolks. Keep those egg yolks moving so they don&#8217;t scramble. In a slow and steady stream, pour and whisk the egg yolk mixture into the warm heavy cream.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/creme-brulee/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place ramekins in a large baking pan. If you don&#8217;t have 1 pan large enough, bake them in a couple pans. Divide custard between each ramekin, filling to the top. Carefully fill the pan with about a 1/2 inch of the hot water. The baking pan will be hot so use an oven mitt to carefully transfer the pan to the oven.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/creme-brulee/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake until the edges are set and centers are a little jiggly. The time depends on the depth of your ramekins. My ramekins are 1-inch and the custard takes 35 minutes. Begin checking them at 30 minutes. For a more accurate sign, they&#8217;re done when an instant read thermometer registers\u00a0170\u00b0F (77\u00b0C).", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/creme-brulee/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove pan from the oven and, using an oven mitt, remove the ramekins from the pan. Add the peanut butter and vanilla, then mix on high until combined.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/white-chocolate-peanut-butter-cookies/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and mix on low until combined. With the mixer running on low speed, add the white chocolate chips.\u00a0Dough will be thick and soft.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/white-chocolate-peanut-butter-cookies/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Chill the dough for 1 hour\u00a0in the refrigerator (and up to 2-3 days). If chilling for longer than a few hours, though, allow to sit at room temperature for at least\u00a030\u00a0minutes before rolling and baking because the dough will be quite hard and the cookies may not spread that much.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/white-chocolate-peanut-butter-cookies/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Place 8 balls onto the cookie sheets. Gently press down on each ball to *slightly* flatten.\u00a0Bake each batch for 14-15\u00a0minutes until lightly browned on the sides. The centers will look very soft.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/white-chocolate-peanut-butter-cookies/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove from the oven. Scrape down the sides and the bottom of the bowl as needed.\u00a0Switch the mixer to medium speed and beat in the sugar until combined.\u00a0Beat in the egg and vanilla extract, scraping down the sides and bottom of the bowl as needed. Add the mashed banana and yogurt and turn the mixer on high and beat until creamy, about 1 minute. Turn the mixer off and pour the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients.\u00a0Turn the mixer on low and slowly beat until combined. Do not overmix.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/banana-chocolate-chip-crumb-cake/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make the streusel by combining all of the streusel ingredients into a small bowl. Layer half of the batter into the prepared baking pan. Top with half of the streusel. Repeat with the rest of the batter and streusel. Bake for 40\u201350 minutes, covering the cake with aluminum foil after 25 minutes to prevent the edges from browning too quickly. Bake until the center is baked through; mine took 45 minutes exactly. If you aren&#8217;t topping the cake with ganache, halve the ganache recipe so you&#8217;re only making what you need for the swirl. (Use one 4 ounce chocolate bar and 1/2 cup (120ml) heavy cream.)", "name": "Preliminary Note", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-marble-banana-bundt-cake/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place chopped chocolate in a medium heat-proof bowl. Heat the cream in a small saucepan over medium heat until it begins to gently simmer. (Do not let it come to a rapid boil\u2013 that\u2019s too hot!) Pour over chocolate, then let it sit for 2-3 minutes to gently soften the chocolate. Very slowly stir until completely combined and chocolate has melted. The finer you chopped the chocolate, the quicker it will melt with the cream. You should have about 1 and 1/2 cups of ganache. Set half aside (3/4 cup or 180ml) at room temperature uncovered until it has thickened into a gravy-like consistency, about 30 minutes. Use this in step 7. Cover and refrigerate the rest of the ganache to use as the topping in step 10. Ganache topping can be refrigerated for up to 5 days before using.", "name": "Make the ganache:\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-marble-banana-bundt-cake/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C) and generously grease a 10-inch Bundt pan. Our favorite pans include this one and this one.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-marble-banana-bundt-cake/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Mash the bananas until there&#8217;s hardly any lumps. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-marble-banana-bundt-cake/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter on high speed until smooth and creamy, about 1 minute. Add both sugars and beat on high speed for 2 minutes until creamed together. (Here\u2019s a helpful tutorial if you need guidance on\u00a0how to cream butter and sugar.) Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a silicone spatula as needed. Add the eggs and the vanilla. Beat on medium-high speed until combined, then beat in the mashed bananas. Mixture will be chunky and appear curdled\u2014that&#8217;s ok. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl as needed. With the mixer on low speed, add the dry ingredients in three additions alternating with the buttermilk and mixing each addition just until incorporated. Do not over-mix. The batter will be thick with some lumps. Makes about 6 cups of batter.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-marble-banana-bundt-cake/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "You will use the slightly thickened ganache reserved for the swirl in this step. Pour about 1/3 of the cake batter (about 2 cups) evenly into prepared pan. Drizzle half of the ganache on top (about 6 Tablespoons). Swirl with a knife or toothpick. Evenly pour another 1/3 of the cake batter on top, followed by the rest of the ganache (about 6 Tablespoons), then the rest of the cake batter. Swirl everything together with a knife or toothpick. See photo above for a visual.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-marble-banana-bundt-cake/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for 60-75 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the cake comes out clean with just a couple lightly moist crumbs. This is a large, heavy cake so don\u2019t be alarmed if it takes a little longer in your oven. You can melt the chocolate in a double boiler or the microwave. If using the microwave: place the chocolate in a medium heat-proof bowl. I like to use a liquid measuring cup. Its depth makes it easier for dipping. Melt in 30 second increments in the microwave, stirring after each increment until completely melted and smooth. Let the warm chocolate sit for 5 minutes to slightly cool before dipping.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/dark-chocolate-coconut-rum-truffles/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove chilled mixture\u00a0from the refrigerator. Add the granulated sugar and brown sugar and beat on medium high speed until fluffy and light in color. Beat in eggs, vanilla, and vanilla bean seeds on high speed. Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl as needed.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/salted-vanilla-toffee-cookies/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a separate bowl,\u00a0whisk the\u00a0flour, cornstarch, baking soda and salt together until combined. On low speed, slowly mix into the wet ingredients until combined. The cookie dough will be quite thick. Add the toffee bits, mix on low for about 5-10 seconds until evenly disbursed. Cover dough tightly with aluminum foil or plastic wrap and chill for at least 3 hours and up to 3 days. Chilling is mandatory for this cookie dough.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/salted-vanilla-toffee-cookies/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove cookie dough from the refrigerator and allow to sit at room temperature for 20 minutes\u2014if the cookie dough chilled longer than 3 hours, let it sit at room temperature for about 30 minutes. This makes the cookie dough easier to scoop and roll.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/salted-vanilla-toffee-cookies/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Line two large baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone baking mats. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/salted-vanilla-toffee-cookies/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once chilled, the dough might\u00a0be slightly crumbly, but will come together if you work the dough with your hands as you roll into individual balls. Scoop and roll balls of dough, about 1 Tablespoon of dough each, into balls. Sprinkle with sea salt.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/salted-vanilla-toffee-cookies/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake the cookies for 10 minutes (11 minutes for crispier cookies), until slightly golden brown around the edges. My oven has hot spots and yours may too, so be sure to rotate the pan once during bake time. The baked cookies will look extremely soft in the centers when you remove them from the oven. Allow to cool for 5 minutes on the cookie sheet. If the cookies are too puffy, try gently pressing down on them with the back of a spoon. They will slightly deflate as you let them cool. Transfer to cooling rack to cool completely. Sprinkle with additional sea salt if desired.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/salted-vanilla-toffee-cookies/#instruction-step-6"}], "prepTime": "PT3H35M", "cookTime": "PT10M", "totalTime": "PT4H", "recipeYield": ["30", "30 cookies"], "recipeCategory": "Cookies", "cookingMethod": "Baking", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "16", "ratingValue": "4.1"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Areeba Raza"}, "datePublished": "2019-12-22", "reviewBody": "Read a lot of comments of the cookie spreading thin and not being chewy or tasting too buttery so I was skeptic at first when I tried the recipe. I agree the dough spread in the oven but the cookie was still amazing in taste and it was still as chewy as you\u2019d expect it to be. For people getting crunchy cookies, bake them for less time or put the dough in the freezer. I\u2019d say salt is a must, not an optional as the cookie is sweet and needs a balance of salt. Sour cream helps guarantee a soft and moist muffin that has a denser texture than chocolate cupcakes.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "double chocolate muffins", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/03/double-chocolate-chip-muffins-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/03/double-chocolate-chip-muffins-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/03/double-chocolate-chip-muffins-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/03/double-chocolate-chip-muffins.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/double-chocolate-muffins/", "recipeIngredient": ["2 cups (250g) all-purpose flour (spooned &amp; leveled)", "1 cup (200g) granulated sugar", "1/2 cup (41g) unsweetened natural cocoa powder", "1 teaspoon baking soda", "1/2 teaspoon salt", "1 and 3/4 cups (315g) semi-sweet chocolate chips", "2 large eggs, at room temperature", "3/4 cup (185g) full fat sour cream or plain yogurt, at room temperature", "1/2 cup (120ml) vegetable oil*", "1/2 cup (120ml) whole milk, at room temperature", "1 and 1/2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 425\u00b0F (218\u00b0C). Spray a 12-count muffin pan with nonstick spray or use cupcake liners. This recipe yields about 14 muffins, so prepare a second muffin pan in the same manner or bake in batches and reserve leftover batter at room temperature for when the first batch is done.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/double-chocolate-muffins/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking soda, salt, and chocolate chips together in a large bowl. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/double-chocolate-muffins/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the eggs, sour cream, oil, milk, and vanilla extract together until combined. Pour wet ingredients into dry ingredients and fold together with a silicone spatula or wooden spoon until completely combined. (Batter is quite thick, so I recommend a spatula or spoon over a whisk.) Avoid overmixing. The batter will be thick and sticky.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/double-chocolate-muffins/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Spoon the batter into liners, filling them all the way to the top. Bake for 5 minutes at 425\u00b0F then, keeping the muffins in the oven, reduce the oven temperature to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Bake for an additional 15-16 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. The total time these muffins take in the oven is about 20-21 minutes, give or take. (For mini muffins, bake 13-14 total minutes at 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C) the whole time.)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/double-chocolate-muffins/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cool muffins for 10 minutes in the pan, then transfer to a wire rack until ready to eat.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/double-chocolate-muffins/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover leftover muffins and store at room temperature for 5 days or in the refrigerator for 1 week.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/double-chocolate-muffins/#instruction-step-6"}], "prepTime": "PT10M", "cookTime": "PT21M", "totalTime": "PT40M", "recipeYield": ["12", "12-14 muffins"], "recipeCategory": "Breakfast", "cookingMethod": "Baking", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "412", "ratingValue": "4.8"}, "video": {"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "VideoObject", "name": "Double Chocolate Chip Muffins | Sally's Baking Addiction", "description": "These double chocolate muffins are incredibly rich, mega chocolate-y, and loaded with chocolate chips in every single bite.\n\nGet the full recipe: https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/double-chocolate-muffins/\n\n\u2022 Ask your recipe question or leave a review over on the recipe page.\n\n#baking #recipes #doublechocolatechipmuffins\n\n\u2022 More of our favorite recipes: https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/ul6POlSNMw8?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ul6POlSNMw8", "thumbnailUrl": ["https://i.ytimg.com/vi/ul6POlSNMw8/hqdefault.jpg"], "uploadDate": "2021-05-05T15:39:12+00:00"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Karen Samuel"}, "datePublished": "2025-11-01", "reviewBody": "So moist and absolutely delicious. Make sure you have a bottom oven rack and a center oven rack in place for step 5. Grease an 8-inch round cake pan, line with parchment paper rounds, then grease the parchment paper. Parchment paper helps the cakes seamlessly release from the pans. (If it&#8217;s helpful, see this parchment paper rounds for cakes video &amp; post.) The cake WILL stick unless it&#8217;s lined and generously greased. (Trust me!)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/flourless-chocolate-cake-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cut the butter into pieces so it melts evenly. Place in a large heat-proof bowl. Add chopped chocolate. Melt in 20 second increments in the microwave, stirring after each increment until completely melted and smooth. Let cool for 2-3 minutes. You can use a double boiler for this step if desired.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/flourless-chocolate-cake-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the sugar, espresso powder, and vanilla extract into the chocolate mixture. Whisk in the cocoa powder, salt, and baking powder (if using).", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/flourless-chocolate-cake-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour and spread batter into prepared cake pan.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/flourless-chocolate-cake-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place a large metal roasting pan or baking dish on the bottom oven rack. Do not use glass. Pour boiling water about 2 inches up the sides of the pan. (I just boil a kettle of water.) Quickly place the cake on the center rack and shut the oven door, trapping steam inside. The steamy oven helps guarantee an extra moist cake.", "name": "Prepare the steamy oven:\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/flourless-chocolate-cake-recipe/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for 30 minutes until the edges are set. The cake is done when a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean OR comes out with just a few moist crumbs. It&#8217;s important to not over-bake this cake, which dries it out. Begin checking it at 25 minutes. Don&#8217;t be alarmed if the cake rises extra tall around some of the edges and slightly cracks\u2014this is normal (it&#8217;s the eggs expanding) and will flatten out as it cools.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/flourless-chocolate-cake-recipe/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove from the oven, place cake on a cooling rack, and cool for only 10 minutes in the cake pan. Run a sharp knife around the edges to help release the warm cake, then quickly invert it onto a serving plate or cake stand. (If it cools completely in the pan, it&#8217;s very difficult to release from the pan.) Cake will be a little crumbly on the edges. Cool completely. I usually stick it in the refrigerator for 1-2 hours.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/flourless-chocolate-cake-recipe/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once the cake is cool, top with your choice of toppings. Cool down for a few minutes. Using a hand mixer or a stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment, whip the heavy cream, sugar, cocoa powder, and espresso mixture on medium-high speed until medium peaks form, about 3-4 minutes. Medium peaks are between soft/loose peaks and stiff peaks and are the perfect consistency for topping and piping on desserts. Serve cake with whipped cream or pipe it on top. I used Ateco 849 piping tip. Decorate with raspberries and a dusting of confectioners&#8217; sugar, if desired.", "name": "Mocha Whipped Cream", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/flourless-chocolate-cake-recipe/#instruction-step-9"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover and store leftover cake in the refrigerator for up to 5 days.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/flourless-chocolate-cake-recipe/#instruction-step-10"}], "prepTime": "PT15M", "cookTime": "PT30M", "totalTime": "PT3H", "recipeYield": ["8", "serves 8"], "recipeCategory": "Dessert", "cookingMethod": "Baking", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "190", "ratingValue": "4.8"}, "video": {"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "VideoObject", "name": "Flourless Chocolate Cake | Sally's Baking Recipes", "description": "This dark, rich, and deliciously moist flourless chocolate cake is naturally gluten free. You will need 4 and 1/2 large lemons total.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "lemon poppy seed bundt cake, lemon bundt cake", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/Glazed-Lemon-Poppy-Seed-Bundt-Cake-2-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/Glazed-Lemon-Poppy-Seed-Bundt-Cake-2-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/Glazed-Lemon-Poppy-Seed-Bundt-Cake-2-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/Glazed-Lemon-Poppy-Seed-Bundt-Cake-2.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/glazed-lemon-poppy-seed-bundt-cake/", "recipeIngredient": ["2 and 3/4 cups (344g) all-purpose flour* (spooned &amp; leveled)", "1/4 cup (30g) cornstarch*", "1 teaspoon salt", "1 teaspoon baking powder", "1/2 teaspoon baking soda", "1/4 cup poppy seeds", "1 cup (16 Tbsp; 226g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "1 and 3/4 cups (350g) granulated sugar", "4 large eggs, room temperature", "2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract", "zest of 3 large lemons (about 1/4 cup, packed)", "juice of 2 large lemons (about 1/2 cup)", "1 cup (240ml) buttermilk, room temperature", "1/2 cup (100g) granulated sugar", "juice of 2 large lemons (about 1/2 cup)", "1 cup (120g) sifted confectioners&#8217; sugar", "juice of 1/2 large lemon (or 1 medium, or 2 Tablespoons)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Lower the oven rack to the lower third position and preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Spray the inside of a 10-inch Bundt pan with nonstick spray or grease thoroughly with butter. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/glazed-lemon-poppy-seed-bundt-cake/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "\u00a0Sift the flour and cornstarch together into a large bowl. Whisk in the salt, baking powder, baking soda, and poppy seeds. Set aside.", "name": "Make\u00a0the cake", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/glazed-lemon-poppy-seed-bundt-cake/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter on high speed until smooth and creamy\u2014about 1 minute. Add the sugar and beat on high speed for 2 minutes until creamed together fairly well. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a silicone spatula as needed. Add the eggs and the vanilla. Beat on medium-high speed until combined. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a silicone spatula as needed. Beat in the lemon zest and lemon juice. With the mixer on low speed, add the dry ingredients in three additions alternating with the buttermilk, beginning and ending with the dry ingredients, and mixing each addition just until incorporated. Do not overmix. The batter will be slightly thick.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/glazed-lemon-poppy-seed-bundt-cake/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour/spoon the batter evenly into the Bundt pan. Bake for 40-50 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the cake comes out clean. Cover the cake loosely with aluminum foil if you begin to see the top browning quickly. Once done, remove from the oven and allow to cool for 10 minutes inside the pan.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/glazed-lemon-poppy-seed-bundt-cake/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Combine the granulated sugar and lemon juice in a small saucepan over medium heat. They're prepared on my simple graham cracker crust and will absolutely be your new favorite dessert!", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "lemon blueberry cheesecake bars", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/08/lemon-blueberry-cheesecake-bars-1-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/08/lemon-blueberry-cheesecake-bars-1-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/08/lemon-blueberry-cheesecake-bars-1-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/08/lemon-blueberry-cheesecake-bars-1.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/lemon-blueberry-cheesecake-bars/", "recipeIngredient": ["12 full-sheet graham crackers (to yield 1 and 1/2 cups (180g) graham cracker crumbs)", "6 Tablespoons (85g) unsalted butter, melted", "1/4 cup (50g) granulated sugar", "16 ounces (452g) full-fat brick cream cheese, softened to room temperature", "1 large egg", "6 Tablespoons (75g) granulated sugar", "1 teaspoon lemon zest", "3 Tablespoons (45ml) lemon juice", "1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract", "1 and 1/2 cups (210g) fresh or frozen blueberries (do not thaw)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Line a 9-inch square baking pan with parchment paper with enough overhang on the sides to easily lift the chilled bars out as a whole. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/lemon-blueberry-cheesecake-bars/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "\u00a0If you\u2019re starting out with full graham crackers, use a\u00a0food processor or blender to grind them into fine crumbs. You can also place them in a zip-top bag and crush them into fine crumbs with a little arm muscle and a rolling pin. Stir the graham cracker crumbs and granulated sugar together in a medium bowl, and then stir in the melted butter. The mixture will be thick, coarse, and sandy. Try to smash/break up any large chunks. Press into the bottom of the lined pan.", "name": "Make the crust", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/lemon-blueberry-cheesecake-bars/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake the crust for 8 minutes. Cool for a few minutes as you prepare the filling in the next step.", "name": "Prebake crust", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/lemon-blueberry-cheesecake-bars/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the cream cheese for 1 minute on medium speed until smooth. On medium speed, beat in the egg, sugar, lemon zest, lemon juice, and vanilla extract together until smooth and creamy, about 3 full minutes. Gently fold in the blueberries. Add the sugar and beat on high speed for 2-3 minutes until creamed together fairly well. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a rubber spatula as needed. Add two egg yolks and the vanilla. Beat on medium-high speed until combined. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a rubber spatula as needed. With the mixer on low speed, add the dry ingredients in three additions alternating with the whole milk, beginning and ending with the dry ingredients, and mixing each addition just until incorporated. Do not over-mix. Fold whipped egg whites into cupcake batter. The batter will be smooth, velvety, and slightly thick.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/moist-yellow-cupcakes-with-milk-chocolate-frosting/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Spoon batter into cupcake liners filling halfway full. I recommend using homemade pesto!", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "pesto shrimp", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/creamy-pesto-shrimp-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/creamy-pesto-shrimp-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/creamy-pesto-shrimp-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/creamy-pesto-shrimp.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/creamy-pesto-shrimp/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 Tablespoon (14g) unsalted butter", "2-3 cloves garlic, minced*", "2/3 cup (160ml) half-and-half, divided*", "1 lb medium or large uncooked shrimp, peeled &amp; deveined*", "1 cup (about 150g) halved cherry tomatoes*", "1 Tablespoon (15ml) fresh lemon juice", "1/2 cup (about 40g) parmesan cheese, freshly shredded*", "1 cup (240ml) store-bought or homemade pesto", "optional: fresh basil and extra parmesan cheese"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large skillet over medium heat, melt the butter. Add the minced garlic and 1/3 cup (80ml) half-and-half. Stir to combine, then bring the half-and-half to a simmer. Once simmering, add the shrimp. Cook for 1 minute, then add the halved cherry tomatoes. Stir and cook until shrimp is nearly cooked through, just about pink on both sides. Stir in the remaining half-and-half, the lemon juice, and parmesan cheese. Cook for 1 minute. (Shrimp should be fully cooked by this point. If not, keep cooking until it&#8217;s pink.)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/creamy-pesto-shrimp/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove from heat, then immediately stir in the pesto while everything is still hot. The recipe was also a great excuse to pull out one of my containers of pesto made this past summer. I cooked up one cup of dry pearled couscous to serve with it. However, I cook very lean for my husband who has a heart stent. For this reason, instead of butter I used plant-based margarine, instead of half and half I used 2% milk, and I used grated parmesan instead of shredded parmesan.  The grated parmesan helped to thicken the sauce. In addition, when I dumped the cooked couscous into the recipe I included the starch water with it, thickening it further. It came out so good that I texted my husband and asked him to stop for a baguette on the way home. This rich, tasty, thick and creamy meal is a keeper. I also feel there\u2019s no need for an entire cup of pesto. Since I was out of my own homemade pesto, I used some from a jar, and it was fine. Spray a 9\u00d75 inch loaf pan with nonstick spray.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/ice-cream-loaf-cake/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the cake flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together in a large bowl. In a medium bowl, whisk the melted and slightly cooled butter, egg, granulated sugar, sour cream, milk, and vanilla together until combined. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients, then whisk to completely combine. Avoid over-mixing. Fold in the sprinkles.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/ice-cream-loaf-cake/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour the batter into prepared loaf pan.\u00a0Bake loaf cake for 50 minutes to 1 hour, covering loosely with foil about halfway through to prevent the top from over-browning. Poke the center of the cake with a toothpick. If it comes out clean, the cake is done. Oven times will vary between ovens. My cake usually takes 55 minutes. Cool completely in the pan set on a wire rack.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/ice-cream-loaf-cake/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "The video tutorial above is a helpful visual for the next few steps. Carefully remove cooled cake from loaf pan. (You will use the loaf pan again in the next step.) Place on a cutting board and using a very sharp or serrated knife, slowly slice horizontally into 3 even layers. As shown in the video above, I usually stand the loaf upright on one end and cut it down vertically. Feel free to use a ruler for precision. A cake leveler isn&#8217;t very helpful because this is a denser cake.", "name": "Slice cake into layers", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/ice-cream-loaf-cake/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove ice cream from freezer. Let it soften for 15 minutes or microwave it for about 20-30 seconds.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/ice-cream-loaf-cake/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Line loaf pan with parchment paper or plastic wrap with enough overhang on the sides to lift the ice cream loaf cake out of the pan after freezing. Place bottom loaf cake layer into lined pan. Slowly and carefully spread 1 pint of softened ice cream in an even layer on top. Top with center loaf cake layer. Slowly and carefully spread 2nd pint of ice cream evenly on top. Place top loaf cake layer on top, pressing it down gently so it really sticks to the ice cream beneath it. Cover assembled loaf cake with aluminum foil or plastic wrap and freeze for at least 8 hours and up to 3 days. (If freezing for longer than 1 day, let it sit for 10 minutes at room temperature before pouring ganache on top in step 9.)", "name": "Assemble &amp; freeze cake", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/ice-cream-loaf-cake/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place chopped chocolate in a medium heat-proof bowl. Heat the cream in a small saucepan over medium heat until it begins to gently simmer. (Do not let it come to a rapid boil\u2013 that\u2019s too hot!) Pour over chocolate, then let it sit for 2-3 minutes to gently soften the chocolate. With a metal spoon or small silicone spatula, very slowly stir until completely combined and chocolate has melted. The finer you chopped the chocolate, the quicker it will melt with the cream. Set aside for 10 minutes to thicken as you complete the next step.", "name": "With about 15 minutes left in freezing time, make the ganache topping", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/ice-cream-loaf-cake/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove loaf cake from the freezer and using the parchment overhang on the sides, carefully lift it out of the loaf pan. Parchment may tear, but do your best to remove the whole cake. Use a knife to loosen it from the pan if needed. Remove parchment from cake and place cake on a cutting board.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/ice-cream-loaf-cake/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour and spread ganache on top. Garnish with sprinkles if desired. Ganache will set quickly since the loaf is so cold. Let the cake sit for 3-5 minutes to slightly soften before slicing. (Slicing will be VERY hard to do otherwise!)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/ice-cream-loaf-cake/#instruction-step-9"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a very sharp or serrated knife, cut into slices about 3/4 inch thick. Cake will be hard since it&#8217;s frozen, but softens as the minutes go by. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/almond-crescent-cookies/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl using a handheld or a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter and sugar together on high speed until completely smooth and creamy, about 3 minutes. Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl as needed. (Here\u2019s a helpful tutorial if you need guidance on\u00a0how to cream butter and sugar.) Add the vanilla and almond extracts and beat on medium-high speed until combined. Add the flour, cornstarch, almonds, and salt. Beat on low speed until mostly combined, then turn the mixer up to medium-high speed and beat until the dough fully comes together. The dough will be super thick, to the point where you don&#8217;t think it will combine. Just keep mixing until it clumps together. If absolutely needed, beat in a couple drops of water to get it to come together.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/almond-crescent-cookies/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Scoop 1 Tablespoon (20g) of cookie dough and shape into a crescent moon. Refrigerate the shaped cookies for at least 30 minutes and up to 1 day.
