A rich lemon-hinted dough is beautifully swirled with a homemade blueberry jam filling, and topped with buttery lemon crumbles. Creamy lemon icing brings it all together, but is totally optional.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally McKenney", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "lemon blueberry babka", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/05/homemade-lemon-blueberry-babka-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/05/homemade-lemon-blueberry-babka-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/05/homemade-lemon-blueberry-babka-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/05/homemade-lemon-blueberry-babka.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/lemon-blueberry-babka/", "recipeIngredient": ["2/3 cup (160g/ml) whole milk, warmed to about 110\u00b0F (43\u00b0C)", "2\u00a0and 1/4 teaspoons (7g)\u00a0Platinum Yeast from Red Star\u00a0(1 standard packet)*", "6 Tablespoons (75g) granulated sugar, divided", "5 Tablespoons (71g) unsalted butter, sliced into 1 Tbsp-size pieces and softened to room temperature", "1 teaspoon lemon zest", "1 large egg, at room temperature", "1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract", "1/2 teaspoon salt", "2 and 3/4 (358g) bread flour or all-purpose flour (spooned &amp; leveled), plus more as needed", "1 and 1/4 cups (170\u2013180g) fresh blueberries (do NOT use frozen)", "6 Tablespoons (75g) granulated sugar", "1 teaspoon lemon juice", "3 Tablespoons (24g) bread flour or all-purpose flour", "3 Tablespoons (38g) packed light or dark brown sugar", "2 Tablespoons (28g) unsalted butter, cold and cubed", "1 egg white, beaten", "1 cup (120g) confectioners&#8217; sugar", "1 and 1/2 Tablespoons fresh lemon juice", "1 Tablespoon whole milk, heavy cream, or half-and-half"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the warm milk, yeast, and 1 Tablespoon of sugar together in the bowl of your stand mixer fitted with a dough hook or paddle attachment. Cover and allow to sit for 5 minutes, until foamy and frothy on top. *If you don&#8217;t have a stand mixer, mix the dough by hand using a silicone spatula or wooden spoon.*", "name": "Prepare the dough", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/lemon-blueberry-babka/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the remaining sugar, butter, lemon zest, egg, vanilla, salt, and 1 cup (130g) of bread flour. Beat on low speed for 30 seconds, scrape down the sides of the bowl with a silicone spatula, then add another 1 cup of flour. Beat on medium speed until relatively incorporated (there may still be chunks of butter). Scrape down the sides of the bowl with a silicone spatula. Add 1/2 cup of flour and beat on medium speed until the dough begins to come together. As the mixer runs, add another 2\u20134 Tablespoons of flour (up to 2 and 3/4 cups total) depending on how wet the dough looks. This should be a very soft and almost creamy-feeling dough. Do not add more flour than you need.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/lemon-blueberry-babka/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "\u00a0Keep the dough in the mixer (and switch to the dough hook if using the paddle) and beat on low speed for an additional 6\u20138 full minutes, or knead by hand on a lightly floured surface for 6\u20138 full minutes. (If you\u2019re new to bread-baking, my How to Knead Dough video tutorial can help here.) If the dough becomes too sticky during the kneading process, sprinkle 1 teaspoon of flour at a time on the dough or on the work surface/in the bowl to make a soft, slightly tacky dough. Do not add more flour than you need because you do not want a dry dough. After kneading, the dough should still feel a little soft. Poke it with your finger\u2014if it slowly bounces back, your dough is ready to rise.", "name": "Knead the dough", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/lemon-blueberry-babka/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Lightly grease a large bowl with nonstick spray or butter. Place the dough in the bowl, turning it to coat all sides. Cover the bowl tightly and allow the dough to rise in a relatively warm environment until nearly double in size, about 3\u20134 hours. This dough is rich with fat, so it takes longer than other doughs to rise. Do not be alarmed if it takes around 4 hours. (If desired, use my warm oven trick for rising. See my answer to Where Should Dough Rise?\u00a0in my\u00a0Baking with Yeast Guide.)", "name": "1st rise", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/lemon-blueberry-babka/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Combine blueberries, sugar, and lemon juice together in a small saucepan with tall sides over medium heat. Stir constantly with a wooden spoon or silicone spatula, pressing the blueberries against the sides of the pan (stand back in case they splatter!). Once the blueberries are mostly smashed and the sugar has dissolved, stop stirring and allow to come to a boil. Boil, stirring occasionally, until the mixture is slightly reduced, about 10 minutes. (If you have a candy or instant-read thermometer, the mixture should reach about 215\u2013220\u00b0F.) You should have about 1/2 cup (around 160g). Remove from heat and allow to cool completely. The filling will thicken as it cools. You can transfer it to a shallow heat-safe dish and place it in the refrigerator to cool down quicker. Set aside.", "name": "While the dough is rising, make the blueberry filling", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/lemon-blueberry-babka/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Grease a 9\u00d75-inch loaf pan with nonstick spray or butter.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/lemon-blueberry-babka/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "When the dough is ready, punch it down to release the air. Flour a work surface, your hands, and a rolling pin. Roll the dough out to a 9&#215;15-inch rectangle. *Note: Should it run over the sides of the dough, the blueberry filling can stain a work surface. If needed, transfer the rolled-out dough to a piece of parchment paper or silicone baking mat.* Gently spread the blueberry filling mixture on top, leaving a 1/2-inch border uncovered. Using floured hands, tightly roll up the dough to form a 15-inch-long log. Place the log on its seam. Fold in half, then twist it to form a figure 8. Pinch the ends together. Place in the prepared loaf pan. Visuals for this step:", "name": "Shape the dough", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/lemon-blueberry-babka/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Loosely cover the shaped babka. Allow to rise until it&#8217;s puffy and nearly reaches the top of the loaf pan, at least 1\u20131.5 hours.", "name": "2nd rise", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/lemon-blueberry-babka/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Mix the brown sugar and flour together in a small bowl. Add the cold butter and, using a pastry cutter, two forks, or your fingers, cut the butter into the brown sugar mixture until pea-size crumbles form. Refrigerate or freeze until ready to use. (Cold crumbles are best!)", "name": "Make the crumble topping", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/lemon-blueberry-babka/#instruction-step-9"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C).\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/lemon-blueberry-babka/#instruction-step-10"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Brush the surface of the babka with egg white. Using a toothpick, poke 10\u201312 holes all over the top of the loaf; this helps prevent an air bubble gap in the interior layers. Sprinkle with crumble topping. Visuals:", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/lemon-blueberry-babka/#instruction-step-11", "image": {"@type": "ImageObject", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/05/crumb-topping-on-lemon-blueberry-babka.jpg", "height": "843", "width": "1200"}}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for 50 minutes or until golden brown on top. The surface of the bread browns quickly, so I recommend loosely tenting the pan with aluminum foil around the 30-minute mark.\u00a0To ensure the bread is done at 50 minutes, give the warm bread a light tap. If it sounds hollow, it\u2019s done. For a more accurate test, the bread is done when an instant-read thermometer reads the center of the loaf as 195\u00b0F (90\u00b0C).", "name": "Bake", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/lemon-blueberry-babka/#instruction-step-12"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove from the oven and allow bread to cool in the pan for at least 30 minutes before icing (next step), slicing, and serving. A serrated knife is best for slicing.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/lemon-blueberry-babka/#instruction-step-13"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a medium bowl or liquid measuring cup, whisk together confectioners&#8217; sugar, lemon juice, and milk. Drizzle over the babka.", "name": "Make the lemon icing, if using", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/lemon-blueberry-babka/#instruction-step-14"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover leftover babka tightly and store at room temperature for 2 days or in the refrigerator for up to 1 week.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/lemon-blueberry-babka/#instruction-step-15"}], "prepTime": "PT5H", "cookTime": "PT50M", "totalTime": "PT6H20M", "recipeYield": ["1", "1 loaf"], "recipeCategory": "Bread", "cookingMethod": "Baking", "recipeCuisine": "Jewish", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "414", "ratingValue": "4.8"}, "video": {"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "VideoObject", "name": "Lemon Blueberry Babka | Sally's Baking", "description": "A summery take on a bakery-favorite bread, this lemon blueberry babka looks impressive but is completely doable in your home kitchen. Then half of the buttermilk. Gently stir\u2014about 5 stirs. Repeat with the remaining wet ingredients and buttermilk. Stir until *just* combined; do not overmix. Microwave in 30 second increments, stirring between each time. You may also melt the butter and chocolate over low heat on the stovetop. Stir until smooth and set aside to slightly cool.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/death-by-chocolate-cupcakes/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a medium sized bowl, toss the cocoa powder, flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt together until thoroughly combined. Set aside. In a large bowl, whisk the eggs, sugar, brown sugar, and vanilla together until smooth. Add the cooled butter/chocolate and whisk until smooth. Add half of the flour mixture, then half of the buttermilk. Repeat until everything is added. Stir until *just* combined; do not overmix. The batter will be very thick like pudding.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/death-by-chocolate-cupcakes/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Fill the cupcake liners 2/3 of the way full with batter. Set aside. With a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter on medium speed until creamy\u2014about 2 minutes. Gradually add the sifted sugar/cocoa powder alternately with the heavy cream and vanilla. Beat on low speed after each addition. Once all added, beat on high speed until creamy and combined for at least 2 minutes. Add a pinch of salt if frosting is too sweet.", "name": "For the frosting", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/death-by-chocolate-cupcakes/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Frost cooled cupcakes and top with chocolate chips as desired. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients. Gently whisk until *just* combined. Fold in the walnuts. Batter will be semi-thick.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/harvest-spice-bread/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Spread the batter into prepared loaf pan. The bread is done when a toothpick inserted in the center comes out *mostly* clean with zero raw batter. (Do not let it come to a rapid boil\u2014that&#8217;s too hot!) Pour over chocolate and let it sit for 2-3 minutes to gently soften the chocolate. Then stir until completely combined and chocolate has melted. Set aside for a few minutes to slightly cool down so as not to cook the eggs in the next step.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/dark-chocolate-bread-pudding/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the eggs, sugar, vanilla extract, and salt together in a large bowl. Pour in the chocolate cream mixture and whisk until smooth. Divide this chocolate custard mixture in half. Add the bread cubes and chocolate chips to one half and stir to evenly coat.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/dark-chocolate-bread-pudding/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Grease a 9&#215;13-inch (or similar size) baking pan. Spread the chocolate soaked bread evenly into the pan. Pour the remaining chocolate custard evenly over the top. If you have extra, dot a few chocolate chips on top too (this is for looks and extra chocolate taste). Cover tightly with aluminum foil and allow to sit at room temperature for at least 30 minutes so the bread has a chance to soak up some of the custard. This is crucial. You can also chill the unbaked bread pudding in the refrigerator for up to 1 day.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/dark-chocolate-bread-pudding/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C).", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/dark-chocolate-bread-pudding/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake the bread pudding for 45-50 minutes* until the edges appear set. Use a toothpick to test for doneness. It will come out with a few moist crumbs, but won&#8217;t be overly wet. *I bake it covered for the first 20-25 minutes, then remove the aluminum foil for the remaining time so it can slightly crisp on the top and around the edges.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/dark-chocolate-bread-pudding/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Garnish with toppings and serve warm.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/dark-chocolate-bread-pudding/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover leftovers tightly and store in the refrigerator for up to 4-5 days.
